Now there's another place we can call home in Tagaytay! From the amazing hospitality and culinary passions of Tita Medy, the Chef / Owner, and her Staff -- to the delicious food, Nanay Cirila's Kapeng Barako...will let you feel that every dish is humbly yet passionately made from home. 

It is very special because all the dishes are unique yet the deliciousness are all heartwarming ly familiar. 

We ordered the following:

Appetizer: Butter Shrimps
=Nicely done üëå Shrimps are indeed buttery soft, garlicky but subtle. Ain instant favorite. A must-try!

Beef: Bulalo
=One of the best I've tasted! Not a single bit of that oily or ma-sebo soup. They patiently remove the oily stuff so all you get is the tenderest beef and most flavorful broth. With fresh veggies too! Yum! Theirs is the only Bulalo we will eat from now on.

Pork: Grilled Liempo
=Another hit!  Soft and just the right balance of flavors/seasoning. And the "ihaw" taste is right. You know they grilled it using good firewood, (not with kerosene or plastic!). 

Fish: Crispy Daing na Bangus
=Fresh, well seasoned, crispy and no "gilik" taste. Just the way you want your bangus to be. 

Veggies: Fresh Lumpia Gulay
=Joy!!! Just JOY! The generous vegetables inside this Lumpia with it's peanuty sauce will make you smile! One order is not enough!

Dessert: Halo-Halo
=There's a special twist that i would like to share but you better discover this by yourself. The Ube Ice Cream is good, but the "twist" elevates it to an "Aha! That works fabulously!" experience.

Beverages: Hot Tarragon Herb Tea & Brewed Iced Tea with Calamansi
=Nothing artificial here. They are all natural, all fresh.

Truly a gem in Tagaytay! 

Do contact them and discover the flavors for yourselves! And a wonderful chat with Tita Medy makes everything heartwarming. I'm so happy to have met her and now call her a friend.

Special Info:
*Pre-booking and pre-ordering is required. Check their website for all your needed details (Menu, Address, etc.) Check also Google Maps and/or Waze for driving instructions.
And you're in for an amazing treat: a display of Harleys! Bring your cameras!

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: The best place to eat in tagaytay!
content:
we went to visit this fine establishment last sunday and we were blown away by the food. 

We ordered the Bulalo Lunch Set and it was more than enough for my family.

The bulalo meat was so tender and soft that the knife just went...through it like butter, very delicious.

The vegetable springrolls was so crisp and fresh, that the flavours just burst through with each bite.

Chef medi was so friendly and inviting that she rounded out the experience to perfect.

If your looking for a good place to eat and relax, look no further than Nanay Cirilas!

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: Traditional Comfort Food with a Twist
content: Very intimate and private. Good place to take visitors üòä the seafood platter is very yummy and fresh üëå

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: Our daughter's 1st Birthday
content:
We celebrated our daughter's 1st birthday at Nanay Cirilas last November 17, 2018 and it was an amazing experience with our family and friends. The place is so homey, the food is great , the staffs are very accomodating. Special thanks to Chef Medi for...all the preparation (from the decoration,charkart and the food). Thank you for allowing us to use your guest room for our babies.
Best to dine here with family and friends. I highly recommend this place. Looking forward to dine again.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Not available
content:
Want a Japanese beer? Not available. Want a sake? Not available. Want a milk tea? Not available. Want air conditioning? Not available. Want an avocado, mango or watermelon smoothie? Not available. 

Was honestly shocked they bothered opening today.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Nice place
content:
Not really impressed with the food.  
If you order the katsu curry mild they sweeten it way too much so it's not made fresh, just a spicy version they sweeten.  First time it came out the curry was cold, so they are just heating it...up and not even good at that.  Very Pricy too!   There are better places to eat at Twin Lakes.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Lunch
content: We enjoyed all the dishes.  The rainbow Maki was awesome as was the  salad, tempura, and ebi sushi. No disappointments at all which is always a bonus. Will be  returning  soon.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: WORST RESTAURANT EVER, DO NOT GO
content:
Waited for freaking 1 hour and 30 mins just to receive my chicken curry thats not even freaking hot or warm 
Doesnt even taste like good curry 
7% service charge for the worst service and said that they had "traffic sa kitchen" - you have...a lot of tables to offer and you cant serve them all? Wow lol 
Had a big freaking menu of what coffee they serve and they didnt even have coffee lol

Went there thinking itd be good because of their Trip Advisor reward in 2020 LOL SO QUESTIONABLE

-1000 /10 WILL NOT RECOMMEND
DO NOT GO EVER

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Nice Japanese Resto in Tagaytay
content:
Food was good. Pricewise and taste is excellent. Auzora Salad was a good  twist on your regular crabstick salad.
Chicken teriyaki was very tasty, shrimp tempura was good..only downside was the mix sashimi. It didn't taste well, the salmon i think was a different cut...of the fish as it was chewy. But the variety is ok..
Nice japanese restaurant when your in Tagaytay that's not overcrowded.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Good food but a bit pricey
content: They offer great food, although a little pricey. Courteous staff and good ambiance. Great location too.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Sad experience
content: Soggy and sad and made our family supper stressful. That‚Äôs how I will describe my experience in Aozora. I guess my expectations were set high since I‚Äôve been reading about the good reviews. The Aozora ramen is bulalo with noodles, nothing to be crazy about.Fod...is average. The wagyu steak is pricey but the way it‚Äôs cooked was mediocre- a waste of ingredients.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Dog food presentation; Flavor is not Japanese
content:
Aozora SVD Road WAS very good until recently.   Today was my third time.   Two months ago I already noticed the food quality and service was different.   I gave it another chance, and today was the third time.   The food was lousy, presentation was like dog...food, the staff were not attentive, the portion size was smaller, and it is not Japanese at all.   To top it all, they charged me the full amount of P1350 and just took out the service charge.    I was told that the former chef and staff were moved to their new branch at Twin Lakes.   I will never go back to this place.  
üòñüòñüò´üò©

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Aozora at The Farm
content:
The Farm Branch.
Slightly disappointing. The food was well presented but not so fresh as you would expect from Sashimi and Sushi. Perhaps it took too much time in the cooler. The Chawan Mushi didn't have the consistency of a steamed custard. It was overcooked...and almost like an omelette. The food took more than 35 minutes to be served.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Tasty food, pleasant experience
content: It's true when they say they are vegetarian friendly. The had good suggestions from the menu, and customized the sushi for our vegetarian preferences. Time from ordering to serving was very reasonable. The tempura was crisp and the sauces tasty. The one drawback was yakisoba...that was too salty. The green tea shake was really refreshing. and the house tea was really nice. The waiter was attentive and brought an extra citronella candle for us without being asked, when noticing the flies were getting too interested in our area. A wee bit noisy from weekend traffic at the nearby intersection, but not enough to mute the pleasant time. Cost of the meal was very reasonable.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Donburi !!
content: Great food.  Responsive, helpful, friendly wait staff.  Highly accommodating.  Wheel chair access.  Did I say friendly wait staff?

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Overrated, Unexceptional
content: We‚Äôve just came from Tagaytay and made a last minute visit to their branch in SVD Road for dinner. Unfortunately our food experience is not as we expected given the good reviews. Their food is so-so compared to their counterparts; especially their Maki, Aozora rice,...Teppanyaki and Sizzling Squid. Sadly, my daughters were not satisfied with their sodden Tempura, their Shoyu and Kakiage ramen were bland and the noodles disheartening. Furthermore, cleanliness/pest control is an issue given the saucers we‚Äôve asked contained live ants!!! Service was OK but overall we hope to have value for money as their prices are comparable to well known ramen houses in Manila.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Must Visit in Tagaytay
content: Good place for Japanese food in Tagaytay. Ambience is nice and food is good. My faves were the Aozora salad and the Rainbow Maki.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Not authentic Japanese food
content:
If you‚Äôve been to Japan and tasted authentic Japanese food, you will be sorely disappointed by Aozora. 

My family and I went all the way to Tagaytay just to try out Aozora which is currently listed as the 2nd best restaurant in Tagaytay! 

Unfortunately, it...did not meet our expeditions. The food was average thus feels overpriced.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Overpriced
content:
Positives: Ambiance and Service

The place looked nice and the servers were very accommodating.

Negatives: Everything else

We ordered Uni Sashimi, Spicy Salmon Maki, California Maki, Miso Ramen, and their grilled us beef (forgot the exact name)

Uni sashimi tasted bland and old. The vegetables...that came with it wasn't fresh as well. Both Makis were just meh. Could compare it to something bought in the frozen section of an SM grocery. Ramen wasn't hot, tasted like instant ramen, and not the good kind. Grilled beef was basically beef tapa. Wasn't hot at all; as the name would suggest it would have been grilled. Felt like I ate something that was cooked earlier and microwaved for my pleasure üôÑ

I honestly don't understand all the positive reviews this place has. Spend your hard earned money somewhere else. ‚úåÔ∏è

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: Satisfying
content:
Although it was raining when we went to the restaurant, the ambiance of the place is good.

Pros
+ Meat is tender as advertised
+ Delicious desserts
+ Good service ( Shout out to sir Alec)
+ Good place for late night catch up moments...Cons
- The potato wedges were overcooked.

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: Our favorite restaurant in Tagaytay
content:
We've been coming here since Firelake Grill opened in 2005. It's been part of our milestones -- family trips, birthdays, reunions, date nights and even just random dinners. When we just want comfort food, we're here. We've seen it evolve over the decades and coming...here is like visiting an old friend for us. 

The food is always a hit - Chef Paul knows good steak. But his non-meat options are also just as good when you need variety. 

Much has been said about the service and we experience it too, as servers come and go. Our longtime favorite waiter retired and was recently replaced by new faces. There is a learning curve on the service but we are forgiving and don't let it deter us from the experience. We're here to enjoy a good meal not stress over the servers.

We always order:
- Blackened Beef Salad
- Tuna Salad
- Truffle Mushroom Pasta
- Ribeye
- Prawns with Angel Hair Pasta
- Pineapple Carpaccio

So YES. Obviously we recommend, despite the hundreds of new restaurants in Tagaytay, we've kept coming back. If a restaurant could be a home, this would be ours. See you again soon, Chef Paul!

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: Not very good
content:
After a TripAdvisor search of best restos in tagatay we made a booking as website, menus and reviews looked great.  Maybe a down day as rib-eye poor and served with frozen mix veg!  Poorly
Trained waiters couldn‚Äôt serve our red wine properly and inattentive despite...only 3 tables. Won‚Äôt be back‚Ä¶.

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: Loved it!!
content: The food and staff were amazing!! The variety in the menu is impressive.  The lamb shank will melt in your mouth. Thank you!

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: 40th Birthday of my sister's boyfriend!
content:
April 29, 2023 ( saturday) at 5pm, we went here to have a simple dinner because it was the 40th birthday of my sister's boyfriend. Usually we go to breakfast at Antonio's.

First of all, the striploin is good. I just wish that the server...should know how to listen, it seems like he make things complicated and he made us feel we don't know how to order a steak (lol) this is very basic as far as i know. What is exactly ON THE SIDE or what esle do you want to add for your side dish. So we had this kind of a conversation about the side orders, the server keep on saying that there is already "INCLUSIVE" side dish, but all we wanted was to add, and i literally went to the point i don't want to talk anymore, and gave a signal to my sister, i'm done with this conversation because i'm hungry, we travel from pampanga to tagaytay. 

To the server, i hope you will able to read this. You know who you are, please try to improve your PR, i actually don't like when they say "FIRST IMPRESSIONS, LAST" but definitely, NEVER AGAIN. 

Thank you again for the experience üôÇ

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: Great food and service!
content: Reservation was a breeze and the staff were very attentive even when there were just two of them assisting our big group. Chef was also very friendly and talked to the group after we finished our meal. The food was great although it may have...taken some time for other bigger orders as they were understaffed. Overall a great experience!

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: Still Delightful After all these years!
content: We had Lamb Shank, Sea Bass and Penne Pasta w/ Mushrooms and truffle sauce.  The view, the service and the food was just a delight! Chef Paul has managed to keep the wonderful reputation this restaurant has had for 18 years top notch Bravo!

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: AMAZING SERVICE, LOCATION VIEW AND FOOD
content: Last night I dined at that wonderful restaurant, it was one of the best dining experiences globally I have had. It was a special, important occasion for me and I messaged the restaurant through their FB page to make a reservation and also to make...some special requests. I had instant replies, from the owner himself who was extremely professional friendly & helped with everything. From providing the most private table with the best view, to organising a lovely bunch of flowers, wrote my note by their staff in a nicely presented way and even helped me video the moment by their staff. In addition, I had used Grab (Uber of Asia) to get there from Manila, with no secure way to get back afterwards... one of the staff arranged a driver, his father, to take me, his mum &  Rhyel, the staff all came for the ride, now my new friends. Service was all incredible. The food was spectacular too,  . our waiter was 5 star. the whole experience was really faultless, no better was possible, highly recommend.

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: One lovely evening at FireLake Grill Tagaytay
content: The australian tenderloin steak was super worth it! It literally melts in your mouth and it was perfectly cooked just the way we liked it paired with some veggies and mashed potatoes. Super quality and good tasting steak. We also tried their truffle pasta and...grilled chicken along the dalandan juice ( highlight of the night) and ice tea. They also gave us bread before the meal which is refillable üíØ‚ù§Ô∏è Kudos to the lady who serve us, super thoughtful and goes beyond the usual service ü§ó will def come back with the family or friends ü•∞

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: A great view deserves great food.
content:
It has been a while since we visited Tagaytay. The pandemic really wrought havoc on our travel and date plans. Finally, on a weekend, we finally took the chance.

We found out about Fire Lake Grill thanks to Google. It was one of the top...search results. We were giddy to arrive.

The place was non-descript, nestled in the Cliffhouse Tagaytay. We almost drove past it. But the area was wide and we were able to park without much difficulty. Just a note: validate your parking ticket lest you want to pay gold for a few hours of parking.

We arrived and Kim, our server, welcomed us warmly and accosted us to our seats: right in front of us is a stunning view of Taal lake and volcano. Since we were famished, we started off with the Seared Tuna Salad Nicoise-style and Mushroom and Pumpkin Soups. The tuna was seated perfectly, with a nice blend of spices crusted around it. The Pumpkin soup was thick and creamy, bringing out the flavors even more.

The entr√©es were the stars of the show. A masterpiece of a TENDERloin, a juicy ribeye and a succulent lamb shank. Not to mention, a delectable saffron and herb risotto. The lamb and risotto was a perfect pair.

And to top it all off, the desserts. Tasty vanilla caramel cake and chocolate cakes flanking the signature Fire Lake dessert: pinapple carpaccio. Coconut ice cream in a pastry cup on a bed of paper-thin slices of pineapple. Eat it together and the flavors just burst in your mouth. I added the lime peel and it even gave a greater dimension to the taste.

Overall, it was a terrific experience at Fire Lake Grill. Great service. Great food. Great view.

To Chef Paul, The Brigade de Cuisine and the Service Staff, thank you!

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: Five stars in every way!
content: I was first here last May 2021 and went back January 1st 2022, our first dinner for this year. Me and my daughter enjoyed their mouth watering, delectable, super yummy steaks and side dishes. Pumpkin soup and mushroom soup are both oh so yummy as...well. Love it that Chef Paul spent time for a small chit chat amidst being busy at the restaurant. Their staff are all so friendly and attentive to their customer's needs. We will definitely go back here! Five stars in every way!

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: Ambrosial al fresco dining in Tagaytay
content:
My husband and I took our family out-of-town for the first time in months since the pandemic. We couldn‚Äôt have chosen a better place to take them than Fire Lake Grill! 

Making reservations was a breeze! Chef Paul was very jovial and flexible even when...we needed to make last minute changes. 

We reserved a table for 6 in their al fresco area where we enjoyed the cool Tagaytay breeze. It was the perfect spot as we felt safe even if we had to remove our masks to eat. 

The food was excellent! Mom & my kids loved the touch of spice used to jazz up the pumpkin soup, and my husband & I found the grilled tomato soup very refreshing. The porterhouse steak was perfectly seasoned and cooked. The pan seared foie gras was so good that my daughter asked for a second serving! We also ordered pasta and risotto which were also nice. But my favorite was the grilled lamb chops which were so flavorful and tender! We thought we were too full to have dessert but the lime-infused panna cotta and the dark chocolate ganache were just what we needed to cap off our ambrosial feast! 

Our short but delightful trip to Fire Lake Grill was just the break we needed! Thank you Chef Paul and to your very friendly staff!

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: Premium steak!
content: we love the steak here. we had it for two consecutive nights. the chef was really nice and remembered our order :)

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: Still great!
content: Good food with a beautiful view. We ordered foie gras salad, steak and lamb chops and they were all very good. Reservation was swift and easy!

name: Fire Lake Grill
title: Good food and great view!
content: Good food and great view! The Rib eye and Tenderloin steaks were one of the best tasted and cooked as we like it. The foie gras salad was perfect.

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
content: Superb tacos and great ambience! Restaurant was neat and orderly. They also gave us personalized souvenirs that provide insight and meaning to one‚Äôs name. Will definitely come back!

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
title: Bad food quality.   Service was okay.
content:
The waiter was enthusiastic although couldnt recommend  something from the menu that wasn't expensive.  Obviously pushing us to order the higher priced stuff from the list from the get go.

When the food arrived, either bland or disappointing to the taste.   Even the simple taco...that the waiter said was the house specialty was so lacking in anything deemed being edible or a taco.

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
title: Family dinner
content:
We frequented to Tagaytay 2- 4 times a month And one of the things we do is to look for different resto. 
Heard reviews about this one and told my family that we should try this one. We were the last customer that night, so...were a bit noisy. The food is superb especially the crispy pata both seniors and juniors alike enjoyed the taste of their food. We were like super gutom mot a single meal was left. In short kawawa ang pusa.

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
title: When in Tagaytay, look for Morielli's Inn & Diner
content: It is a cozy, homely bed and breakfast inn and diner. Very affordable in meal and accommodation. Services are very friendly. Chef Louie is around to greet the guests specially on weekends.

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
title: Transferred from La VeryOl‚Äôs
content: So due to an uneventful mistake of the booking/reservation staff of La VeryOl‚Äôs, we had to be booked in Morielli‚Äôs (with complimentary breakfast) as compliment for their mistake. Booked on cozy room but no view. We had our massage there courtesy to la VeryOl‚Äôs therapist...for our overnight stay. The place was neat and cozy, bit a bit disappointed with the breakfast. We were told of the limited choices of breakfast menu to choose from (slightly acceptable) but what kept me wondering was that for a complimentary breakfast coffee is not included, so I had to pay for it. Its nit the price but what‚Äôs a breakfast (in the Philippines) without coffee considering were inTagaytay...

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
title: Two thumbs up! üëçüèªüëçüèª
content: Very accomodating staff, nice location and very easy to locate. Food was excellent! Cozy and very relaxing room. Promise to go back very soon for bed and breakfast. Thank you

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
title: So so food
content: Food is not all that great. Plus it takes a really long time to cook the food. 30 minutes or so. Makes you think that they only have one stove available. Everything takes minimum of 30 minutes. The taste is so so. Not that great....Quality is poor as well. The noodles are soggy, the vegetable‚Äôs over cooked. Their signature dessert is not available.

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
title: Great location and comfortable ambiance
content: A quiet evening and good food. Authentic local and European flavours. Decently priced and tastefully decorated

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
title: Disappointed
content:
I think I should blame the Certificates of Excellence Morielli's got for the past 2-3 years and the Booky entry. Italian/Mexican/Filipino restaurant with 5-star TripAdvisor rating? My expectations were quite high. I arrived there to find a very average restaurant. Definitely not an Italian/Mexican restaurant...except by a huge stretch of the imagination. 

The food is so-so, with only the crispy tawilis really showing promise. Crispy pata was a bit tough and rice too expensive for the quality. The soup and arroz caldo were also mediocre. We wanted to order their flatbread pizza but it was out of stock, so there goes the Italian. 

The facilities were average, definitely not cozy as some have described. It's more or less properly maintained, but the washroom has a smell. 

There was only one other family aside from us in the restaurant. I had recommended this over Balay Dako due to its higher TripAdvisor ranking, but I definitely regret my decision and ended up making amends by visiting Balay Dako the following day. Learn from my experience.

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
title: The Inside - Outside Look of Morielli's Diner
content:
As  we were supposed to go to our sure lunch place, it was CLOSED for renovation.  We saw Moreli on the other side and we decided to try rather than travel far.

The outside look of the place looks enticing.  But there is no view...whatsoever.   The interesting stuffs are those paintings, coloring of the kids on display.    

The food is not cheap and the serving size is not big.   I guess it depends on what you order.  Besides the service is in need of upgrade - being attentive to customer needs.

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
title: Way overpriced. Small portions
content: The food had good flavour. But I was the only one in the restaurant, service was slow and poor. Food was super expensive and the portion of the tacos so small. Would not eat here again. Plenty of nicer places with much cheaper food and...larger portions in Tagaytay.

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
title: Mexican tacos and mango crepe are heavenly!
content: The Mexican tacos are freshly cooked. Tortillas are homemade topped with a generous serving of flavorful beef and tasty salsa (the hot sauce on the side complements it so well). The Mango crepe is served with fresh sliced mangos and creamy ice cream. The smell...of sizzling sisig is also very appetizing. The steamed tilapia is one of a kind - loved the delectable kick of coriander. The manager is friendly and passionate about his work. Always a delight to visit Morielli's!

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
title: Friendly helpful staff with great service and good local food to match
content: very nice casual eating place with great local cuisine, will be back for more of this genuine small business

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
title: Best Thing on the Menu is their Tacos
content: Tacos are pretty tasty and spiciness can be customized. Brisket is slow cooked so it‚Äôs tender and well-seasoned.

name: Morielli's Inn & Diner
title: Good Food, umm if it's available.
content:
Came here as a group and we were the only customers on a Friday lunchtime. Since we are a big group, we wanted to order at least 3 of each dish on the menu.  However, the waiter would always say either they have only one...serving left or it is not available.  We ended up ordering just crispy pata, sisig, kare-kare, and chopsuey, which I prefer to have in other restaurants.  The wicked Oreo is a must-try according to some reviews, but the 12 of us have to share the last 2 remaining servings. 

Sign to the comfort room leads to a common room that made one of our lady companions scream as she was not expecting a male customer inside. The printed names that they give away to first time customers? You guessed it right, it's not available either.

name: Cafe Voi La
title: Cafe Voi La - a chill place
content:
Went to Tagaytay for a few days. Saw a few reviews recommending the place, the food and ambience did not disappoint. The selections were reasonably priced, serving portions were also very good. Fragrant and great coffee too.

We picked a overlooking spot in the verandah,...it was a nice cozy moment in November.

name: Cafe Voi La
title: Quite pricey, but worth a visit
content: We were staying in a nearby hotel so we ate here for dinner. The place was dimly lit so it's ideal for intimate dinners. Decorations are perfect for IG enthusiasts. Service was a bit slow, but tolerable. The food is quite pricey but we were...satisfied with what we ate. The chicken satay and tom yum were delicious. Like the food, the coffee was pricey also but we ordered anyway since we enjoyed the ambiance (and weather) that time. Would definitely recommend going here but just be prepared to shell out more than you normally spend.

name: Cafe Voi La
title: Slightly costly, but great service
content:
The F&B was alright, although not exactly fantastic. It was also somewhat costly. However, what won us over was the service.

The staff members were excellent - prompt, friendly, helpful.

The kids also liked the decor in the restaurant. 

We enjoyed our mid-morning coffee break...there.

name: Cafe Voi La
title: Taste of Paradise
content: Shout out to John and the bartender for amazing service! Truthfully, the service was the best part. John was so friendly and hospitable. I came here with my boyfriend, my sister, and her fianc√©. The menu features a good variety of different Asian foods. We...collectively ordered spring rolls, bok choy, a grilled cheese, and Bistek Tagalog. I wish I had taken pictures because the food looked as good as it tasted. I would absolutely come back here if I were to ever visit Crosswinds again. Prices were unbeatable, not to mention the extremely well-made fruit margaritas!

name: Cafe Voi La
title: Overated, expensive, slow service
content: we went to have dessert and coffee at around 3:30pm on a Saturday. You have to spend minimum of 500 pesos in any establishment to avail of free parking or else the parking fee is P500.  Coffee is quite expensive, more expensive than Starbucks but...not as good. Service is quite slow. took them 15 minutes to cut and serve a slice of blueberry cheesecake considering the place was not full at all. Nice place though.

name: Cafe Voi La
title: Good Lunch International Dish
content: Came here for second time. Had tom yang gung and phad thai noodle, kare kare beef and callos. With rice. Overall the theme of restaurant was good, service was good but the soup had no heat and not sour enough as thai soup should be....The rest will pass. It is quite pricey though.

name: Cafe Voi La
title: Such a Pretentious Restaurant
content:
Everything is just slow, and overpriced. 

The food is just plain mediocre. The serving size was ultimately small.

The restaurant's name is in French, but does not serve French cuisine.
They however serves English, American, Filipino, Mexican, and Chinese food.

The staff makes you seat...in an old sofa. I'm not really sure what the theme is. But all I can say is that, they failed. 

And yes, they have water bottles already available in the table. Which will make you think that is free, but they'll charge you afterwards lol. 

Will not go here again. Hopefully, they change things here since this is in Tagaytay.

name: Cafe Voi La
title: Bad service
content:
Very disappointed with this restaurant. They dont have service water unusual for resto serving food. Their serving sizes was enough for one but the price is so expensive!

We were paying in credit card and was advised that it was offline or there was no...signal. I insisted to pay in credit card since they did not notify us that cc was not allowed.

My husband also requested if we could eat the pie that we brought along since the food was not yer ssrved and my husband also informed them that we were diabetics. We were not allowed to eat the pie. 

Never again to dine here and would also tell friends about our experience.

name: Cafe Voi La
title: Disappointing
content:
VERY DISAPPOINTED. YOU JUST RUINED OVERALL EXPERIENCE. We were charged P55/ bottle of water that was displayed on the table. It gave us the impression that it is part of their protocol to give bottled water to their customers. They could have advised customers that...the water is not on the house. We could have ordered a coffee instead. It is a total RIP OFF! If you want to increase your sales Voi La, BE FAIR! Don't TRICK YOUR CUSTOMERS like that. P55/bottle? No problem! we can afford that. The point is, WE DONT WANT TO SPEND ON SOMETHING THAT WE DO NOT NEED! We have bottles of water in the car since we drove from Manila. Who ever thought about that bottle of water thing is a terrible person! You should not be in a Hospitality Industry! ITS A RIP OFF!!

Oh. And we even have to call the attention of ur staff for us to order. And even need to go to the counter to call ur staffs for us to get the bill. Very nice for a resto that have "additional service charge" on its bill.

name: Cafe Voi La
title: Severely Overpriced
content: There are some good dishes but not all of them are exemplary. The prices are way off the scale for what you get. The presentation is what you pay for most of the time. P700 plus for 3 tiny sticks of satay? Seriously, not worth...what you pay for as the sauces are not all that great and miss the mark. Enjoyed the kare-kare as it was not typical, the steamed Thai custard was pretty bad as it seemed to have been reheated. The papaya salad was good and plentiful as it was fluffed up with a lot of lettuce, the phad thai was ok. The ambiance is really great as a lot were brought in from Thailand so it gave a very nice and pretty look. We enjoyed the salted caramel cheese cake very much. Overall, too much money for what you get.

name: Cafe Voi La
title: Good Ambiance Resto but too expensive food
content:
Good ambiance overall with wide selection of Filipino, Spanish, Thai and a little bit of American cuisine but food is expensive with small serving and taste is just ordinary.

We just want to highlight how attentive, courteous and friendly their waiters are.

And we were...deceived by the bottled waters in the table haha! I thought that this is their service water given the pandemic but i was wrong. Always ask if unsure

name: Cafe Voi La
title: Lovely place and good food, but bad service
content: We were supposed to go to another restaurant in the area, but we couldn't find it and we ended up in this restaurant. I really didn't mind discovering and trying out new places, especially one like Voi La, which has a beautiful ambiance and a...good selection of food. As we stepped into this restaurant I was immediately impressed with its decors, furniture, colorful lanterns, and so forth. Not bad at all, I said to myself. Then I skimmed over its menu. It had a good selection of Italian, Spanish, Thai and Filipino dishes. My expectations were really high, considering that they were quite expensive. It's fine, I said, since you pay not only for the food, but for the ambiance, too. Well, the foods didn't disappoint, except that I found the servings rather small. Everything would have been forgiveable, but then our dining experience was dampened by a couple of things. First, service was too slow. Second, the waiters were not as accommodating as  they should be. They were nowhere to be found near our table and I had to rise many times just to look for them and call their attention. I asked for an extra fork and I had to ask for it thrice before they brought me one. The same thing happened when I asked again for the menu. The waiter serving us also took forever to give us the bill when we asked for it. Hayz! In the end, out of our dissatisfaction for such a lousy service, we decided not to leave them any tip. It's a pity that a lovely place with good food would have such a terrible customer service. I don't think I'd be returning to this restaurant any time soon. Besides, they have a perennial problem with their parking lot. =(

name: Cafe Voi La
title: slow service
content:
Coffee was good. Food - nothing spectacular. There were a few IG-worthy spots in the restaurant. 

We were hungry so we decided to dine here instead of waiting in line at the Ruined Project. 
Went here on a weekday afternoon and there were very few...customers at the time. Service was very slow despite only less than 5 tables occupied.

name: Cafe Voi La
title: Don't order drinks !!!!!!
content:
we went to cafe viola for lunch on June 13, 2021.  We are seated facing their bar counter. While waiting for our food, which takes ages to come, i and my mom-in-law saw a waiter mixing a drink.  Then he use a spoon to stir...and have a taste w/ the spoon. He then added sweetener to the glass and use the same spoon to stir again.  He do it a couple of times to use the spoon to stir and taste before serving.  Ewwwww!  How gross!!!!

Advice :  Don't order drinks.

Hygiene please.  Management please discipline your waiters,diners might get infected if your staff are sick.

name: Cafe Voi La
title: Relaxing ambiance
content: The resto is ideally located away from the hustle and bustle of Tagaytay and overall ambiance of the place is good. Food is good although the menu is not that extensive and a bit pricey.

name: Shambala Silang
title: Shambala silang Art and Culture
content:
Amazing place all space is Instagramable, beautiful sunset..

Very friendly staff
Home of arts and culture i like all kubos for accomadation

Pet friendly space

Food is excellent i like all they dishes

Thums up

name: Shambala Silang
title: Worst Experience, Don‚Äôt waste your time. Go find somewhere else to go
content:
Not worth visiting at all. You‚Äôre better off going someplace else. What a waste of beautiful space and environment. 

First - i asked them about the rates via Facebook Messenger and they said that the entrance fee is 200 and consumable with food. They did...not mention about the 500 minimum food requirement per person.

When we arrived, they started saying that the 200 per person entrance is only for the garden then we have to pay 300 for the food then we have to pay 200 for the gallery entrance fee. So in total we have to spend 700 pesos which we were not informed during our initial conversation in Facebook Messenger. The issue here is not the money, but the feeling that they did not tell us the prices early on during the fb messenger conversation. i felt that we were misinformed and coerced into going there by the premise that you can spend just 200 pesos. 

Second - They informed us that the food will take an hour to be served. This is okay since we did not pre-order and we can roam around while waiting for food. After 1.5 hours wala pa ring food. Even coke hindi pa din dumadating after 1.5 hours of ordering!. Hindi naman niluluto ang coke. Then the food arrived on by one and it was cold. We had to complain endlessly tapos saka lang sila nagmadali na i-release yung food.

Third - The Food also taste bland lalo na yung pasta dishes and pizza na parang frozen pizza lang. It was bad despite of it being pricey.

The crew apologized after our incessant complaints and gave us 1 complimentary ice cream cup per group. for me - the solution would have been to serve us the food on time as promised in one hour. that‚Äôs it. and please change your chef who cooks the western dishes. It was really bad.

Maganda yung place pero not worth visiting at all. You‚Äôre better off eating somewhere else in Silang.

name: Shambala Silang
title: A visit good for the soul
content:
We spent a perfect day in this little paradise in late January. Since our last visit  here 4 years ago, there have been more structural improvements and more impressive art work to view. The plants throughout the property provided a relaxing atmosphere, with the overcast...sky and gentle breeze keeping us comfortable. 
The lunch menu was amazing ‚Äî from every dish‚Äôs appealing presentation to its savory taste  ‚Äî we‚Äôve got it all ! 
So thankful to our gracious hosts for the opportunity to experience this little paradise in Silang.

name: Shambala Silang
title: 3rd Jan Family day out.
content:
The owner and staff were super friendly. Quick to help out and to answer questions. 
The sumptuous two set meals we ordered were of a very high quality. We happily wandered around the house whilst the food was being prepared.
Unfortunately, due to the wet...weather we sadly couldn't tour the surrounding gardens later on. We'll have to return sometime in the future.
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and wouldn't hesitate in coming back.

name: Shambala Silang
title: Shambala Tour
content: We went at Shambala last Oct 1, 2022, and honestly it was a great experience to visit there. Shambala is perfect for school or educational purposes which you will learn everything about the arts and paintings, different kinds of sculptures and even foods and clothings...and many more. This place is also ideal for family and friends who really love and appreciate arts and people who are interested about the life of our beloved ifugaos, of course while having fun together. Most importantly, visiting Shambala is excellent for stimulating new ideas, recharging batteries, and providing fresh perspectives. It will surely provide you an access to the works of great masters, inventions, and objects that have changed our lives.

name: Shambala Silang
title: SHAMBALA TOUR
content: Very accommodating staff, delicious foods, and good ambience which is good for relaxing relieving stress. The farm is very unique it has own art museum that show culture of ifugao people. I suggest to bring a lot of energy if you are planning to visit...shambala.

name: Shambala Silang
title: SHAMBALA EXPERIENCE
content: Shambala is the perfect place for healing, relaxation and meditation. In there you'll learn arts, history and how the farm started, and i find it very inspiring and initeresting. Food was exquisite as well as the staff and employees. I'll definitely go back here but...this time with my family.

name: Shambala Silang
title: Shambala silang
content: The place is good for vacation and it's so refreshing and relaxing the staffs are so accommodating and also the owner is so energetic. The food is delicious but i suggest that add some foods that promoting silang's dishes

name: Shambala Silang
title: Adventurous Yet Relaxing
content: When I visited Shambala Silang, I find it very relaxing, adventurous, and at the same time relaxing. I enjoyed different kinds of activities they have. I learned different histories of Shambala. They also have a very unique facilities specially for their accommodations. It is quite...amusing that they use the ifugao culture in their accommodations. Even the foods are great.

name: Shambala Silang
title: SHAMBALA TOUR
content: The place is very beautiful and very eco-friendly. The staffs are all accommodating and hospitable, they are all nice and they know how to entertain their guests very well. Plus the spots in their farm aren't just a normal spot but it all has a...history story. The foods? It's all good ‚ù§Ô∏è overall the place and their services are all üíØ

name: Shambala Silang
title: I enjoyed the art
content: Good ambiance, great food, nice tour. I enjoyed the free food. I like the historical place vibes. Overall, it's an average place for me

name: Shambala Silang
title: The place of PASSION and INSPIRATION
content: Shambala is indeed a very amazing, interesting, and a perfect place for people who wants a peaceful and serene ambiance. I believe, the way the museum was designed is one factor that makes it unique but what‚Äôs more jaw dropping about it is the inspiration...and the overflowing passion of their one and only master, Ms. Riza Muyot. They are truly genuine in delivering an authentic experience and service. I remember the time we went there; they allowed us to feel and touch the hagabi: the bench in the middle of the Tawid Museum; it symbolizes wealth of the ifugaos. I was truly amazed! Every corner that your eyes lands on, there will be an artifact that is worth staring and the longer you see it you will eventually appreciate the beauty of an abstract art and its value. I would recommend for others to go check the place out and I, as well, I would definitely go back when I have a space in my time to free up my mind and have a wonderful and out of this world relax time!

name: Shambala Silang
title: FUN AND EDUCATIONAL
content: This place is not only good for relaxing but also for you to learn something. I love how the owner explained every meaning and story of the arts she collected and displayed in the gallery. She is so accommodating, and I like how she want...the students ask her a question. I also like the food and the colored purple drinks designed with flowers which they picked from their garden. You will surely love the ambiance too, you will feel kinda free everywhere, from the gallery, the garden. you will appreciate the culture and the history.

name: Shambala Silang
title: A Hidden Art Garden Paradise
content:
Shambala is a secret garden in Silang, Cavite that is named after a mythical Himalayan kingdom of peace and happiness. Among the lush garden is a Living Museum of modern Filipino Art,  Cordilleran culture, and slow-food Filipino cuisine. It's still under construction, but it's worth...a visit while most people haven't discovered this hidden paradise. You can choose which area of the garden you want to dine or relax in. There is plenty of space between guests. You are free to explore the garden on your own. You'll be surrounded by various bamboo varieties, flowering plants, bushes, ferns, overhanging vines, and tree species. Explore the second floor to learn about the owners' personal collection and become enthralled by the stories behind the various artworks. Shambala Silang was created and is curated by Riza Matibag Muyot. She is frequently in the garden grounds, to say hello and ask her about Shambala stories. The main Living Art Museum exhibits Cordilleran art, contemporary works by Filipino masters, and emerging works by young Filipino artists. The slopes on Shambala's hilly side are terraced, with foundations of rip-rapped tuffaceous stones made by true Cordilleran stone artisans.The authentic Dap-ay, where the tribal council meets with stone seats and a bonfire in the middle, is one of the Shambala Terraces' most impressive features.

Overall, we adore the art- and culture-inspired landscape, the lush, spacious gardens, and the Filipino heritage cuisine. This is a safe place to celebrate special occasions with the entire family, including grandparents and children. It's also an excellent location for retreats, and moments of self-reflection.

name: Shambala Silang
title: THE ART OF CULTURE AND TRADITION
content:
The story behind every masterpiece in the gallery and in the whole Shambala is really what has me coming back. I love how Ms. Riza toured us around the gallery informing everything about Shambala from how they started it to how it is going now,...the theme which is the "Cordillera in the South". It is fascinating how they created the whole Shambala, how precisely Ms. Riza explained every art inside the gallery, her collection, her friends that are the artists of some masterpiece and I remember the four corners of Shambala Silang which is Creativity, Spirituality, Learning and Healing. 

I also love the food that is served to us, the Poqui-Poqui pizza, other gourmet foods, and the Maluca drinks and the violet one that really has me. 

I consider myself coming back to Shambala.

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: Superb service, food was good too. Not very wow, but definitely would come back!
content: Food was average for me, not much peanut taste in the kare kare. My friends ordered bacon lechon kawali and longganisa and they enjoyed it. We also ordered ensaymada, and churros. They‚Äôre pretty good too. But Kuya Jimmy‚Äôs service was superb!

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: Almost 5 stars
content:
We brought our balikbayan friend to Pamana to satisfy her craving for bulalo.
It did not disappoint as the serving was generous, the meat fell off the bone
, and the soup was divine.  

Customer service was at its finest; the waiters were attentive and...efficient.
Food was readily available.

My score is 4.5 stars, as we did not have a full view of Taal.  We were at the ridge.  The interiors were nice and the curio shop was very interesting.

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: Tsokolate Eh! The best!
content:
The food is average.
The service is very good.
The one that stand out is the Tsokolate Eh!
Pricing is affordable.
Weekday is a must visit.
Resto vibes is relaxing.
Love the plates they are selling!

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER
content:
food is absolutely delicious and affordable but your waiters and staff even the receptionist are terrible!!! R U D E!! it's actually our first time eating here and our experience was disappointing because of the staffs we are never coming back! we were aiming to...eat at balay dako or bag of beans or antonios but puno lahat so we ended up trying this pamana restaurant since walang tao naman, Which is a very wrong choice

we went to the restaurant at around 12nn (december 2,2020) the parking boy was very good he actually assisted us but when we went in the receptionist just said " pwede napo pumasok" and did not assist us she even got my mother so mad because my mother kept on saying we wanted a table na magkakatabi kami because it's OUR ONLY TIME na kumpleto! receptionist said na "wala wala "di pwede blabla, we know na dapat social distancing what we are requesting is atleast isang helerang table kahit magkakahiwalay duhhhh, we were 7pax btw. they gave us magkkahiwalay na table at first tapos yung nakagreen na naglalagay ng water was very bastos!! super!!! my mom said to the receptionist bakit yung katabing table magkakatabi sila. and all the receptionist is saying is "wala na wala na" 

but! merong waiter na hinelp kami he was superb!!! he was the only one who actually calmed the situation binigyan nya kami ng table sa taas where in we can eat as a whole family. Thank you kuya waiter! sorry we were'nt able to get the name of the staffs because we wanted to bond. He's the only one who served as so we gave him almost 2000 pesos as a tip alone because of his effort i hope your co workers are like you. Mabilis mag isip and magresolve ng situation.

okay so we are all settled in ok na so i went to the cr downstairs the receptionist and si ateng tagapour ng water was talking about what happened and yung mom ko sa RECEPTION AREA wherein a lot of people can hear it, they were laughing about the situation ,So i told them kung paguusapan nyo yung nangyare or chismis please kayo kayo nalang wag yung ibang may nakakarinig. 

SO SI KUYANG WAITER LANG ANG KUMAUSAP samin and nagsorry and tbh wala syang kasalanan yung receptionist at yung nakagreen ang bastos e. Not even yung manager supervisor ang lumapit samin to talk about what happened. üôÑüôÑüôÑüôÑ si kuya waiter na mabait included sa picture down below thanks kuya again. Godbless you kuya waiter

END OF STORY. 

NOT COMING BACK HERE AGAIN. food is great but staffs are rude.

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: Good food
content:
I ordered Pinakbet and Crispy Adobong Pusit. Both were really really good! You should order it. 

They have Taal Lake  View but it is too windy to stay outside. 

Limited parking only.

This place is good for family bonding. However you need to go up...the stairs and not a PWD or senior citizen friendly. 

Price is not cheap but worth a try.

I will definitely come back to try another dish.

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: Heirloom dishes with a twist
content: First tried it at the Makati branch and was pleasantly surprised to the familiarity of the dishes but to a certain extent the twist are just fine. Loved the fried squid in its ink!!

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: Great Food and Ambience. Worth every penny
content: Tried their humba and 3kinds of adobo. Initially I thought restaurant is a bit pricey by just looking at the menu but not the case actually. The serving is generous and service and food is great so it is actually worth and justifies the price....Plus great ambiance

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: One of the best restaurant in Tagaytay :)
content: Love the ambiance and foods are delicious! Chicken Binakol and Adobo Kangkong are so tasty and delicious. I hope to try some more foods when we come back :)

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: Good food
content: The food is good, I order the nilechong bangus I love it, it's tasty ,good view also you will see the taal volcano.

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: Sulit and Sumptuous Family Lunch
content:
5 things I like most about Pamana:
1. Love the food. I don't like Kare Kare that much but their's is absolutely delish.
2. Bulalo soup was tasty and the meat super tender. We even had a soup refill for free ü•£
3. The place...feels like home. Perfect for family meals and get-togethers.
4. Natural breeze inside the house.
5. Price is relatively reasonable.

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: Good filipino food varieties.
content: Good food especially the adobo! Spectacular view of  Taal Lake, wide array of food choices, friendly staff, and a good place to eat in Tagaytay!

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: All Filipino Faves
content: I know there are other pamana restaurants in Manila, but dining in Tagaytay is sort of a different level, the ambiance of the taal lake and the fact that you are on a mini break makes it special. We arrived as a group of 15...and there was a group of 20 ahead of us, but we were seated in about 30 mins. The lady at the reception was kind enough to recommend some other restaurants around Tagaytay (probably because we all look famished!), but this kind gesture made us stay. They serve all the favorite dishes in the Philippines, from Luzon to Mindanao, so it's practically a one stop dining experience. I highly recommend the humba, the seafood kare-kare, the sinigang na kamyas, and tuna belly. They have the all time favorite snacks and desserts so you can eat at your hearts content. Also, the ginger pandan ice tea is really good stuff. Staff is very friendly. The food arrived in a reasonable time and served together. It's worth the wait even if you have to queue.

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: Had a great dinner
content: This is my 2nd time to eat in Pamana, we‚Äôre always ordering their boneless crispy kare kare, not too salty because it is partnered with bagoong, we also tried their sizzling bulalo, very juicy. We‚Äôll surely come back here.

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: Good food!!!
content: Serves very good food especially the Crispy Adobong Pusit Calamares. However, I think some of the waiters could have been attentive. There were a few times that we had requests and we needed to reminded them more than once. Aside from the that, this is...a good place for family and friends to dine. During the day time, it's nice to stay at their veranda for a good view.

name: Pamana Restaurant
title: Delicious Filipino meals  in nostalgic local ambience
content: 3-way adobo (pork, beef flakes & chicken in a single dish), beef bulalo, seafood aligue, baked bone marrow + adobo pate & toast, lechon manok tinupig sa gata, baked sugpo sa taba ng talangka, to taste the least. All are delicious & sumptuous. In nostalgic...Filipino ambience. Apparently owned & operated by the Barrio Fiesta chain of restos. Staff service is good. Clean surroundings &  toilet.

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: Disappointed customer
content: Had breakfast here last Sunday, and we were very disappointed.  We ordered the Country style bfast and breakfast pancakes. When the food came out, the bacon was half cooked, and sausage was rare. Only the eggs were cooked to perfection. And,  the food was COLD!...With the price in that restaurant we expected something better. I think this facility should have a system by now even if the restaurant is fully booked. Please do something about this kasi. You guys are carrying the name of an establishment that has been in Tagaytay for so long.

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: ... Will never come back...
content: The food is ordinary, the place is overrated - only a few tables in the edge will give you a nice view of taal lake, and the staff are so unaccommodating... i will never go back to this restaurant again..

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: Breathtaking View & Awesome Breakfast
content: Awesome breakfast, cosy place, nice staff and breathtaking view. One of the must-visits in Tagaytay. My son and I headed here after he picked me up from NAIA T3 and the trip was all worth it. This place deserves several more trips or must-go to...place for every visit in Tagaytay.

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: Good local cafe
content: This is a local cafe offering coffee, food, and views of Taal hills and lake. Entry to the cafe snakes its way down from the main road and opens into the main dining hall. Tables are arranged around the different levels offering direct or some...obstructed views of the hills. We only ordered drinks including local coffee. The espresso offerings were good. We also ordered a berry cheesecake. The cake was smooth and silky with berry compote cutting through the richness. A good stop for a cup of coffee by itself or with food.

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: Outstanding Brunch!
content:
Neither of us were really hungry so we decided to split one of the breakfast meals.

The meal was delicious. The service was excellent. And the view was inspiring.

This alone made the trip to Tagaytay worth it!

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: Perfect for breakfast
content:
The best way to start the day is a breakfast at Charito. Easy to find, just off the main highway in Tagaytay. We were early and could easily get a place to park, when we left at 9:30am the parking lot was full, the earlier...the better I guess.
They have a beautiful terrace with an amazing view, that alone got us in the right mood, the setting is just unbelievable. The service team there was good, not as good as at Breakfast at Antonio's but they got the job done. We had breakfast and the portion size is quite good, and the food was good, we had some eggs, bacon, pancake etc. Was it the best breakfast food I ever had - no, but combined with the view and overall setting it was just a great start into the day.

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: Good food with a good view
content: The view of the Taal Lake is gorgeous from this restaurant. Staff are welcoming though its kinda difficult to get their attention if we needed them as we were seated at the corner facing the lake. The food was delicious and they prepared it quite...fast. Overall I recommend this restaurant if you want a good food with a good view.

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: Lovely house turned into a restaurant!
content: The original structure that now houses a restaurant was built in 1970. It is owned and was used as a summer house by the Diaz Family. Today it's a lovely restaurant that offers both indoor and outdoor dining. The salas are very elegant and the...foods are great! However, it is always full of diners at lunch and dinner time and reservation is not allowed. Hence, the waiting time can be quite long and parking lot hard to find.

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: Denied service because I am too old . . .
content: This used to be one of my favorite restaurants, but no longer. Although both my wife and I are fully vaccinated, we were denied service today because I am too old! The hostess insisted the age limit is an LGU rule, we had no difficulty...getting lunch just a couple blocks away.

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: Great Restaurant for Dinner or Even after Dinner
content: Bag of beans has many branches in Tagaytay, but I like Charito the best. Came here for after dinner coffee. This restaurant setting of a grand house with beautiful table and furniture. Had coffee, chocolate and pastry. It is overlooking the ridge and I can...imagine the view during daytime. The night view is the house itself.

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: Not worth it
content: Went there on a Tuesday. Had to ask 3x before someone finally took our order. Requested if we can transfer to another table because a big plant is in front of us, was told that the table is only for 2 person. But when it...rained they transfered us to a same size table inside. Had to follow up my Coffee refill 3x. Heard 2 staff talking the "excuse"  they will give to another customer.  In short (and you can also read in the other comments) Staff not accommodating, bad slow service. There are many other resto in tagaytay with great view, good food and better service.

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: A Poorly Run Kitchen
content:
Ordered the country breakfast (2 pancakes, bacon, 2 sausages and 2 eggs) at 8:37am got served at 9:20am. The sausages were cold and the bacon was more hard than crispy, the effect that you get when grease hardens when cold. So i waited for more...than 40 mins only to get served cold food. I am assuming while the other components of my order was being prepared, they cooked the bacon and sausages in batches and would just get some as orders came in. So by the time they processed my order, the bacon and sausages that i got were cold. The restaurant was 80% capacity so it was not even at their limits. The restaurant is a converted house so i suspect the kitchen doesn't have the capacity to serve a restaurant of that size so they made shortcuts in the preparation. Even then i had to wait for more than 40 minutes. For 450 bucks for the dish, I was expecting more. A that price point, I'd give other options a try.

Great view though.

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: Great breakfast
content: So took a friend for breakfast, menu was good, food great, so was service. Only went once and glad I did. Rather expensive more of a tourist/ upper income Pilipino.

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: view was great, but thats all
content:
The view was amazing from this place
but for the food. Low quality
as for the service, mediocre.took them along time just to give us tissues and the receipt
if it wasnt for the view. I wouldnt come back here at all

name: Charito by Bag of Beans
title: good food
content:
attended a birthday dinner celebration and food is really good. and of course, the coffee. being a coffeeholic, the first order as soon as i take a seat is coffee. since this is also run by Bag of Beans, i am sure what coffee to...get.
all food tasted good. period.
value for money and worth your while.

name: Buon Giorno
title: Just the view is great, forget about the rest
content:
Wife and I went for a day out to Tagaytay. We both love Italian food, so Buon Giorno was a welcome option.
There's a lot of parking lots available, the view is great (really great!).
Sadly, coffee and food are below average.
We both started...with a cappuccino each. They tasted watered down.
For brunch we had Pasta Verdura, Eggplant Parmigiana and Pizza Margherita.
The pasta sauce was not bad, fresh veggies, but the pasta was overcooked.
The Eggplant Parmigiana was bland, the Pizza Margherita was bland and soft. Very unexciting. Boring.

For the given high price range the delivery was absolutely underwhelming. Service was friendly and average. 

We will not go there anymore and can't recommend it.

name: Buon Giorno
title: Its ok
content: I would not mind going back but its a bit pricey.    Will try the other dishes next time.   The view is great and I like the homey feel of the place.

name: Buon Giorno
title: Disappointment
content: Used to come to eat here a lot. Now food is piss and rubbish. A vomitt hole at best. Food can do better. No taste, very bland, ‚Äòrisotto‚Äô is just rice we all know. Ingredients used are mediocre.

name: Buon Giorno
title: Good Italian Food
content: Good view of Taal. Food is average as best sellers are "out of stock".Can't blame the average service as well since the place was packed.

name: Buon Giorno
title: Great Italian
content:
Lovely views of Lake Taal from the Cliffhouse location in the day. 
Great Italian food especially the shrimp ravioli in tomato sauce. Very filling so sadly no room to try out their desserts.
Book if you want a table outside.

name: Buon Giorno
title: lost its edge
content: This is a good place. However wines are not available from the wine list. "out of stock". Kitchen moves the food out pretty good. Water refills very slow. Lots of flies and pests. Billing had to go back and forth since it was not accurate....Overall its just Average. the  prep -ratios not balanced food? Not as good as the last two times. The kitchen not doing its normal thing seemed out of sync. at these prices I was was left wanning for something better.

name: Buon Giorno
title: good food, good service, good ambiance
content:
hubby and i tried out this place months ago when we decided to get a quick ride to tagaytay. all i wanted was to get my daily dose of coffee but got to try some pizza and pasta. but the coffee is really good, and...it comes with a free cookie.
just this month, brought my grand kids on a random trip again and we suggested the place. my apos were happy to see the place all geared up for halloween. even the cookies are now ghost-shaped to match the theme.
food is good, service is likewise good, and the view from the cliffhouse is really nice.

name: Buon Giorno
title: Family Toad Trip
content: Juicy steak and great service! Sumptous serving of side dish and gravy. Definitely we will go back and taste the other list from the menu.

name: Buon Giorno
title: Experience Boun Giorno Resto at Cliffhouse
content: My husband's order - Osso buco.was deliciously and fantastically cooked.Mine is Rissoto Pescatore. As a Filipino I wanted the rice to be fully cooked and surprisingly I got what I wanted without even asking the server to tell it to the chef, The ambience was...superb... almost you just wanted to stay more for a while.  But the most unforgettable experienced we had was how the lady staff server patiently answered all our questions.I could have given an excellent rating but I have to remind her of my Tiramisu order....which I had ordered earlier along with the main food.

name: Buon Giorno
title: Good Service
content: I went with my mom and sister for lunch. From the time we were about to enter the place, a staff was already there, accommodating and escorting us to our table. All servers were friendly. Everyone was willing to take our requests. Well done!

name: Buon Giorno
title: Best breakfast spot!
content: I think this is the best breakfast we had in Tagaytay. they have an outside seating which you can have you‚Äôre coffee peacefully with a great view of taal lake. They have complementary garlic bread while waiting for your food to be served. We ordered...carbonara, us tapa loin, boneless bangus and tocino which are delicious, you must try it guys! Their service is great, nothing to complain. üëèüëèüëèüëè

name: Buon Giorno
title: Dinner date
content:
-Great scenery, ambience and view of Taal Lake
-Food was ok. Very filling. We ordered lasagna, spinach cannelloni and meat pizza
-Good place to hang out with your family and friends

name: Buon Giorno
title: Mother‚Äôs Day
content: We usually travel to Tagaytay for special occassions and sometimes to unwind since malls/restos here in Manila were crowded specially during Mother‚Äôs Day. We dont have plans yet for the M‚Äôs day. That afternoon, I asked my husband if he wants to have dinner at...Tagaytay, and we arrived at the Cliffhouse at around 8:30pm. Unfortunately, Concha‚Äôs is no longer accepting customers so we opt for other restos in the area and we saw Buon Giorno. What amazed me here is the interior of the resto. It‚Äôs homey though it needs more space. What also impressed me is their unlimited bread which I think is freshly baked italian bread. So if you are quite hungry while waiting for your food, you can have the bread first. It was served hot, covered with cloth to preserved its freshness and hotness and it is in a small basket. Serving time is quite long but you are assured that your food is freshly made. Nice pasta and we loved the food!

name: Buon Giorno
title: Anniversary Dinner in Tagaytay
content: The last time we ate at B.G. it was at Twin Lakes and it was excellent in every way. The Cliff house restaurant is nice with a partial view of lake Taal.  We sat outside and it was nice but after a while it got...too hot and the bugs were buzzing us.  An added fan made it better but we should have just gone inside.  My wife ordered the rack of lamb and I got the salmon.  The lamb was cooked to perfection a little rare, tender and super tasty. My salmon was cut as a steak.  It was tasty but I had to remove fish bones in almost every bite.  The pasta was a bit stiff unlike the last time I had it.  My overall score is that it was better than average but not very good. It was our wedding anniversary and if we had the same experience as our last visit there we would have been very happy.

name: Buon Giorno
title: Food galore
content: Who wouldn't love Italian cuisine? Had the pasta, salad, risotto and pizza. Love the food. Carbs galore! üòÇüòÇüòÇ

name: Lime & Basil
title: A Very Nice Find
content:
We visited on the recommendation of a few friends and weren't disappointed. We sat in the tented more open area. Whilst it might not be as smart as inside the main restaurant, that didn't matter as this area had a really nice laid-back feel to...it.

We had three dishes, all of which were nice. At first I was worried about how red the red curry was, but it had great flavours and the chicken was really moist.

The staff were slightly slow on taking orders and never seemed to be looking at us when we were trying to get their attention. That said, they were pleasant enough.

Slightly on the expensive side for what we had but well worth it and will definitely put this on our return list.

name: Lime & Basil
title: Always happy
content: Ever since we tried eating in Lime and Basil ( recommended by a friend of ours) we have kept coming back whenever we are in Tagaytay. We have celebrated quick get aways in Tagaytay and always make time to eat here . Our favorites are...their Shrimp Cakes, Crispy Pork with Red Curry sauce and of course their TomYum Soup. Sadly we have never made it to dessert ( I'm sure it is good , judging from their dishes) we are always too full to partake of it.

name: Lime & Basil
title: Great Thai food
content:
Great food, nice ambience and professional staff to serve us.
Not to be missed when you‚Äôre in Tagaytay. A short drive from center of Tagaytay. Food serving size is commendable, authentic Thai food.

name: Lime & Basil
title: Good food, seevice needs a lot of improvement
content: Food is good but takes some time to prepare (first dish arrived about 40 mins after ordering). Servers seem to hate their jobs and do their best to avoid you and leave the dining area unattended. Really weird considering we were only one of just...2 tables there. We literally had to stand up and go outside a couple of times to get servers' attention. Overall a good experience but definitely could have been better with better staff.

name: Lime & Basil
title: Closest to real Thai food
content: We ordered 2 Shrimps in Blanket and devoured them before I could take a picture. Excellent Pomelo Salad! I requested and got a tastier Pad Thai. The tilapia's tamarind sauce was too thick. The Green Curry was 5-alarm hot! Generally satisfied my Thai food craving...for a moment, haha.

name: Lime & Basil
title: Must visit when in Tagaytay
content:
Nice ambiance. Delicious food. Friendly staff. What else could you ask for?

The food they serve are really good tasting. Lalo na if you're a fan of Thai dishes.

Tapos abangan mo what they'll serve you while you're waiting for your orders.

name: Lime & Basil
title: Woueld Recommend <3
content: I rarely write reviews, but had to go back to this page after visiting Lime and Basil! Their food is super yummy (medj pricey, but understandable bc quality food naman talaga) and nice staff as well. We were seated medj far from the main area...lang kaya kinda took a while for our food to arrive but it was worth it :D would reco this play and would definitely come back. They have a parking too and a big place both indoor and al fresco. It would be best to schedule a reservation though especially during weekends

name: Lime & Basil
title: Excellent
content: Excellent food, quick service, al fresco dining, what else can I ask for? Highly recommended, will definitely visit again

name: Lime & Basil
title: Lime and Basil!
content:
The place. The food. The staff.

This is my happy place. I just enjoy eating here with friends and loved ones. The authentic Thai food makes me long to travel to Thai again very soon!

name: Lime & Basil
title: Tagaytay is not just for Bulalo
content: Tucked away from the main highway, it was such a delight to find a very cozy restaurant with friendly people serving great Thai Food. We already had our Bulalo the day before so we decided to have another cuisine for lunch. We ordered the Thai...staples which were all comparable to what I used to have during my trips to Thailand, Pad Thai, Red Curry, Pineapple Fried Rice, Mango Sticky Rice and Pandan Chicken. We also ordered Tom Yum but it‚Äôs a bit too salty for me. Of course, we did not skip the Lime and Basil Salad which was super fresh. Overall, it was a great dining experience, good food with very attentive staff.

name: Lime & Basil
title: Almost all of the food (which
content: Almost all of the food (which was supposedly their best-sellers) were not available. How can a thai restaurant not have curry! Such a disappointment. Hope they have better inventory planning.

name: Lime & Basil
title: Romantic Place to bring a loved one?
content:
Lime & Basil (L&B) may be worth the drive esp if you're into privacy and relaxation whilst taking your meal. L&B is located just after Tagaytay and they have ample parking space for big groups of people. Just make sure to call ahead of time...so that you won't have to wait to be seated.

Their Pad Thai is very good as well as their Crispy Pork Red Curry. The Spring Rolls and Bagoong Rice is top-notch as well. They have other fares from Beef, Chicken, Pork, & Vegetables. I'm sure we'll come back to try all the others soon!

P.S. More romantic to go here for dinner. Cards are accepted as well.

name: Lime & Basil
title: Awesome Exp
content:
Due to this pandemic, the shorter road going to this restaurant was closed, and you have to go around just to reach here. 

Location was kinda tricky maybe because it was our first time coming we kinds got lost along the way... parking is quite...an issue as you just have to park beside a curving road. 

But the food is really good and it isn‚Äôt pricey compared to other overrated restaurants in Tagaytay.

name: Lime & Basil
title: Not your average Thai resto
content: Really enjoyed out meal at Lime and Basil.  Not like your average Thai resto I was used to in the states.  Authentic Thai food served in a beautiful setting.  We sat outdoors and were surrounded by green gardens and flowers.  Loved the food and the...service was excellent too.  Have to say though I was a little disappointed by the Northern Thai sausage. I have to admit this is the first time I have tried it. I have been searching for it for a few years when I lived in the states but could never find it anywhere. When I saw it was on the menu here I had to order it.  It was good but the lemgrass flavor was a little overwhelming.  Maybe my expectations were not realistic but it was not as I expected.  Its a little off the beaten path and you  have to park down a dirt road and walk up so bring your umbrella.

name: Lime & Basil
title: Not going back
content: Service was sloooooow took 45min for our orders to complete. They add 10% service charge to boot. Food is average, nothing to write home about but prices are at par with better Thai restaurants in Manila.

name: Gourmet Farms
title: Great Food and Store
content: We enjoyed all of the food we ordered including the salad buffet, Pizza and Pasta. The chips were great too! Definitely worth coming back.

name: Gourmet Farms
title: Bread superb tasting
content: It was my 1st time to drop by / visit this place. The place looks clean and very welcoming, even the staff are all friendly. I love the taste of their  bread, I bought the tuna bread and cheese/ bacon bread, both of which are...excellent. So soft, filling full , really worth the price. I also like the Pesto Chips. Definitely would be back.

name: Gourmet Farms
title: Perfect spot for those who hate the crowd
content:
We arrived there on a rainy Friday lunch and was escorted by the guard with an umbrella. The waitress was courteous and the food tasted great! Outdoor dining was the highlight of the entire stay since it was raining and the weather was quite cool....The only complaint we had were the flies flying around our food.

We even went to the store in front to purchase some take home items! Their white choco cake is a must try!

Great place for family reunion lunches!

name: Gourmet Farms
title: recreated as a mediocre tourist restaurant
content: Gourmet Farms used to be one of our favorite stops, but we will not be back. The outdoor setting is pleasant but that is the only good thing I can say about today's visit.  We waited 45 minutes for our lunch to be served--remarkable since...the first course was soup and salad. By the time our pizza arrived, I was sitting direct sun and there were no tables to move to. And the apple pie I ordered for desert never arrived . . .  This was not a pleasant experience that we will not repeat.

name: Gourmet Farms
title: Outdoor dining room is a real treat
content: With the quarantine in full lock down mode, its been a while since we visited. Imagine our surprise to find a full outdoor dining room, with all the favorites we loved inside: a full salad bar along with a drink station outside and major orders...from the kitchen roughly 35 meters away. They've added a 10% surcharge/tip and we added a bit more recognizing the efforts of the staff to get our meal while still warm.

name: Gourmet Farms
title: Perfect spot for not too crowded dinner
content: We love the gourmet pizza! The place has the perfect ambiance to enjoy the food. You can also enjoy the coffee at its cafe shop.

name: Gourmet Farms
title: Santorini Resto
content: We decided for lunch here at gourmet farms. The resto was a santorini style. We amazed on the resto design and the ambiance. There was someone playing piano during the lunch. Their pizza, salmon, calamari and cheesecake are the best. We will surely comeback. When...it comes to price it is a little bit pricey. Dont forget to visit on their store where in you can have a free taste of the lettuce chips and pesto chips with so many choices of dip dressings.

name: Gourmet Farms
title: My family‚Äôs favorite restaurant
content:
Almost all our family special occasions and most lazy saturday or sunday night dinners expect us to be here!
Staffs are accommodating. Waiters are attentive & great service. We love the new addition to their menu! THE CHEESE WHEEL!!! Great clean ambiance and the music...they‚Äôre playing in the restaurant is pleasing to the ears! Foods are pleasing to the taste buds. Big parking space! Clean restrooms! In totality this place is superb!

name: Gourmet Farms
title: Healthy food at reasonable price
content: You can do your own salad at P130 per 85 grams. Reasonable price and the veggies are fresh. Worth to try. We also ordered scampi shrimps with rice and salmon. Desert is also great.

name: Gourmet Farms
title: Nice Ambiance and Delicious food
content: We went here to have a breakfast. The place is spacious and has good feel to it. The food is delicious. We had Tapa and Alaminos longanissa. The place also has a store the sells organic food and local delicacies.

name: Gourmet Farms
title: Tasted the Best Coffee in Town
