content: Tasted so many coffee, gourmet farm specialty is locally grown coffee. I tried the civit coffee and it was so good. It was placed in a french press and it was so good. Although price at 3.60 usd, it was so good. Highly recommended for...coffee liver.

name: Gourmet Farms
title: nice friendly staff
content: Food takes a while to be served,Therefore if you are in a hurry this is not the place for you, I suggest to try the lamb chops, the place is clean and full of nice painting, the owners are very accommodating, the waiters even offered...us to try their home made coffee for free, will come back again,

name: Gourmet Farms
title: Salad Bar = Gourmet Farms
content: Everytime we visit Tagaytay, we really have to pass by this place for the salad bar & soup.. The salad is a bit expensive but have many varieties to choose from.. The staff are friendly & attentive..

name: Gourmet Farms
title: Over-rated.  Don't get value for the money
content: Decided to drop by today after spending a good and restful in THouse Tagaytay.  This is the 3rd visit.  Ordered 3 menu for 4 of us since my daughter isn't exactly hungry.  Didn't wait long and the food was served.  Surprised to see how little...the food serving just like those in fine dining restaurant.  Taste is ordinary too.  Meal at Thouse was far better.  Finally, got the bill for almost 2,000 pesos.  Sorry, but that's just highway robbery.  Never again.

name: Gourmet Farms
title: The best Baraco Coffee!
content:
After having a sumptuous lunch in Tagaytay, we stopped by Gourmet Farms for a nice coffee before heading back home.

Our balikbayan relatives were longing for Barako and Civet coffee and they were indeed very happy that we have brought them in this place.  The...coffee was soooo good along with Silvana cake.  A lot of pasalubong items are available.

I really love this place and will surely come back.  Highly recommended!

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: Mommy's birthday dinner
content: I really like the people who serenade us during pour stay. They sing old classic filipino songs that will be very nostalgic. The food is quite pricey. Serving is okay as well as the service. All in all, the restaurant is nice as well as...its location. Quite a traffic build up upon exiting the restaurant. This is still a must try restaurant in tagaytay.

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: Give it a try..
content: Located along E.Aguinaldo Highway and just several meters away from Tagaytay Flower Market. Known for eat-all-you-can Filipino foods priced at 899 oer head. However, buffet starts just before 12noon ,so, they do accept ala carte. We ordered Bulalo and fried tawilis. Food is ok probably...at 7 out of 10.  Staff were all nice and attentive. Worth trying if i may say.

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: Great Location, Okay Food
content:
The location of the restaurant is great maybe because of the view.
The food was a bit pricey but reasonable for its serving size.
I was a bit disappointed maybe because it feels very different (ambiance-wise) from the last time I ate here.
Kudos to...the singing group but they should wait for the customer to give them a tip instead of asking for a "pamasko" while the customer is eating.

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: Wonderful spot to celebrate a friend's birthday
content:
With many of our favorites closed due to the pandemic, we decided to take a chance on RSM Lutong Bahay and were glad we did. 
Seating is in a cluster of bahay cubos under an elevated metal roof. The result is a very casual, welcoming...environment. The menu is surprisingly large and everybody in our group of six found something they liked. My roast beef over garlic rice was outstanding and I could have easily consumed a second order. 
Unfortunately, staffing is very limited and service suffered. Our drinks arrived after a 20 minute wait and the meal itself required more than 50 minutes to prepare. I don't fault our server who was struggling to entertain six tables, but with things had been a bit faster.

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: Place is relaxing with a Good Buffet
content: One thing I really loved at this place was their location, it was very relaxing fresh air and with a beautiful view. Buffet meal was good also different kinds of viands, you can choose from but some food, was not so delicious. Staffs were accommodating...as well.

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: Sad Bulalo
content: It‚Äôs a long trip from QC to Tagaytay, we‚Äôve been craving for a hot good Bulalo soup. We‚Äôve had a good one before at RSM, so we endured the traffic at Tagaytay - Nasugbu Highway. Unfortunately, their Bulalo now is not good, there are only...beef meat. A bone was there but nothing in it, no tendon, no meat. It was a sad Bulalo soup with just string beans & cabbage. Not worth it for the price of P730 per order, travel to RSM is also not worth it, we‚Äôre very disappointed.

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: LOVED IT!
content: I'm so glad we came to this place instead of any of its neighbors. What a great restaurant! Gorgeous view, delicious Filipino food, lovely ambience. Will be my go-to place in Tagaytay from now on!

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: Very poor service
content: Food took almost an hour to serve.. and was served food by food... chicken and pork with smell not fresh.. tastes bland and reheat several times... over priced.. food and service not woth your money.. definitely NOT going back!!

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: Family Time!
content:
My family and I had lunch in this restaurant to celebrate my nephew‚Äôs birthday. 

It wasn‚Äôt busy as what we were expecting. We were sitting in the corner where you could see the fantastic view of Tagaytay! And it‚Äôs really really amazing!!! 

We ordered Crispy...Pata, Fried Tawilis, Bulalo, Grilled Pusit, Pancit and Kilawin. Everything was delicious although for me, the Fried Tawilis wasn‚Äôt fresh. We had fresh green mango shake and mango shake too which was so refreshing! 

The band added an extra excitement in the restaurant. Thank you for singing happy birthday for my nephew!üòä 

Would we come back? Of course! I would love come back and see the beautiful Tagaytay again.

Service- 3* (should be more attentive not only to other nationality) Love your own Kabayan folks!üòâ

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: Superb Buffet
content:
With 21 dishes to choose from, our lunch buffet was a great deal! Steaming hot bulalo will always be the best when in Tagaytay. I tried all the dishes and all tasted good but I just love the Ginataang Suahe! So many choices for fruits...and desserts too, plus the juices and hot coffee. 

I must say that it's a money well-spent when you dine in at RSM Lutong Bahay. Highly recommended and will definitely come back! üëçüòä

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: A good buffet restaurant
content: The restaurant offers a good number of dishes for its buffet. Basic Filipino dishes such as kare kare, lechon kawali and barbecue meats are cooked the traditional and right way.

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: Sisig is real
content: Its eat all you can buffet where in there a lot of delicious choices viand like crispy sisig, lechon belly, kare-kare, bulalo and many more. Good taal volcano view..

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: Buffet is worth it
content: We had a dinner buffet during weekend and good thing when we arrived there's still plenty of table available. Selection of food is wide and a you can have all you want in a rewarding day in their buffet menu. Shirmp, Crispy liempo, Kare kare,...Beef with broccoli, Bbq, sushi and other. Staff was attentive as well in dishing out our used plates. price is worth it with the buffet food they are offering.

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: RSM Lutong Bahay Tagaytay Philippines
content: The lunch buffet was very appetising and enjoyable. All Filipino cuisine and very native and delicious.Complete meal buffet with drinks. The Taal Volcano was overlooking and after the meal you can go there enjoy relax and fresh air.

name: RSM Lutong Bahay
title: Good buffet
content: We had dinner here. It was a buffet night during weekends. There were lechon, sushis, beef lengua, shrimps, pork sisig, fruits, salads, banana with syrup, and juices plus coffee.

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: Excellent Food
content: Service and food were both excellent. Highly recommended. The steaks are well cooked and portions are big.

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: Great experience
content: We had a wonderful and memorable celebration at Verbena! Their staff were so accommodating, warm and courteous. Not only did they accommodate my requests on a semi customized menu but was generous in totality! They set up our long table beautifully. The food was sumptuous...and excellently prepared.  The platings were beautiful! When you book, must look for Abby - 5 star service! I only have beautiful things to say about them. We made the right choice celebrating my birthday with you. Thank you Verbena team!üòç

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: Awesome Gastronomic Experience!
content: breakfast was superb! most especially the Country Benedict! a symphony of flavors bursting in my mouth! ordered it for 3 straight days and still can't get enough of it! the tapa, pancakes and continental buffet was also good!

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: Great Brunch at Past 2pm
content: We arrived for lunch as past 2pm due to the heavy traffic coming from Nasugbu.  They still had their buffet brunch available.  The selection was of good quality and value for money - salad station, bread, omelet station, potato au gratin with truffle sauce, grilled...vegetables, salmon confit, very tender pork belly in a special sauce, sous vide fillet mignon, fried chicken w/ biscuit and gravy and a very lovely cheesecake and bread pudding for dessert.  Staff were very accommodating.

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: Overpriced, average food
content:
Tried their plated breakfast that came with the hotel package.  We were allowed to select one among the choices on top of a selection of assorted fruits, bread, juices, milk, coffee/tea/hot chocolate.  The portion was just right to make one full, although taste and quality...were pretty average.  The hot chocolate was no longer "hot" when served so I requested it to be warmed.  Pitchers of fruit juices were dipped in water, not ice and there were no ice dispensers around, so just imagine drinking them at room temperature.  The assorted fruits were limited in variety.  The mangoes were overripe.  

Tried also their dinner on the night we checked in.  The restaurant barely had any other guests except us at about half past 6.  There were more selections in the menu, but rather pricey and thus not commensurate to the food quality/taste.  

The restaurant was clean and offered a nice view of the lake.  But it lacked the ambience and coziness of a fine dining restaurant.

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: Service at its best
content:
The service for both the suites and restaurant is consistently top notch.

We decided to just eat in and avoid the Saturday evening Tagaytay traffic.

The complimentary rolls are fresh off the oven, soft and sweet.

The kids enjoyed the basket of fries.  My son...had the Fish and Chips and boxed the leftovers since the serving was big.

My daughter and I shared the Lechon Kawali which was done perfectly.  The skin was crunchy why the meat melts in your mouth.

My wife had the Salpicao though it was a bit to sweet and the tenderloin used had some tendon.

We didn‚Äôt have dessert as we decided to walk next door for some coffee and pastries.

Breakfast the next day was just as superb.  My daughter had the corned beef while my son had the eggs benedict and both were happy.  My wife and I both had the regions breakfast with 2 kinds of longganisa, dried fish and egg.  You can also help yourself to various breads and spreads, juices and fruits.

Always a pleasure staying and dining at Discovery Country Suites.

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: Delicious Breakfast
content: We went for breakfast here.  The view was beautiful.  The restaurant was nice and quiet. The breakfast menu had limited western-style choices, but we both ordered the Eggs Benedict and it was really delicious.  The eggs were poached to perfection (something very hard to find...in the Philippines).  The price included a coffee and access to a small buffet of fresh fruit, cereal, pastries and bread.  The service was great.

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: Verbena Restaurant Discovery Country Suites
content: Great dining experience.  The inclusive breakfast has a nice choice of menu so it allows variety if you spend a few days.  The all day menu provides a varied choice of items for lunch, snacks and dinner.  Service is fantastic and you also have good...view of Taal Lake from Tagaytay Ridge.

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: Dine With a View at the Restaurant Verbena
content:
Am so excited to share our dining experience and how we went a little lavish enjoying a full board meal at the Restaurant Verbena, that‚Äôs critically lauded as one of the ‚Äòbest restaurants in Tagaytay‚Äò, and we were so thrilled then to indulge ourselves.

Oh...dear!  It has been an ultimate dining experience for a foodie family like us!  Every dish was beautifully served with locally sourced and farm-fresh ingredients.  As you scroll down the page of this blog, get ready to feast your eyes and drool over these mouthwatering food photos that am very much excited to share with you.
And oh, we soooo love the fresh air and green surroundings with a magnificent view of the Taal Lake!

Indeed, it‚Äôs been a happy family day that we have a happy appetite too to savour the hearty and healthy dishes that was served to us for Lunch.

We‚Äôve picked a variety of best sellers from the a la carte menu, and this large hot pot filled with flavorful, soft, melty mozzarella cheese as a dip to a warm focaccia have kick start our appetite!

Is there anything more soothing than a bowl of this reach and creamy soup?

It was also nice to add some more greens to balance our plate with a delicious and fresh salad‚Ä¶

This cheesy Prawns Termidor is truly a seafood delight!

I‚Äôve always been a fan of Ribeye Steak, and the tender melt in your mouth of this decadent cut of steak is so worthy of the price!

The salmon skin on top of the dish is so crisp, and the pink fillet is so rich and buttery!

My little spaghetti monster had a full plate of this all for himself!  üòâ

A taste of Filipino-style cheesecake in a richer,creamier, and cheesier way!

Chocolate lovers‚Ä¶ this warm, ooey, gooey chocolate chip cookie topped with vanilla bean ice cream is perfect for you!

Oh dear, we‚Äôve eaten quite a large meal that we ended up stuffed after an indulgent lunch, so we got sleepy and took some siesta time (afternoon nap)!

Then came the evening, a Set Dinner for 2 with a 4-course meal awaited us.

We started off with the Soup of the Day- Asparagus Cream Soup ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs pure comfort in a bowl üòâ

This deliciously succulent Barramundi is made more delectable with butter sauce and served on top of Edamame. I shared this plate with my little boy, and he loved it as well too üôÇ

While the husband enjoyed this juicy and incredibly tender Braised Beef, the little boy liked the taste of the veggie side dish!

Sigh we‚Äôd love to try the Panna Cotta though the restaurant had run out of it.  Instead, we had this sweet and smooth baked custard Creme Flan.

The next day, we were so excited to start the day having an exceptionally good Country Breakfast‚Ä¶

I‚Äôve always believed that when eating a balanced breakfast, you‚Äôll surely have a better morning üòâ

And oh, may I say this in Tagalog, ‚ÄúGustung-gusto ko talaga ang manga!‚Äù  I just love eating mango regardless if it is green or ripe üòâ

Me and my husband got excited as we‚Äôve been served with a warm, thick, bittersweet Tsokolate de Batirol and a perfect pair of Hot Pandesal with Coconut Jam spread.  A variety of freshly baked breads and pastries are so delicious too!

Since we woke up a bit late, we decided to pick the Mains from the Country Breakfast Menu.

My husband had this perfectly marinated tender Beef Tapa that went well with garlic fried rice and fried egg.

‚Ä¶and for myself, it may not be ideal, but I couldn‚Äôt miss not having this all time favorite Filipino breakfast, Garlic Longganisa!

It has been priceless moments to bring our family together over good food and meaningful conversations.

Our smiles and cheers to the Chef and Team of Restaurant Verbena for your warm hospitality and excellent service that brought us with a full belly and a happy heart!

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: Attentive servers
content: We stumbled upon this place last weekend.  We had lunch.  For 6 people our bill was P3200.00 (bangus, tapa, adobo, 6 cups rice, 1 panna cotta).  Their servers/waiters were very attentive, it reminded me of good restaurants abroad.  Food was good and the interior was...really nice.  Two restrooms, one for female and one for male.  Taal Volcano is only partly visible.  In the photo I attached you can‚Äôt see it, it‚Äôs on the right hand side.

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: Fine & Relaxing Dining experience
content:
The Ambiance & menu choices were superb!
We had our light dinner with rounds of drinks
Christmas decors were simply elegant

Will be back again

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: One of the best restaurants in Tagaytay
content:
Everything is perfect: the ambiance, professional staff, great tasting food.

Though very limited options for vegetarian (please correct the description).

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: Prelude to My Wife's birthday
content: It was the night before my wife's birthday and since we stayed at Nantucket and we're already in Tagaytay I was thinking of eating out of the hotel but unfortunately it rained hard that night and it was a blessing in disguise co'z since we...cannot go out to eat we tried Verbana and it blew us away! The staff was great alwaysready to assist the food was delicious if we could only try all of them at once hehe it made our night, hats off to Verbana!

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: Very good food, ambience and service! Must try!
content:
We had our dinner last night and felt like we rented the whole restaurant to ourselves!
We were looking for a nice restaurant and this was recommended by Zomato.
And we are glad that we picked Verbena. 
My Bf was amazed on how the food...is presented and quality of food is superb!
The ambiece is so good and felt like we had a personal butler! Not that we wanted to have one but we were impressed on how we were accommodated. We were also surprised on the complimentary cake! 
For me the food price is competitive and fair based on the quality of food, service and place. 
Definitely we will be back and recommend Verbena to our family and friends!
Thank you so much for making our Anniversary Dinner amazing! We enjoyed every minute at Verbena!
More power!

name: Restaurant Verbena
title: Lovely Anniversary Dinner
content:
Had a very hearty dinner here in Verbena. 
All the Staff are very accommodating. 
Good food for a good price. 

Considering it's a Monday, there are still a good number of diners but not too crowded though.
Would be back again for sure.

Oh, I...love renovation and the interiors too!

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: BEST AND DELICIOUS FILIPINO CUISINE
content: A decent, relaxing place that offers reasonably-priced home-cooked meals. Food generally tastes like how you'd cook it at home, so you're basically paying for the convenience. A single serving size is good for 1 heavy eater. <3

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: Onion Sisig
content: I ordered Pork Sisig and got an Onion Sisig (pork is missing)‚Ä¶ they told us that it‚Äôs 250 grams of pork, but it doesn‚Äôt look like 250 grams for me. You be the judge..

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: bahay-kubo resto
content:
we were still undecided where to spend our lunch on our way back to bulacan from spending a weekend in tagaytay. balinsasayaw's signage caught our attention from afar and decided to give it a try. it was a delightful experience since my son's birthday fell...also on that day. he was very happy to celebrate it with his cousins. we devoured three orders of sisig, crispy pata kare-kare, whole fried chicken, pancit bihon-canton guisado, balinsasayaw express, chop suey, beef kaldereta and 2 platters of rice. it was a feast fit for more than a dozen people. and we're only 9.

it took 36 minutes before all our orders were served simultaneously but it's worth the long wait.

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: BALINSASAYAW: a perfect combination of good food and ambience
content: Visiting the final resting place of one of our dogs in Pet Valley Cemetery was our main purpose in driving to Silang. I asked the receptionist for a good place to eat and she instantly recommended Balinsasayaw. Upon our arrival at the restaurant, we didn‚Äôt...expect that we would have our own cottage or kubo, which makes social distancing effortless. The waiter assigned to us recommended the crispy pata, pinakbet and halu-halo. We took his advice and the rest is history! The crispy pata was fried to perfection without being oily. The vegetables used in the pinakbet were fresh and crunchy while the halu-halo was simply divine. All dishes are good for 3-4 persons so we had a lot of leftovers. The restaurant staff is very attentive and friendly, and the prices of the food are reasonable. Balinsasayaw is a nice place to treat balikbayans who will have a taste of authentic Filipino food in an equally authentic Filipino setting. We cannot wait to be back!

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: Wide range of Filipino favorites
content: Our family was on our way to Batangas for the weekend and we stopped over for lunch at Balinsasayaw.  We easily got parking. Yes!  Then we got a table for 12 which took a while since it was lunchtime. The service is self-service cafeteria style...- you just point and it will be placed on a dish/bowl for you.  The number of dishes is awesome - bulalo (beef marrow soup), adobo, barbeque, sinigang, sweet & sour fish, menudo, paksiw, ginataang gulay, tortang talong, bicol express... Think of any Filipino favorite and most likely its there.  You get your own soda/juice from their fridge, and when you're done, a girl will come over to the table and hand you a bill.  We were a family of 12 and our orders did not even reach P2,000.  Really affordable and tastes good too.  You can order take out and some dessert if you still have room.  A very satisfying lunch indeed.

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: A Friendly Surprise
content:
Today we had dinner at Balinsasayaw in Silang. What an absolutely wonderful experience. The ambience is superb -- we had dinner in a small and comfy bahay kubo. The service was prompt and friendly, the food was fabulous and large portions, We had baked bangs...and bison with a large plate of Balinsasayaw's famous rice. 

Our son was celebrating his 5th birthday so this made a visit even more special. He very much enjoyed hid Banana Split -- and without us even asking he was served with a small cheese cake with a candle and singing of Happy Birthday. All the servers were very nice and when we were ready to leave the very gracious and kind manager lady stopped by our cube to say thank you. 

This place is very popular and for very good reasons. We will definitely be back here again.

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: Go Native Dinner
content:
Although we were craving for something not native, the small huts really impressed us from the highway, so we chose to eat here.  

I would recommend the Chicken Binakol since the taste was really something new to me.  Nope, it doesn‚Äôt taste like Tinola but...I was expecting it to taste like one.  I got disappointed with the Balinsasayaw shake.  I was expecting something spectacular after all the answers when I asked what it was.  It tasted like common Mango shake to me...sorry.

If you want to go native and would like to impress your foreigner friends, visitors, and/or office mates and brag about our native food and ambiance, I suggest you take them here.

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: WORST FOOD
content: place was very attractive from the outside but once your there and dine in - from the utensils and plates. they used very cheap. it doesnt equal to their pricey menu. and what was worst are the food. taste like no one knows how to...cook in that resto. im sorry but i hope this resto should improve a lot.

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: Average Restaurant
content: You paid for the ambiance and parking, pricey for little serving, taste average. You may want to try it just once. Service crew is very good.

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: Going Native
content: Came here as recommended by a friend. Ordered barbeque pork, chicken tuna and pork rib with rice, bulalo soup and noodles. Beef soup was good, pork barbeque was well grilled, butslightly tough. Noodle very tadty. The experience inside a hutwith mosquito net was good. It...was cheap and may want totry their otherdelicacies.

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: Affordable and Delicious Food
content: Food is great. You can even buy your own tawilis and request the resto crew to cook it for you.  The bulalo is good, ambiance is adorable and the staff are nice and smiling

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: Nips hut style restaurant
content: It‚Äôs a very nice restaurant with a good view from the top nila hut..  service is okey and foods are yummy. The fried milkfish or the bangus was the biggest milkfish I‚Äôve ever seen. Pansit taste yummy too. Halo halo is serve in S coconut...shell so it‚Äôs appealing. Price is not that expensive too. It cost only P3500 for 11 people. We ordered 3 big mil fish , sinigang batboy, nilaga baboy, torta talong , signature Kanin, halo halo, tokwat baboy, pinakbet , pansit, water purified , 4 beers , nilaga okra and bill is only P3500..not bad for so much foods and take away. Very much recommended., just don‚Äôt go late.. last order is 9pm, you need to be there before 7 for dinner meal

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: good experienced on my first visit
content: dinner at 7 pm and still was good, we had the dinner to their branch nearby aceinda outlet amadeo. the place was beautiful and has a very unque set up for the table.its bahay kubo style with mosquito net so we are all safe

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: Best Pad Thai ever!
content:
I usually don‚Äôt leave that many reviews but I feel like this restaurant deserved one. The people were so nice, the prices are good and the food was amazing. I had the best pad thai ever. We went back here the next day just because...we liked this place so much. The waiter remembered our food preferences from the day before.
Also, the restaurant and the surrounding garden look beautiful. I would definitely recommend this place!

name: Balinsasayaw Restaurant
title: Needs Consistency in Quality & Service
content:
First time that my family had lunch here was a clear win for a 5-star rating. Everything that we ordered were satisfying and gave us a delightful experience.  That caused us to dine there again, albeit we did not have the same experience.

There were...relatively more customers than our first visit so we just ordered the same combo meals for each for easy preparation and then ordered other dishes ala carte. First disappointment was the waiting time, which is almost 45 minutes. Second was the serving size in which the three got almost the same sizes while mine was obviously only about half of what was served to the rest. Third was the fresh lumpia with my daughter's share having a sour taste.  She tried mine and it tastes different.  They replaced it but with the same sour taste unlike what was served to me which was ok. Then the very disappointing fresh buko which we followed up since our meals were served but we are already about to finish and no fresh buko has arrived.  Calling the waiter for the last time, the waiter said everyone in the kitchen was busy and nobody can prepare the fresh buko for us. But we saw a couple of waiters bringing fresh buko at other tables after I talked to the waiter. 

I demanded that our drinks be replaced with a new one, free of charge, because it was not an issue of being out of stock but an issue of nobody can prepare, meaning it is still available.  The manager gave us free drinks and apologized.

Food is great and gives you value for your money.  But only if they will be consistent in their quality and service.  I am still recommending this restaurant with the hope that they will improve after reading this.

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: Very good filipino food
content: The restaurant is part of the view park hotel. It can be quiet but the food and service is very good and showcases there twists in filipino regional dishes. Would definately return when back in the area

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: A Restaurant That Cares
content:
Siglo is the in-house restaurant of the charming View Park Hotel.  It prides itself with the use of local ingredients for dishes that hail from Luzon to Mindanao.  We had breakfast here for three days since we were booked at View Park Hotel which included...breakfast in our package.  Breakfast was plated a la carte with rice, eggs and a main viand such as bacon, tapa, daing na bangus, etc.

During our first night, we had dinner at Siglo since we just wanted a quiet & relaxing place to have dinner after a long drive from Manila.  We ordered grilled St. John's fish (Tilapia) with a side dish of tomatoes and onions and fresh young coconut (buko) juice served straight from the coconut.  We enjoyed our meal that we decided to just have dinner there for the next two nights we were in Tagaytay and try their other dishes.  We were not disppointed, in fact we enjoyed the laing and pinakbet that we ordered during the succeeding nights.  

Their serving is good for two persons.  We would order only one dish since the serving was sufficient for the two of us.  Had we ordered another dish there would definitely be left overs.  And we would not have fully enjoyed the savory laing and pinakbet and the grilled tilapia.  

The tilapia was grilled superbly without any signs of blood.  It was juicy and not overly grilled and dry.  The laing had just the right spicy kick without burning your palate and the coconut cream and the yam (gabi) leaves gave the right texture to the dish.  And the pinakbet was a complete dish with mixed vegetables (squash, okra, egg plant,bitter gourd (ampalaya) etc.)and pork bagnet in shrimp paste (bagoong alamang, Ilocanos would usually use anchovy sauce or ginamos).  Each meal with drinks averaged PHP700-800.  We charged our dinners to our room and settled it with a credit card upon checking out of View Park Hotel.

Service was prompt (unlike other reviews mentioning a long wait) probably because since we were booked at View Park Hotel, we placed our orders  two hours before our meal. I think they cook your chosen dish when you order it, thus keeping it fresh.  While waiting for their order, guests could just chit chat or look around and take pictures at the different instagrammable spots of View Park Hotel.  Food attendants were also constantly looking out if we had needs to be attended to.  

While we were dining there, there were only around two other tables that were occupied.  The tables and chairs had that antique feels in keeping up with its name, Siglo.  One table even had an antique sewing machine as its base.  The chairs and benches had hard wood without any cushions so it could be quite a killer on your butt if you wait a long time for your meal.  Probably they could have cushions on some of the chairs so that patrons could choose whether they want to sit on hard wood or on cushioned chairs.

While the dishes were excellent, I feel they have to work a little bit on their beverages.  As previously mentioned, on our first night we had buko juice straight from the coconut.  The juice was refreshing but I felt that the juice came from a matured coconut.  After drinking the juice, we requested that the coconut be broken open so that we could get to the coconut meat.  I was right that the coconut was mature and the meat was not soft and slushy as young coconuts would be.  Perhaps, they should choose their coconuts more judiciously or get a more reliable buko (young coconut) supplier.

On our second night,  we chose to have cucumber shake.   Cucumber is light and refreshing but when it is a shake it becomes a bit heavy and when I sipped the shake about a  fifth of the glass was ice sludge with cucumber residue.  Cucumber juice with kalamansi and honey would have been more satisfying to me.

The service staff professionally attended to the diners.  Rico, the restaurant manager trained his staff well.  In fact, while we were having breakfast, we overheard him emphasizing to the new trainees the value of punctuality.   He said that they should be there fifteen minutes before the appointed time so that they could have a little time to prepare themselves for their shift.

I felt that Rico could probably talk to his staff outside the dining area out of the earshot of diners.  Some diners might misinterpret the training negatively.  But for a training practitioner like me, I felt that the trainees are lucky to have a restaurant manager who is committed and cares to train and guide them.

Overall I would give Siglo a high rating and would endorse it to diners who are in the Tagaytay area for a quiet, relaxing and satisfying meal.

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: Place is Quiet, Relaxing
content:
This restaurant is very nice, and very easy to access!
Guards there are happy to assist you in parking.

Place is so quiet and giving me nostalgia.. very Filipino-themed. I love Filipino foods!

Waiters are approachable, nice and most of all, following instructions.

The food,...well, its pricey but I was surprised that they serve in large amounts. Sulit. Aside from that, taste is very unique and delicious.

Will definitely go back here... if you want less crowd and want to be private with your significant other, this is a place to go üíñ

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: Enjoying local delicacies
content: The competition is quite tight in Tagaytay (with so many restaurants and eateries to choose from) and tourists may not know where to go to try some of our very own local dishes. I would personally recommend Siglo Modern Filipino restaurant. The place is a...bit old, but its aged ambiance adds to the beauty of the place. It reminds of our old ancestral house. Anyway, given the restrictions and health protocols nowadays, indoor dining can accommodate only about a dozen people at a time. The menu had a long list of local (Filipino) dishes representing the different regions of the country. I tried their "bulalo," crispy pork "binagoongan," and "binagoongan rice." Our order was served some 30mins later. We really didn't mind waiting for we knew that the foods had to be cooked fresh and besides we enjoyed exploring the nearby Siglo Brew caf√© and View Park Hotel in the meantime. It was worth the wait for the foods tasted great. Compared with other restaurants in the area, the prices here are very modest. Indeed, we had a hearty meal and enjoyed the cool breeze of Tagaytay!

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: Exemplary Service
content:
The food was good, the ambience were great. It combines the Filipino carinderya nature and the hospitality of the Filipinos. There were a few people eating and looks understaffed when more people will eat. For me, this is a rough diamond that just needed a...little more polish.

Oh btw, At the moment, they are not accepting Cards. Something that is needed to bear in mind who prefer no-contact transactions / cashless people like me.

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: Nice platings, generous serving.
content: Make sure to try out some meals here sa Siglo whenever mag stay kayo somewhere near. So sulit! We had two meals here pero hindi swamped ng tao yung restaurant both times.

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: Doesn't care with their customers...
content:
Our family visited this restaurant for lunch. We chose this place because we've known this place with a very accommodating people to serve you..aside from the fact that their food is good. 

It was when we arrived that I felt the service has gone bad......Without any suggestion and options to offer, that service guy in white polo shirt instantly told me that there is no available/vacant table. Passing by the veranda of this resto, I've seen there are 2 tables that are vacant without "reserved" sign on the table. Then that guy in blue polo shirt approached us and asked how many were we. After telling him, he gave us the table outside. Theu could have checked their area first before turning down a customer. üòíüòíüòí

Then, this was the most annoying and i-really-couldnt-accept thing in this place... There were 3 staff arranging our table as we transferred table from the other side due to uncomfy area, NO ONE BOTHERED TO ASK US OUR ORDERS!  Isn't that it's an sop when someone sits in your dining area, as a restaurant, you should ask orders??? We were already waiting for quarter an hour already and no one bothered to came to take our orders. Fyi, it was past 1pm already.

Tsk, tsk, tsk... What happened to your service Siglo???

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: Fine Restaurant
content: Masarap naman. Worth the pay :) Medyo matagal magserve kasi siguro lunch time yun. me Hotel adjacent to the hotel so okay din if you want to stay for awhile sa tagaytay. i judt dont know how much haha

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: A Must Go Restaurant in Tagaytay
content: We are a group of ten from Hong Kong. I have been in the Philippines many times but some of my friends are first-timers, so I want to leave them a good impression of Filipino food. Their Bulalo and Crispy Pata are the best I...have ever tasted all through the years, and the Beef Kulma is also very delicious. Another must-try is their Ripe Mango Shake. Btw, search for View Park Hotel instead of Siglo if you use the Google map to locate the restaurant. Google map's positioning of Siglo is wrong.

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: One of the best restaurant in tagaytay.
content:
Must try: Bulalo, adobo chicken,  buko halo halo, seafood kare kare, pinakbet
Friendly staff and nice environment

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: Great Food; hospitable and friendly staff
content:
Amazing hospitality and delicious food. I can really say that every dish is passionately made.

Beef bulalo: one of the best I've tasted in Tagaytay
Must try! Adobo chicken and Halo Halo dessert: there's a special twist. 
Seafood Kare kare and Pinakbet: the best!
And...I absolutely loved the krispy sweet potato

We will definitely come back!

Congrats for having the best chef and very accomodating staff.

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: BreakFast @ Siglo
content:
Siglo is the restaurant of Park view Hotel where we stayed last March 2019.

The BF is a set meal with the best roasted coffee.

The serving is enough and good for 1 person.

You can order extra viands for 65php If the set meal...is note enough for you.

I did not like their sausage , but the Ham, Bacon, Tapa and tocino is good.

BF cost around 180 to 200php since this is included on our room payments.

Adding extra bacon is enough for our meal.

The service si fine , food is good . Nothing special other than their restaurant  motif and ofcrz the weather.

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: Poor service
content: We wanted to try a new resto near Tagaytay Highlands.  Some reviews of this particular resto is 4.8, so we thought it's worth the try.  I had 3 senior citizens with me, and we ordered pinakbet (they must have cooked it with sweeet bagoong, but...tasted alright), bangus (they poured mushroom soup on top of it, taste was so-so), bistek (waiter said it's tender, it wasn't) and halo-halo in a coconut (it was warm, we wanted to cool ourselves that why we ordered this and it was very sweet). We had leftovers, we asked the waiter to pack it for us, the paper bag was dripping and he still placed it on our table.  We had to tell him to repack it for us, I couldn't believe it, he was such a pig! I wouldn't go back to this place again.  Very disappointed.

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: No fuss, flavourful
content: Must try Manok sa Dilaw!  Matched with the cucumber with calamansi twist, had a really tasty, aptly-sauced, and what seemed like native chicken that really soaked in the flavouring. Only regret was we got too full to try dessert 8-)

name: Siglo Modern Filipino
title: Food is good, even vegetarian
content: This was our first visit to this new restaurant after they changed the name and concept. We liked the ambiance. We were glad that they now had available vegetarian options after we talked with the chef. They were very accommodating and made our dinner really...pleasant. We intend to go back.

name: Leslie's
title: Salty BULALO
content:
The bulalo wasn‚Äôt so good today üòë
Service wasn‚Äôt so good also and the crew are always looking for the tips
Leslie Tagaytay

name: Leslie's
title: Wow bulalo
content:
I wasn‚Äôt my first time to visit the resto, extend there multiples times already and I love it. I would say it was the best bulalo in town. Me not so expensive too. 
I would like to commend the good customer service they have, they...refill our soup without being told. They were proactive and they serve fast. 
And it has wonderful view to taal too. 
One thing I didn‚Äôt like was the toilet it was too small and it could get crowded. I mean this Is a huge resto and lots of people go and ate there. I think it‚Äôs fair to suggest to build bigger toilets. That‚Äôs all.

name: Leslie's
title: Highly recommended!
content: We moved here and at first the receptionist was around and very accommodating she handled the line professionally and waiting time took only 10 minutes and after we were seated despite that the staffs were busy which we understood all orders came at the right...sequence food was amazing. Very satisfied customer

name: Leslie's
title: Family Dinner and Surprise
content: Had one of the best dinners here when I get back in the Philippines. They offer best items on their menu. I really like the serenade also of the local singer/s and musician. They offer live music from table-to-table. Will go back here, definitely. I...like the food - the bulalo, chopsuey, their tuna panga and belly. Worth the try! The food is quite pricey but I believe that you are paying for the location. lol. still, a must try.

name: Leslie's
title: Luke warm bulalo
content:
We dine 7pm on a Monday night at their main dinning , order bulalo & it came luke warm, we had to ask another extra soup that luckily came hot, not long table beside us also complain and received extra hot soup only for d...bulalo ( beef shank soup )
Our grill squid come rare and had to return for them to cook properly
Others like sizzling kangkong, sisig & grill chicken Ok

name: Leslie's
title: lunch
content: Our party had a very sumptous lunch. Very tasty Bulalo and sago. The veranda is overlooking the lake and volcano. Pleasnt staff and good parking. a bit of a hike for people with limited mobility

name: Leslie's
title: Not coming back here
content: We ordered bulalo, relyenong bangus and lechon kawali. They served the whole dishes after around 15mins of waiting only to find out that the beef is still not fully cooked. It was hard to divide! Relyenong bangus was very salty. Requested for condiments but staff...didn‚Äôt get back to us. We had a lot of leftover. Price not worth it. Very disappointed. Not coming back here again.

name: Leslie's
title: so disappointed
content: if there negative zero rating , i wil give, food was too expensive and not worth for the price.walang lasa! napaka unhygienic magserve, tulo tulu sabaw ng veggie , my gosh!no common sense nagseserve , kakain ka ng crabs walang extra plate paglagyan ng pinagkainan,...no extra spoon for soup and no serving spoon for ulam, palitan nio chef nio and all staff needs f and b training

name: Leslie's
title: The View.
content:
Good Filipino Foods.
Good view.
Courteous staff.
Reasonable price.
Ample parking areas.
Responsive staff.
Good restaurant.

name: Leslie's
title: Waste of time!
content: Can give a zero rating? Food did not arrive until 45 minutes later after several follow ups. By then we had to leave for a meeting. Cancelled the order but they still insisted to serve. Left them there. Total waste of time! They have not...improved their service after years of customer‚Äôs complaints and dissatisfaction. Not coming back ever!

name: Leslie's
title: Money Wasted
content: No taste, sayang pera, overpriced, wag na kayo pumunta dito, also bad service, yung rice 70php per cup, subrang mahal

name: Leslie's
title: Don't drive by this iconic restaurant
content: Classic Filipino cuisine served amidst a breathtaking background. We ate lunch here in the way home and requested overlooking seats. Civid precautions being followed, it was dining al fresco anyhow. Enough spaces between tables in the common area in my opinion. Service was quick until...the Halo-Halo part. Everything we ordered was gone quickly !

name: Leslie's
title: Poor service. Long waiting time. Not worth the price
content:
Honestly speaking, I paid for the view and not for the food that I ate. 

I was not satisfied with the services they provided. There were staff around passing our table but when we needed some assistance they will just look at us and continue...to walk away. We need to approach them personally to ask for help and assistance. We needed to follow up our orders because it really took time. 

The food was average. Nothing special for my own perspective. Their bulalo didn‚Äôt taste as good as I expected. It was overrated. 

And again, as I always says, bring your own water. Their 1 liter bottled water costs 78php. 

Upon payment, we also have to look for them to pay our bill. Service is very poor. 

If you‚Äôll ask me if Ill come back? Definitely not. 

*do not bring your child or senior member of you family. They will not allow them to enter.

name: Leslie's
title: The Moment matches the Memory
content: Leslie‚Äôs is a popular restaurant among Tagaytay frequents - and very deservingly so. The serving portions are HUGE for the price point, and cooked to perfection. Must trys are the Signature Bulalo (ask for more marrow, if wanted), Pinakbet (delicious), Bicol Express and Sugpo sa...Aligue. You won‚Äôt regret it. It‚Äôs our second Christmas here and the first since the Covid saga began. Without a doubt, in our second visit (and many to come)... the moment matches the memory.

name: Leslie's
title: Breathtaking View
content: It was an amazing experience dining while site seeing.  The food was great and loved the bulalo.  The servers are always ready to assist the customers.  It was a nice experience.

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: Fair Place for beef stew
content: Hard to differentiate what restaurant in Tagaytay has the best tasting bulalo . Simple place , adequate menu selection. Choose between original and special bulalo. There are the pompano and tawilis fish. As well as pork liempo grill and crispy kangkong. Felt stuffed up after...the meal. Ambiance has homey atmosphere with attentive staff. Don‚Äôt miss the sizzling plate choices as well

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: The best place in Tagaytay to eat Bulalo. Specially, when you are with your friends and family.
content: The food and service is SUPERB! The best place in Tagaytay to eat Bulalo. Specially, when you are with your friends and family.

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: Meh.
content:
Bulalo's soup tastes good however the meat seemed bland and dry for some reasons to me.
Sizzling chicken's meat is overcooked. Not tender.
We ate here on our last day at Tagaytay and was really disappointed.

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: Bulalo Point Review
content: Good place to get freshly cooked bulalo. The place can get busy on weekends. The staff are all great.

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: Fast service! Good food! üëå
content: My 3rd time to dine. Still yummy their food. Fast serving of food. Mabilis ang order. That‚Äôs why everytime punta akong Tagaytay d2 ako kumakain talaga. Mabilis ang order even dami tao. Hope they will maintain their good service and good , hearty food.

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: Value for Money Food
content: Families flock Bulalo Point because of their affordable and good-for-sharing menu. You might experience a little wait especially night dining but it's definitely worth the wait when you try their Bulalo that can be refilled with soup.

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: Good for Family!
content:
Meal: The food is delicious and not too pricey. 

Ambiance: It has a great view and lots of seating. 

Price: It's not too cheap, not too pricey. You can feed your whole family without spending a lot.

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: Bulalo Fever
content: Me and my hubby enjoyed the bulalo so much. We also ordered grilled liempo but a bit diasappointed as it tastes like lechon kawali. But overall, the foods are great.

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: nice restaurant
content: good food and nice ambience. we always go here to eat with my family. the staff are very nice and courteous.

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: Nice food
content: Bulalo point is a must for me everytime me and partner goes to Tagaytay. Ambiance is nice and food are delicious. Aside from their Bulalo, bangus is 1 of the dish that i always order.

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: Very popular
content:
As Bulalo goes, I actually liked the bulalo kare kare more than the special bulalo, but the special bulalo was actually good enough.  There was no more tawilis because of the ban on catching the fish from the lake.  The bangus we had was not...good, as it had a smell.  I believe that is because the bangus came from the lake, which is freshwater.  Bangus from the sea or from a brackish water tastes better.  The rest of our food, like the different veggies: pinakbet, kangkong, etc. were good, same with the blue marlin and the pork based food.

Tables and seats are very crowded, and getting around will require some "excuse me" to pass through.

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: Fall of the bones beef bulalo
content:
Tagaytay is known for their Maliputo Fish, Tawilis, and Bulalo Soup. I think this is one the popular restaurants in the city. The place is packed when we went here. Good thing we were able to sit after 5-10 mins of waiting. 

The bulalo soup...tastes really good. The meat is very tender and flavorful. The soup is thankfully unlimited. You could ask for more soup in case you ran out.

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: Kare-kare Bulalo: a must try
content:
How to get there: we had our hotel near Picnic Grove. Going to bulalo point from Picnic Grove via tricycle (the yellow or blue) is 300 pesos. So we opt for another mode of transpo which is Jeepney. Just wait for jeepneys going to Olivarez....Fare is 11 pesos. From Olivarez, there are jeepneys in front of KFC going to Mendez, just ask the driver to drop you off to Bulalo Point. Fare is also 11 pesos. But it is very traffic. 

Food: Amazing. We came here for Kare-kare Bulalo and it did not disappoint. Serving is big. It is good for 4-5 persons and has complete vegetable and a generous servings of bulalo meat. Sauce is very creamy and peanut-ty. Definitely, one of the reasons in going to Tagaytay. I also had hot kalamansi juice. It's good to have while waiting for the order.

Place: Crowded.We arrived at around 1:30 pm and was seated past 2pm. There was still a line when we left but for me waiting is okay because staff is accommodating, friendly and attentive.

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: They were right. The Bulalo was right  on.
content: Very good soup base for the Bulalo soup. Each clay pot had soup bone marrow with beef supple and tasty. The veggie we had was like napa cabbage. I would like to go back there and try it with guests again.We wanted to try it...because we had seen popular travel Youtubers recommend this at this location. Tagaytay. Wow, who would have thunk it that a place can get popular by Youtubers.

name: Bulalo Point Turo-Turo Grill
title: Bula-love
content: Of course, it's Tagaytay if it's all about bulalo with fried tawilis on the side! Seriously, I love this place. My gang used to hang out here, and we've made quite a history visiting this place very often. I love the view and the space,...and with all the guests, the place just comes alive.

name: Koolbits Grill And Restaurant
title: Will def be back
content: Great ambience. Al fresco area is spacious and has a bit of beach vibe. Good food too. Love their dinakdakan.

name: Koolbits Grill And Restaurant
title: Birthday Celebration
content:
JC 
 Approachable and accommodated us as much as he could everytime we need him.

Location/food/service rendered is extraordinary.

name: Koolbits Grill And Restaurant
title: Birthday celebration
content:
Jc is very accommodating and easy to approach when we ask for some service like taking photos 
We will be back for sure. The Food are delicious and affordable

name: Koolbits Grill And Restaurant
title: Birthday celebration
content: Highly recommended ‚ô•Ô∏è The place is very relaxing. The food is great. "To taste is to believe" indeed! Thanks to the accommodating staff especially Sir JC. We will surely visit again.

name: Koolbits Grill And Restaurant
title: Best place to Hangout
content: I love the place, relaxing, hidden behind the crowded area of the city, they have good music, you can play Billiards, great food highly recommended

name: Koolbits Grill And Restaurant
title: 1st time @ Koolbits
content:
Good ambiance and tasty foods and great service, easy access, with wide parking area...
thanks for the assistance JC Rosanes

name: Koolbits Grill And Restaurant
title: Socials Night of Our Team
content: We were very accomodated by the waiters here. Specially by Cel :) We were very happy to have found a place that we could enjoy our night.

name: Koolbits Grill And Restaurant
title: Koolbits dinner
content: Cel is very attentive with our dine in Koolbits and i recommend you guys try the quarter leg chicken and sisig its the best. Ambiance is very vibrant and would come back for another dinner for sure

name: Koolbits Grill And Restaurant
title: Good resto
content: Good na good mababait crew specially si rosa crush ko na sya eh üòäsarap malasing ü§£good service cool bits

name: Koolbits Grill And Restaurant
title: Super chill!
content: Chill lang vibes and di super ingay. Outdoor seating with great food and service. They have a karaoke, a pool table, and even an arcade machine. Real nice place for a casual hangout with friends. They're open till 2! Have to mention Kuya JC ‚Äî...superb service!

name: Koolbits Grill And Restaurant
title: Good place for chill inuman üçª
content: Open space, great ambience, even greater service lalo na from Kuya JC! Go-to namin ng friends for drinks. Babalikan!

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: Basic Decoration with Excellent Food
content:
We hadn't been here in a while and were asked to sit at the lower level because of social distancing measures. The setting downstairs was fairly basic but it produced a really nice atmosphere and worked very well for the venue.

We ordered a light...lunch and the food was as consistently good as at Antonio's other two restaurants in the area. The waiters were as polite and attentive as if we were at Antonio's main restaurant. 

Glad we stopped in and will make this a regular venue when we're in the area.

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: Loved the food!
content: Chocolate with almonds at the candy shop was yummy! Monte cristo sandwich too! Same with the apple juice. Can't wait to go back again.

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: Celebrating Jonald's Bday
content:
The ambiance is great üòä
We ordered breakfast meal Tapa and Bacon and we request additional longanisa and fresh corned beef they are all delicious üòç

We will surely comeback to taste their Burger.

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: Family Lunch
content: Stopped by this place for a family lunch before heading down to Talisay for a visit. We've been to this restaurant a few times now & still the food & the service is great. Choose the topdeck seating for a beautiful view of Taal Lake...& the volcano.

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: Brunch
content: I‚Äôve been to some restaurants in Tagaytay, to compare, I‚Äôd say Antonio‚Äôs is a bit overrated when it comes to price vs the quality of food.  Ambience is great, they have a very scenic view of Tagaytay.  I got some pancake and cheesecake.  The cheesecake...has some lemon and it taste a bit sour than usual.

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: Overrated
content: Antonio‚Äôs has the class but some of the food are meh. I like their Reuben Salad it was good. But all my that my family ordered like tapa, longanissa are not impressive. The view is great though. I bought goodies at their store section and...their Spanish bread is good, the milk chocolate with hazelnut is bitter. Prices are expensive but if it‚Äôs for the experience go for it!

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: Tagaytay‚Äôs Best!
content: Ask my children where they want to dine in Tagaytay? Breakfast at Antonio‚Äôs always tops the list. My son loves the burger, sandwiches are great. Lots of choices in the menu, and the restaurant is very clean.

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: Worst cr√™pe ever
content: Place looks very nice and view on taal is wonderfull. Menu looked great and pictures of the cr√™pe was very tempting. I ordered sarazin crepe with crab, my family too and high protein crepe for my son (ham and cheese). They brought all the cr√™pe...with some chili sauce inside and sweet mayonnaise on top, while it was not mentioned in the menu description. They changed it without spicy sauce and mayonnaise but i have never seen so oily crepe in my life. I absorbed it with my napkins but it was not enough, i did not finish it and felt bad after dinner for all the oil. I was so sorry with that experience, hopefully staffs was nice and hope chef will correct his receipe.

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: GREAT VIEW! GREAT EATS!
content: A must to go to when you are in Tagaytay. It is very clean, over looks part of the Taal Lake. Great service and delicious food.

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: Amazing five star place
content:
Amazing breakfast place . Menu is wonderful. There are traditional Filipino breakfast sets and the western breakfast too. Location of the restaurant is very good. The view from the top seeing other mountains and lakes make the breakfast a good memory. Even in heavy rain...we can enjoy good environment to talk. Service is very satisfying and showing Filipino hospitality.  
It is very clean, panoramic and excellent restaurant. Must try in Tagaytay.

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: Banana Macadamia Jam!
content: You just have to taste the Banana Macadamia Jam. It‚Äôs a must have.  Been here many times and each visit is enjoyable.  Everuthing on the menu is good!

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: Independence Day
content: It was my first time to visit with my friends and the service was good and i love the breakfast experience during afternoon snack!

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: Good food with great view!
content: If you are lucky you have a very nice view of the Taal Volcano and the lake around it (it is often foggy). The food is good, a big menu to choose...

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: Always full on weekends
content: I am a breakfast lover. In fact it is my favorite meal of the day. Going up to tagaytay for a weekend breakfast was worth it when you have it here. The food was great and those eggs benedict were to die for. The only...thing that was lacking was ample parking space... Although it was a weekend and most of the city folks are in tagaytay.

name: Antonio's Breakfast
title: Delicious
content: We often stop by this restaurant on the way to the beach. The whole family loves it. Our favorites include the golden waffle, beef tapa, and the garden crepe. The coffee is good too. If you are already in Tagaytay or Alfonso, I highly recommend...this restaurant!

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: No crowd!
content:
The place we went to is located along Sta-Rosa Tagaytay road.
The other restos on the area were fully-booked and has time limit.
It was 7pm.  Loved that there was no crowd here.
The interiors were made to be elegant.  Love the coffee books on...the foyer.
Service is fast.  Ordered some hot liquids and dinner options.
Passable but nothing exceptional.  The staff were very friendly though.
Nice resto option.

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: BEST PLACE FOR PASALUBONG!!!
content:
For pasalubong we bought: All the tarts esp blueberry, apple, choco, buko, and strawberry. Didn't like the pineapple. We got the ground coffee (hazelnut and barako), okoy, pastillas, sardines (try Montano brand), Banana chips, Cassava chips, and tamarind candies. 
There's parking space, but cash only...transactions.

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: Never Again!
content:
Never Again!
We had a horrible experience here last Sunday May 30, 2019. On our way home from an overnight trip at Tali beach our large group of 10 decided to make a stop in Tagaytay to grab coffee. Our first and 2nd choice were...jam packed so we ended up at cliffhouse and decided to settle here. 

It took a long time for our orders to arrive. I ordered for pansit bihon and white chocolate mocha 16oz. The first batch of coffee we ordered arrived. Then when the waiter called for who ordered white chocolate mocha I raised my hand, but I noticed how come my cup was placed in an 8oz cup when I ordered for 16oz. The waiter seemed annoyed and he told me that for white chocolate mocha the 16oz cup is placed in an 8oz cup. This made no sense to me at all. It was only then that one of my friend said she ordered for the white chocolate mocha small which is the 8oz cup. So I immediately pass the drink to her. All of my friend‚Äôs coffee already arrived except for mine. 

A few minutes later, the waiter came out with a cup of 16oz then he asked who ordered for hot chocolate? I said I ordered for white chocolate mocha 16oz and I did not order for the hot chocolate. And I told the waiter to cancel my WCM. After awhile he came back at our table looking annoyed and was screaming to us saying ‚Äúmeron po talagang nag order nito for Sheila!‚Äù I was shocked that he had to mention my name out loud announcing like I just didn‚Äôt want to accept my order. So I told the waiter, ‚ÄúKuya yes, I am Sheila and I made an order but not for hot chocolate. Why would I accept a wrong order?! Besides, I‚Äôve already cancelled that drink.‚Äù While some of my friends just wanted me to let it slide saying ‚Äúhayaan mo na‚Äù The whole situation got me too annoyed so I said ‚Äúhello? I‚Äôm the paying customer ako pa ba mag aadjust?‚Äù Cliffhouse is known to have quality restaurants and coffee shops within its compound. Not being petty here but, I expect some level of service to go with their menu prices. We noticed, the group from our next table all stood up and left because no one was attending to them. 

The persistent waiter came out again in a few minutes with the 16oz messy cup and putting it down in front of me saying here‚Äôs your white chocolate mocha (ugh! I said to cancel it already) but fine, never mind. I removed the lid to take a sip and my God! It‚Äôs obviously the hot chocolate drink from earlier that they tried to remedy to make it pass as a WCM. I know how a WCM taste like. But to be sure, I passed the drink to my friend who ordered for the same and she confirmed it‚Äôs a different drink. 

When I saw the guy who took our orders coming out of the kitchen, I think he‚Äôs not just an order taker but he was also the one who prepared our food. I immediately called him and I talked to him calmly and told him. Kuya, this isn‚Äôt a WCM. Just to let you know that I am not paying for this drink. The guy told me sure maam no problem and he took the cup away. 

Upset and hungry, I ate my pansit and it tasted like a lot of soy sauce was poured over it. The pansit tasted bad even when I‚Äôm hungry. 

When my friends asked for the bill ‚Äúkuya pa bill out na rin.‚Äù the same waiter responded in his same annoyed tone ‚Äúma‚Äôam wait lang!‚Äù My friend lost it and told him ‚Äú ok kuya! May problema ka ba? Ano bang problema mo? You can say it nicely Ang ayos kung nag ask sayo.!‚Äù I think this waiter can‚Äôt take this level of stress that he doesn‚Äôt realize he‚Äôs already screaming at us numerous times. It‚Äôs a Sunday. Rowena‚Äôs should‚Äôve anticipated the volume of people and should‚Äôve assigned a few more staff that day. Your waiter is so stressed out we are just a group of 10 and the other group already left and they can‚Äôt even cope. 

And my god asking for our bill took another 20 minutes. It was chaos when the lady cashier doesn‚Äôt seem to know what she was doing. Oh and they asked for Sevice charge pa ha. I wanted to ask ‚Äúwhich service?‚Äù But nah, never mind. This will be our first and last to be visiting this place. We should‚Äôve just went to UCC next to it. Sorry no photos. No one would think of taking a photo when the place already ruined everyone‚Äôs mood at the table.

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: pasalubong
content: Bought Blueberry and Chocolate mousse tarts and Malunggay chips for pasalubong. As always, their tarts are good and especially loving their malunggay chips. They are not salty at all and good for those who love chips but hate the salt overload.

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: Cashier Error - BEWARE!!!
content: Last day October 1, 2018 we went to this store and restaurant then we eat after that we buy a pasalubog but when we came home I check the receipt and I've notice that there is some items that are not include on what we...are buy so I was disappointed that there is a store like this are not honest now I was learned and make it to be one of need to be block-listed when buying a pasalubong. I also reminder everyone to check before you leave the store not all store in Philippines are honest most of all the cashier sometimes do not trust them look very carefully on them. #DISHONEST STORE I EVER VISIT IN TAGAYTAY Along the way to Sta Rosa.

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: Love their Apple and Pineapple Tarts
content:
I love their apple and Pineapple Tarts
They taste just perfect, crust is soft and yummy.
The price is very competitive.It's just a bit difficult to bring the box if you are commuting because the Tarts may get deformed, however it still taste the same....Keep it up Rowena's.

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: Too many mosquitos
content:
We had dinner here after purchasing tarts to bring home. The restaurant was deserted and we were the only customers for the first 30 mins. there. The pathway going to the dining area was dark, unmanned and mosquito infested.

The waiters were attentive and accommodating,...the food was ok and reasonably priced. However be aware that there are huge mosquitos (and plenty of them). They got into our food as well. The staff didn't have a solution for this problem.

Would think twice before dining here again.

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: Yummy
content: Really great tasting buko tarts and buko pies here. We're regretting not buying more for the long ride back to Manila.

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: Yummy Pasalubong Buys
content: A must stop when you visit Tagaytay. Apart from their wide array of pasalubong buys like buko tart, sylvanas.. They also offer some menus that you can enjoy eating inside their shop, while resting those tired feet from all the day's walk about. Love their...sisig and red sinigang! Just perfect for Tagaytay weather.

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: Perfect comfort food & takehome goodies
content:
Usually, aside from family getaway, we frequent Tagaytay to bring home balikbayan friends and families. 

Rowena's Cafe or and Rowena's pasalubong shops is a defenitely a must-stop for delicious meal and of course to bring home baked goodies and hard to find snacks to bring...home with our visitors back in their country.

The place is well kept and manage, staffs very warm and accommodating, good service, quality food/proportion and value for money.

The Tarts are all good. We took home with us Assorted cheese tarts, and apple tarts. The apple tarts has been my favorite. You can eat it as it is, or pop it in the oven or toaster for a warmer version.

A good box of 9pcs Apple Tart cost 220PhP, same with the assorted cheese tarts. 

Visit their Caf√© and pasalubong areas and surely you will love it!‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: Love their Pasalubong
content: If you love buko tarts, Rowena's Cafe  is the place to buy. They also have different flavors aside from buko. And plenty of other items too like the sweet and spicy dilis, the crunchy banana chips and many others aside from their famous buko tarts....This is a nice place to drop by last if you wish yo buy something to take home after any tagaytay trip.

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: We waited almost 2 hours
content: My family decided to try Rowena's located at Hill Crest because the view there is stunning and the location is very relaxing. What I don't like about Rowena's is their waiting game. We waited for 30 minutes before we got to our seats. It is...passed lunch time already so we are very hungry at that time. We thought our foods can be served in less than 30 minutes because there are only 3-4 tables occupied during the time, and less customers ordering food because it's passed lunch time. I thought the loooong waiting game is over. 1 hour passed, and only 1 dish was served to our table. They didn't even served us water, which is a common practice in restaurants, that once the guests are seated to their respective tables, the servers will automatically serve a glass of water to their table. (I know that because I am a SHRIM graduate). We noticed that every 30 min, they serve our orders, one by one, which is not sooo good. So all in all, we were waiting for almost 2 hours before we can eat our lunch.

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: Pasulubong to Impress
content: Their Blueberry Cheese Tarts never fails to impress the receivers of these pasalubong. Their other tarts are equally delicious. The place is quite roomy but, still packs a lot of buyers on weekends. There are more pasalubongs to choose from like nuts, chips, crackers, etc.

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: Great Buys for Pasalubong
content: As we Filipinos love to bring home a little something to our loved ones from a trip, I wanted to try something different this time so I went to Rowena's. I wasn't disappointed. From Rowena's suman pinipig (P220 per pack of 10pcs) to Rowena's assorted...mini cheese tarts (less than P200 per box of 12 mini tarts - blueberry, mango, strawberry), plus Ube Halaya, Espasol, and Apa, my family loved all the goodies that I bought. The place was very clean and a restaurant side as well. Service was impeccable. Thanks!!!

name: Rowena's Cafe
title: Delicious Buko Tarts
content: They have the best buko tart. Im not really a fan of tarts but, Rowena's Buko Tart is a must try! The creaminess of the mixture combined with the soft but crunchy crust makes you looking for more! They have many other tart flavors available...too, but i only tasted their buko tart. Maybe next time, im willing to explore their other flavors. Aside from tarts, they also have cakes, silvannas, etc. It is great to buy here before leaving Tagaytay.

name: LZM Restaurant
title: Very bad experience
content: We are food lover and eat all around places such as tagaytay area and Today we had lunch at LZM in this branch and we had a very bad experience , while ordering food we had to advise one of there food server / waiter...to kindly serve first the soup and the fried milkfish and the rest of our order to follow , at our surprise he the food server / waiter aggressively in his higher tone said ‚Äú I told them already!!! And turn his back at us!! ‚Äî For you Sir and the owner of this resto, let‚Äôs face it one of the reason that people enjoy coming back to great restaurants is that when there is extraordinary customer service nad you don‚Äôt have it there ‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏èAnd sorry the food also wasn‚Äôt that great ‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è ‚Ä¶( by the way the waiter didn‚Äôt even bother to say ‚Äú sorry , thank you, please , welcome or anything‚Äî his just on his baddest attitude ) We don‚Äôt recommend this resto guys , unfortunately

name: LZM Restaurant
title: Must-try Filipino food
content: I‚Äôve visited this restaurant many times already in the past. We always eat here every time we visit Tagaytay. Their fried bangus is to die for and not to mention their pakbet. Of course, the bulalo is a staple and the crispy para. It‚Äôs great...food for a good price.

name: LZM Restaurant
title: Biggest serving of Kare Kare in any restaurant! Can feed atleast 8 people! It‚Äôs crazy!
content: Ok so my favorite food is kare kare and LZM Restaurant serves the biggest Kare Kare serving i‚Äôve ever had so far! It‚Äôs so affordable it‚Äôs crazy! All their food is good! Best bangus I‚Äôve had lol their veggies are good also! Loved the bulalo...and leche flan also! Will definitely go back! I‚Äôm not a fan of beef so I didn‚Äôt like their salpicao but that‚Äôs just me! It‚Äôs still awesome though!

name: LZM Restaurant
title: Take out boneless bangus
content: A friend stopped by on our way home to buy a take out bangus. We were all curious what's special with the boneless fried bangus so we ordered as well. Loved it! seems ordinary but it was really good

name: LZM Restaurant
title: Nicely cooked Filipino food, from a small chain restaurant
content: The bulalo soup is always consistent, they serve very good bangus that is usually of the 1kilo size, so the belly is very fat and yummy, make sure you come in a group of at least 4 people, so you can finish what your order.

name: LZM Restaurant
title: Bulalo for dinner
content: We stopped by this resto to have dinner. We had their uber soft bulalo and boneless bangus. They are a bit pricey but worth it for a group of 3-4 persons can share it. The bulalo is not that hot as I want it to...be so you can feel the sebo or fats lining your lips. You may want to add a little fish sauce and chili for enhanced flavor. For the bangus, it's a huge one good enough for 4 persons. We concucted a dip of soy sauce, calamansi and chili pepper to add flavor to the bit bland fish.

name: LZM Restaurant
title: Above Average Food - Cramped Space
content:
We visited this restaurant with about 12 people. 4 of which were babies/toddlers. Even though they had a large space restaurant next door, we were put in the smaller space which had every table filled. It was hard to enjoy the meal since there wasn't...enough room for everyone to sit even close to the table plus the fact that people were constantly maneuvering around our table trying to get by since we were in the center of the room.

The food itself was pretty good. It was clean and they did refill our bulalo soup for free, which was nice. The workers were nice and accommodating, but I didn't have a chance to really talk to them as someone else did the ordering. 

Would I come back? Probably not, but it's only because it wasn't anything too spectacular and there's a lot of other great places in Tagaytay to eat.

name: LZM Restaurant
title: For a quick dinner of local food
content: The bangus is delicious and also the sinigang na tuna belly and other dishes.  The place is spartan.  The rest rooms need to be cleaned more often.  The prices are reasonable.  No frills and ambiance but the prices are reasonable.

name: LZM Restaurant
title: Comfort food at its Best.
content: LZM is a restaurant in tagaytay that me and my family love.the food are straightforward delicious and traditional. the bangus is crispy on the outside but moist and heavenly inside, their bulalo is so impressive, just the right saltiness to give way to the star...which is the tender beef that melts in your mouth. We keep coming back to this place whenever we visit tagaytay.

name: LZM Restaurant
title: Love their Bangus
content: Its a typical Filipino bulalo restaurant. i really like their bangus, its big and tasty. Bulalo is average enough.

name: LZM Restaurant
title: LZM and the tasty Giant Bangus
content:
It has been 7 years or more since my last visit to this popular restaurant luckily we decided to eat here yesterday, we were considering bulalo's point, diner's bulalo and LZM but since we saw a lot of good reviews in LZM than the other...two we decided to eat here and bro we made the best decision ever hehehe.. üòäüëçüèª

We ordered the Boneless Bangus, Bulalo and Sizzling Gambas..

It took 20mins for our meal to arrive and when it finally reach our table they gave us the biggest and tasties boneless bangus that I have ever seen in my life check out the pic.

The Bulalo is also an absolute winner when they notice that the soup is already half full they will quickly refill the soup, the bulalo meat is also very tender and the vegetable is cooked just right..

I was not able to try tye sizzling gambas because of my allergy to shrimp but according to my wife it's tasty but the serving is not that generous you can clearly see from the pic.. we can buy a lot of prawns with the price of the gambas..

The price is just ok and the service is absolutely awesome.. I will always eat here with no hesitation whenever I'm in tagaytay.

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

name: LZM Restaurant
title: Business
content: This is a typical restaurant that serves Filipino foods with great servings with courteous staff and crew.

name: LZM Restaurant
title: Good food!
content:
My balikbayan friends were looking for Filipino dishes. We ordered sinigang, beef steak and crispy prawn. Huge serving great big groups. 

Although the acoustics of place was unnerving. You can clearly hear the cutlers clinking on plates and dishes.

name: LZM Restaurant
title: No Taal view but great food
content: Quality Filipino food! Big servings too! We loved the chicharron bulaklak, bulalo and calamares (not crispy but yummy still). There were ample tables too and the wait staff are fast. My only compliant is their rice. I wish they could change it to Japanese rice...or to any other softer variety.

name: LZM Restaurant
title: Bangus FTW
content: We ate at Ayala Mall Serin branch since it is walking distance from our hotel. The restaurant is spacious and the atmosphere is great. Staff serves fast though I don't know if they are still fast if the restaurant is full. We tried their famous...bangus and kare-kare. The bangus is superb. Very fresh and so big. We only finished half of it. Kare-kare is delicious but I've tasted better kare-kare.

name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: Bad service
content:
my food order took almost 45 mins
We were also denied entry when the resto was full, they said we dont have reservations and had to show our vaccination card, but a week ago we ate ther without reservations, but there were only 2 tables.

name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: Excellent Vietnamese food.
content: Excellent Vietnamese food. Great, personalized and fast service. Good coffee. Worth the 2 hour drive from Manila. Will surely recommend and come back.
