name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: Worth Finding Off the Path
content: We were introduced to this place by friends.  It is beautifully decorated with only a few tables.  It is a family run place so don't be surprised when you see adorable little kids running around a bit.  The food is fresh, healthy and well created.

name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: Authentic Vietnamese Cuisine
content:
The popularity of Vietnamese cuisine has reached other shores. On such outlet is Bawai's Kitchen located along Hernandez St. in Silang, Cavite, the Philippines.

It's a Mom's and Pop's venture. The resto is owned and managed by a Filipino gentleman married to Bawai, a Vietnamese....Hence the name.

If you're not planning to visit Vietnam soon, and you're looking for Vietnamese dishes to taste, and you're somewhere in Tagaytay, this place is worth a try.

Sample Bawai salad of coconut sprouts with glazed pork and steamed shrimps. Then Goi Cuon Bo (fresh rolls with mixed greens and lemongrass beef). For your soup, you can choose between Bun Bo Hue (beef and pork knuckle soup) or Pho Bo, the classic beef noodle soup.

For entrees, you can have Bo Luc Lac (tenderloin beef tips in Vietnamese spices with potato and sweet potato), Ca Kho To (caramelized fish with rice), and Curry Go (coconut-infused chicken curry with rice).

Another thing going in Bawai's favor is its quaint ambiance being located in a secluded part of town.

Its expanding clientele attests to its reputation as a dependable food corner. It has opened branches in White Plains, Quezon City; Nuvali, Sta. Rosa, Laguna; and Taguig City. It's best to book ahead for your visit.

name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: Superb authentic cuisine
content: We were so fortunate to eat in this place. The ambiance was so nice and you can also hear the sound of the crickets. Very intimate if you want a romantic date.  The owner was very accommodating. The food was authentic and you can‚Äôt go...wrong on the taste of their food! Hoping we can go back once again!

name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: Thai Vietnamese Food
content:
Super love the place. Needs reservation atleast one day ahead.
Love the shrimp and vegetable spring roll. 
Place near Asiong Restaurant and Chateau Hestia.
Thumbs up!!!üòä

name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: Very Good Vietnamese Restaurant in Tagaytay
content: Passed by here for a light dinner snack.  Loved the Ca Phe Sua Da ( Iced Coffee ) and spring rolls.  Saw Bawai (Granny) herself.  This small resto had a quiant homey vibe.  Perfect for intimate dates.  Looking forward to come back here for some...serious eating.  It a little hard to find.  Needed Waze.

name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: Healthy and hearty...Getting there!
content: This Bawai's branch is in the midst of a transformation.  Under new management now with better trained staff, the signature Bawai's food that's given their Pasig and Bucal (House of Bawai's) foodie cred is served graciously and enticingly.  Since about half of our family now...is trying to go plant-based, this was our choice, keeping the carnivores and kiddies still happy while doing that.This branch is in a slightly set off spot and glass encased with surrounding views of the greenery.  All that's good for the soul 8-)  We visited on an off hour and off day so it was pleasantly quiet, gave us the space to stretch out and dine well and warmly...just the stuff you need to build up strength again for getting back to the grind the next day.Good food that hits you where you need it!

name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: Vietnamese Dinner
content:
Reservation though their published mobile was easy and fast. The directions and their specialties were forwarded to me upon reservation. The staff were friendly and accommodating and the place was quiet and away from the big crowd of Tagaytay.

We went here on a Friday...night. We were the first ones to arrive but the places quickly filled up by 7pm. Service was quick. We had the Fresh spring rolls with greens and noodles. This is the usual spring rolls with our favorite peanut dipping sauce. Tender beef tips and steamed vegetables with rice. The beef was really tender. Special crab noodle soup. I did not taste the crab but the soup was light and flavorful.

name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: Baw, Wow!!!
content: The interiors of this resto are just right , provides a clean comfy feel. The food tastes like great authentic Vietnamese food!! Service was good and fast !!Another great resto to add my favorite list.

name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: Put in your reservation
content:
We nearly went without a reservation and chances are, we would not have had the fine experience of dining here because of the limited number of tables it can accommodate. It is the house of the owners actually. And yes, for me they serve better...tasting dishes than the White Plains branch. Their waitstaff are courteous and attentive. A hand The place has a garage that may house about 6 cars.
Our foreigner friends loved what we ordered.

name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: Authentic Vietnamese restaurant
content:
I believe it was established by a Filipino guy and his Vietnamese wife. This resto in Silang/Tagaytay is also situated in the hime of the owners. Delicious authentic Vietnamese food. I lived in. Ietnam for 2 years so I should have an idea  of real...Vietnamese food. Cozy tastefully decorated place. They only accept customers with advance bookings. Open only from Thursday to Sunday (I think).

Beware though: The Sta. Rosa branch of Bawai does not have as good quality as this one in Tagaytay.

name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: REAL GEM AND A TREASURE!!!!
content: My wife and I were invited to have dinner in this Excellent Restaurant by the daughter of the owner.  Admittedly if you try to find this place at night it can be daunting as the road from the Tagaytay main road is not well lighted...and yes Waze does help for sure.  But in spite of this, I liken the 'adventure' to find the place like a Treasure Hunt and WOW what a treasure at the end!!  I cannot really convey how super great this place is.  The food quality, the ambiance (its actually the house of the owners), the feeling of eating excellent Vietnamese food at home.  I love that NOT commercial feeling in the place and the food.  My wife swears by the food as 'worth dying' for.  And we are not saying this just because the daughter of the owner invited us and also was there to sit with us, I mean what we ordered was in the menu and not something special made just for us.  As I write this my mouth is watering thinking of the food.  And like the coffee at the end of the meal.....HEAVEN!!!!!!  My wife and I love this place and will definitely be back for more.  I will swear by this place and recommend this place to everyone for sure.  For those of you who want to try this place, I believe you have to make a reservation as this is NOT some commercial place with tons of seating, it is the house of the owner and what I saw sitting would be for like maybe at most 30 (or even less).  But as I said really really worth it.  It is accessible from Tagaytay, the main road - of you come up to Tagaytay from the Sta. Rosa route, turn right heading towards Tagaytay proper, about 500 meters or so after you turn, you will see a road that you can turn right with a landmark I think is the Dominican Sisters, go down that road for about 1.5 km and then you will see a sign which you can turn right on and there you are.  Another landmark would be Buena Vista Tagaytay or if you know about Chateau Hesita it also has the same route as Bawai's.  What ever you do, you have to try this place for sure!

name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: Home-cooked Vietnamese food
content:
On the way to Tagaytay, we stopped to have lunch here. Based on reviews, I must say this place is a hidden gem. It's located inside a residential area, off-road. Part of the area was converted into a semi-outdoor dining while the cooking mostly done...in the kitchen inside the house. Some of the foods we ordered were: Goi Cuon (fresh spring rolls with shrimp), Tom Rang Me (grilled prawns with tamarind paste), Pho Bo (beef noodle soup), Com Suon Cha (grilled pork belly). I must say, we ordered a lot for a party of 2 - foodies at heart! Here's the verdict:

The spring rolls were ok. Nothing fancy but the peanut sauce was good.
Grilled prawns - the prawns were fresh and the tamarind sauce was good! Order rice.
Pork belly - tasty. What really hit the spot was their homemade sauce - it's a fish sauce that's not too sweet nor too salty but perfect for their pork belly; they can even use this dip for their spring rolls!
The Pho was good - you can really taste the beef stock. We didn't get to finish this because we were busy trying out the other meals.

Overall, this restaurant is good for couples and families who need a break from the usual Metro Manila-based restaurants in Tagaytay.

name: Bawai's Vietnamese Kitchen
title: Hard to Locate
content:
We went there for a dinner with my family, servings are not so generous just a regular serving, no fuzz, the soup ''Pho'' was too oily and their spring roll was just ordinary and not bad at all Price of products are to be considered...$$$.
I just notice that since we were the last guest to be accommodated, the lights were not so pleasant at all they only opened 2 bulbs...probably saving electricity and during our time of visit the wash room / toilet Stinks...never will be coming back again, there are more much better Vietnamese resto along the way.

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: Carlo
content:
There are so many kind of foods for you to choose with. Sulit ang bayad! Good environment and also the service. 

Carlo

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: Great service!
content: Great service! I like almost everything. They got a lot of choices in seafoods too. The restaurant is clean and the servers are attentive.

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: Kalami ba sa Tong Yang!
content: If you want the best buffet for hot pots or samgyup, you must must visit and try this resto. Suki na talaga kami dito! They served the best dishes and maki. And oh the ice cream one of our faves. They have the good customer...service as well. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: Good experience in tongyang bacoor
content: Very nice ambiance quality food all staff are accommodating unli beer pa tapos unli pulutan din my friend is satisfied‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: Worst eating experience
content: Food at its worst....frozen ang shrimp served with hard ice, ebi tempura chopped shrimp ang loob at konti lang ang laman, squid and fishes ilado lahat......so what do you think ma enjoy ko dito ? not worth my money or yours either. Sad to say........you are on a downtrend.....may food quality control ba dito ?

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: Good food good serviceüëèüëè
content: Good food good service üëåüëåüëåüëå sulit na sulit  ang daming korean appetizer at cakes .. ang babait pa ng mga waiter..üòäüòäüòä

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: Anniversary dinner
content:
This has always been our go-to place whenever we crave for ‚ÄúHotpot + Grill ‚Äú and it never disappoints. 
The ambience, food quality and most especially their service are the reasons why we always come back. 
Special mention to Kuya Jayson and also Ate at...the reception who went the extra mile and surprised us with cake + greeting and keen enough to note that we are celebrating our 22nd anniversary today. 
Thank you!

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: My baby's 18th month celebration.
content:
Everything went well.
Staff are 100% friendly.
Special mention to kuya Jayson, job well done‚úÖüëå.
Kudos‚ò∫Ô∏è

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: Recommended
content: Very good service and has good variety of foods. Highly recommended. The atmosphere in this place is very pleasing.

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: Best 6th birthday
content: Suppppper yummy it's a  SUPER NICE PLACE AND IT'S A  100%100 ‚ô° Sir  Rodel was nice and the girl staff made  me laugh üòÉ!‚ô°‚ô°‚ô°

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: Birthday of my friend
content: I like the food here, though there aren't many "ulam" options. loved the ambiance in the resto definitely coming back

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: Best service
content: First timer here. Didn't know how to make the best out of the experience. Fortunately, the staff is super helpful. From selecting what best pairs with your soup and how to season the meat slices. I'm glad my kids enjoyed the food.

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: Worth it!
content: I am glad to see na madami na ulet selection and you can take your time to enjoy eating cool ambience as well. The unlimited drinks and desserts is really what I like about Tong Yang.

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: Team eat out!
content: Awesome food and service! The stay are very courteous and food was fresh. Would recommend to friends and family.

name: Tong Yang, SM City Bacoor
title: Super kain si coolit a sulit na sulit
content:
The best experience mommy! I love it balik po tayo dito. Date po tayo ulit dito mommy‚Ä¶
Super satisfied customer ang anak ko ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: Enjoy the beautiful view of Taal with good food!
content: A good place to eat and enjoy the beautiful view of Taal. Best time to eat here is during sunset. During our visit, there's a lot of parking space available. The place is just across SMDC wind residences and nearby Robinsons Tagaytay.

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: Great view and food
content: First time to eat here and it was made special with my parents visiting from US. The place and kubo was very relaxing. Restroom was clean. The food was delicious and great. My Dad loves the fried ayungin. We loved the tofu and bulalo. All...the food we ordered was yummmmyy!

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: Dine with Taal view
content: Ambience is nice. Overlooking Taal while u dine in a Kubo/hut or tables & benches under the tree with nice cool breeze during summer. Food was okay but pricey. 10% service charge included in their menu prices. Staffs looked serious most of the time. Need...more engagement to customers like checking if the food was okay or if we needed anything else. A simple check back.

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: Beautiful location but mediocre food
content: The place offers a pretty good view of Taal volcano. The servers were polite and very helpful. It's a little pricey for a mediocre food though. I've had a better tasting bulalo at a cheaper price in another resto in tagaytay.. Their serving is also...small considering their price..

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: Casual outdoor dining with good food, service, and a great view.
content: Came with my wife and a group of friends. Had to wait for a while before bring allowed entry. Being a weekend, it was understandably busy but the wait was worthwhile. We ate in one of the larger kubos. It was clean and well maintained....The menu was quite extensive and prices were fair. Service was efficient and courteous. Being a larger group, we tried many of the menu items and shared. Recommend the bulalo steak & chopsuey which was great value. The view of Taal was an added bonus.

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: Lunch experience overlooking Taal!
content:
This place can be a bit busy but doing weekdays and during lunch time, you can have a good spot to eat while looking at Tall from a good vantage point.

There's minimum food consumption in terms of cost depending on the type of sitting...you will use.

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: Ridge Park in times of Pandemic
content: Visited Ridge Park for the view, food and service. I love this place as it has such a nice view. Since I came during lunch, the sun was hot so I used the kubo. Tried fried squash for the first time and it was so...good. Of course, we have the bulalo soup and gising gising and lechon kawali. Service was fast and grest. Will come back for sure.

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: Brunch at the clouds
content: This place is perfect! Very affordable, they let you stay maximum of 1hr and 30minutes to enjoy the view and good. Must try the bulalo!

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: Solved!
content:
Always worth the long queue.. the food is superb.. the staff is great  and the view is spectacular..

‚Äî- good thing they already allowed cars to wait inside their parking area instead of waiting along the busy street of tagaytay..

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: Very disappointed!!  Not worth the money!!!!
content: The restaurant closes at 9pm we arrived at 7:45 they accepted us as last customer and but upon checking on the menu the waitress keeps on telling us it is already cut off for the last order once we ordered food we cannot again  order...anymore and asked also if they can already present the bill upon serving our food.. we just felt that we need to eat in a hurry.. The food are pricey, too expensive for its taste and quality. Ex the sinigang which costs P400++, they served us puro taba ng baboy and gulay and the sisig which is puro lang onions and extenders.. I suggest that you just visit any other restaurant like sa twin lakes pricey din but super worth naman ang food unlike this resto.

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: A View To A Kill
content: Relaxing perfect view. Friendly staff. Rossana was very attentive. Clean bathrooms! Parking space available. Nipa hut is consumable of P1000-1500 for 1.5 hours use. You can extend a little bit of minutes if the place is not busy. You will be surrounded with a garden...full of colourful flowers. Food was great! Tawilis is a must try! Bulalo meat is not that tender though your server will always offer refill of bulalo broth. Food was served in good portions. CONS- menu was a bit pricey.

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: My daughter's birthday celeb..
content: Great food and very good service plus amazing view..the waiters are all courteous and very approachable..

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: Family Birthday Treat in Tagaytay
content: We've been going back and forth for the last 6 months in preparation for our wedding. And alas, we decided to stop by here and treat our family as our advance birthday treat. Meals were really good. All authentic Filipino. The sisig, crispy pata and...ginataang tilapia is a must have. Awesomely good dishes. Top that with a very refreshing young coconut juice hmmmmmm. Will definitely come back for more.

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: Dinner with beautiful view
content: This place is good for groups who wants to enjoy hot bulalo while overlooking a beautiful sunset at Taal lake. Kubo is free for a minimun order of Php,1,500. So far this budget is reasonable for a group of 5-7. Bulalo, crispy tawilis and pancit...is a must try.Great staff service too.

name: Ridge Park Kainan sa Kubo
title: Great Food even in Hot Summer
content: Came here on a hot clear weather for lunch. Everything was outdoor and natural.found a long picnic wooden table good for 6 people. The wind beer made the hot weather cool. The food we ordered was vegetable pakbet, enselada manga and talong, bulalo soup, kare...kare, tawilis and gising gising. Staff servics was good and food came in fast. Most important, the view of taal lake and volcano was so close and clear. Even on a hot day, it feel good to be at the best site in Tagaytay. Just opposit the SM condominiums. Well recommended as it is cheap food with quality foos and sights.

name: Antonio's Garden
title: Fabulous lunch experience
content: We had a great lunch at Antonio‚Äôs-  the ambiance, the food and the service was superlative.  Their lamb was soft and juicy;  the burrata was delightful and the crepes suzette was really a special treat.  Even the restrooms were so clean and even had toothpicks...and mouthwash-  truly a treat

name: Antonio's Garden
title: Antonio‚Äôs Tagaytay
content: Very disappointing, my wife is dairy intolerant and we advised beforehand, wanted the akaroa but couldn‚Äôt because of her intolerance, so they recommended the cod and spinatch on the side. The cod was the smallest fillet and the side of spinatch tiny as well, nothing...else on the plate, very blah! Also the waiter offered mesclun leaves for the salad because  we didn‚Äôt like arugula with pears  but what do you know we were given arugula.  All of this for a meal that, at 3200p per entree , is completely overpriced.

name: Antonio's Garden
title: Out of this world!
content:
I had very high expectations. The actual experience exceeded them. 

The place (building and garden) is stunningly beautiful. Undoubtedly someone with great taste has been involved in this outstanding delivery. 

Same for food - simply excellent. 

Bottom line: not to be missed

name: Antonio's Garden
title: Best restaurant in Philippines bar none
content: No trip to Tagatay is complete without a stop that this fine dining experience of excellence. The steak was one of the best I have ever had, paired perfectly with a wine selected by the manager himself. The sides were as good, the steak tartare...was brilliantly done. To end the feast the souffl√© was divine.

name: Antonio's Garden
title: Class
content:
I've been here a number of times over the years but hadn't been for a while. This really is  in a separate league in the Philippines.

The setting and ambience re beautiful and it has an old world charm with the foliage of the gardens...giving a beautiful backdrop.

The food presentation and flavours are outstanding and the chef/kitchen staff do a super job. The waitresses bring a calm elegance to the proceedings.

They appear to have a good wine cellar too at not outrageous prices.

Whilst this is expensive by Philippine standards, it's still great value for the quality of food you get.

name: Antonio's Garden
title: Not as good as before
content: Taste of the food  seems different now from before ... It's better before ... Everytime i went back here it seems to taste different than before ... Not in a good way :( their steak is the best steak i have eaten before ... But...now ... Mehhh ... If you haven't eaten here before then i think you would really appreciate it :) their souffle is still great !! My highlight for the night

name: Antonio's Garden
title: One of the best dining experiences of my life !!!!
content:
The plan was to go and have a steak main course and nothing else as we had done nothing but eat far too much during the previous week.

Our plans soon went array! As soon as you arrive, you get that feeling that this is...indeed a very special place and that perhaps you should indulge to get the full benefit.

The original one course idea turned into six courses.......all of which were cooked to perfection and sublime in every way.

Veal bone marrow with pecorino to start was rich, packed with favour and truly unctuous.

A small salad of strawberries, radish, walnut and blue cheese followed, this unassuming salad was packed with surprises, every mouthful, another taste explosion. As salads go this was a masterclass.

The lightest clam chowder followed. Intense and fishy without that usual chowder heaviness.

Next a pineapple palate cleanser- I admit I am not actually a fan of sorbet/granita as a palate cleanser, but this was packed to the rafters with intense pineapple flavours.

Dry aged rib eye followed; it was exquisite. The multiply accompaniments were a classy touch - Hollandaise, burnt onion sauce, chilli flakes and pickled garlic all added another dimension to every slice of that very happy cow (sadly/or happily departed depending on your viewpoint).

After five courses there really is not much point in avoiding dessert. Chocolate and olive cake with honeycomb and ice cream and the Italian version of 'floating islands' were just to die for.

The last time I ate this well was at Gordon Ramsey, Hospital Road over ten years ago. I've been trying to decide which was better and, in my opinion, they are now both in my top 1.

In summary, an exceptional dining experience and one which I will remember for many years, the food was so well executed and perfect that I felt emotional. When food has this effect on you, you know that you have experienced something utterly wonderful

name: Antonio's Garden
title: Worth It to Try!
content: So, I'm here sharing my experience in this wonderful restaurant. From the parking up to the table. It was amazing experience to be here and taste their food.

name: Antonio's Garden
title: Definitely worth the price
content: We definitely like the ambience and the food. We actually over ordered and had to pack the rest of the food. We ordered ordered dried age rib eye (which includes salad, soup, sauce and dessert with coffee/tea), suckling pig and some drinks.

name: Antonio's Garden
title: Wonderful evening
content:
A family birthday visit (not the first time) and as usual the food and surroundings were exquisite. 
We were a party of 9 and everyone had very good food and drinks. 
This is a definitely a Resto I need to spend more time at

name: Antonio's Garden
title: Don‚Äôt miss this experience!
content: Very Organized!!! From the moment you enter the place, literally entering the parking to the reception to the time you are ushered to your table, to the advising of the specials, to the meal course until the very end. Everything was carefully sequenced for you...to enjoy the ambience, the food and everything else in there to complete your fine dining experience. I have to mention that we had the 40days aged steak and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. One of the best steaks I ever had. Raclette with jams etc is also the perfect appetizer to get us started. Special thanks to Jeffrey who served our table. Very attentive and gives us options to suite our wants. :)

name: Antonio's Garden
title: A perfect culinary experience!
content:
Our first, but certainly not last, visit to this superb restaurant on the occasion of our daughter's 30th birthday. Despite not having made a reservation we were warmly welcomed and shown to a very nice, round, table. All members of staff were friendly, discreet, and...highly professional. The Ma√Ætre d'h√¥tel, Anthony, took excellent care of us and was a very pleasant person to meet - and meet again.

As appetizer, our daughter chose the Baked Burrata in Phyllo while my wife and I enjoyed the excellent, and very generous, P√¢t√© de Foie Gras. For the main course my wife chose the Akaroa Salmon Wellington, while my daughter and I enjoyed sharing the Angus Rib Eye Steak. The quality, taste and presentation of all dishes was truly excellent - the best we have ever experienced in the Philippines, and well on par with the best Europe can offer.

All main courses are in themselves generously sized, and additionally come with a salad, a soup, a delicious mini-scoop of cucumber and mint sorbet, a dessert and coffee - so you certainly will not leave hungry! To celebrate the special day we enjoyed sharing a bottle of Italian Prosecco which went very well with our meal choices.

We have been to our fair share of Michelin-starred restaurants in Europe, and Antonio's Garden is really at the same level, if not better in some respects. It's not inexpensive, but very much value for money.

We'll be back - soon!!

name: Antonio's Garden
title: A must visit close to Manila
content: Enjoyed the ambience and cuisine at this fine dining restaurant. Good wine selection. Well worth the drive from Manila

name: Antonio's Garden
title: Worth the trip!
content:
Visited in 2017 after an excursion to the Taal Volcano. The renewed July 1, 2021 outbreak and the heartbreak that it brings to the people in Tagaytay spurs me to finally recommend Antonio‚Äôs. I do hope the restaurant survives this challenge once again. As I...understand it, it‚Äôs an institution in the region. 
For me it was a perfect respite from the bustle of Manila - nestled in green surroundings, open and airy spaces, attentive people and good food! 
All around a very pleasant excursion!

name: Antonio's Garden
title: Ideal Romantic Place
content:
Went here with my boyfriend to celebrate our 3rd Anniversary. Going there was quite a long drive but since it was one of popular restaurants in Tagaytay, we got it a try and definitely it was a good one!
Place is very romantic, staffs were...all accommodating. Steaks are good, with a good plating. Elegant Hotel, we will surely be back for our another anniversary date.

name: Balay Dako
title: Great food!  Good location.
content: Fantastic Filipino food. They were full! But still service was great. Parking a problem but thats because of the large number of customers. When you have that many people lining up to eat, they must be good! Such a plus that they're pet friendly as...well! Great service and talk from Erwin, Marc and Carlos.

name: Balay Dako
title: Best Bulalo and Piaya in Tagaytay
content: Serves the gold standard in Bulalo. All servings are generous and Dako. Staff accommodating. parking and waiting time challenging during peak hours. They also have the only crispy piaya I know of, a native of Bacolod. Highly recommended. Having the best and nearest view of...Taal volcano.

name: Balay Dako
title: Balay Dako, a great restaurant in Tagaytay with an awesome view,.
content: Our family took a chance at going to Balay Dako as recommended by the bellhops at the hotel we had just checked in at. I was curious, being an Ilonggo, as to how a place with an Ilonggo name came to be in Tagaytay where...Tagalog is spoken. When we arrived at Balay Dako, we were very impressed by the size of the place. Balay Dako means large (dako) house (balay) in Ilonggo. The setting was just beautiful and the grounds and building were very well kept. It was meant to be reminiscent of a large family house from decades past. Luckily, we were there on a Tuesday afternoon and we were able to avoid the usual weekend crowds. I would estimate that it only took us about 20 to 25 minutes to get seated at a table by the window with a great view of Taal. The menu can be deceiving since we order kare kare and kansi amongst other dishes. The size of the bowl was very large and was full. I travelled all the way from Iloilo just to try one of the best kansi that I have ever tried. The servers were very attentive to our every need. The service at Balay Dako was great. Our family will be back for more at a later date. Eating at Balay Dako is a must when you come to Tagaytay.

name: Balay Dako
title: Average food
content:
We went there out of curiosity and had to wait 45  minutes to an hour  for a table. 
The food was subpar , the chef's interpretation of the traditional bulalo  has received so much praises so
we ordered that l. We ordered pork belly, but...it was quite chewy. Service with the waiter was excellent. We won't be eating there  as  the restaurant was overrated  and pricey

name: Balay Dako
title: Chicharon bulaklak
content:
Super duper heavy lunch at Balay Dako, Tagaytay ü´∂üèª What we ordered (of course) are bulalo, karekare and chicharon bulaklak ü§£

Love the taal view also. 

They are veryyyyyyyy busy during lunch time. Luckily, we just did a walk-in.

name: Balay Dako
title: One  of the best  restaurant to eat in PH Tagaytay
content:
Amazing  views, delicious big serving plates. Outstanding service!
Everything is quality from  big napkins that doesn‚Äôt melt to  standard size plates and spoons.  Bathrooms are clean and  again they use Americans type of paper towels  which is rare in PH.  The place is busy but...very well organized and fast turnaround.

name: Balay Dako
title: Best Restaurant in Tagaytay
content: Wonderful view, great food, AMAZING STAFF! Can be a challenge if you go on a weekend or peak hours. Parking space is big but since its really a sought after restaurant, it gets really congested.

name: Balay Dako
title: Underwhelming dinner at Balay Dako
content: I was expecting to be blown away by their food but in the end, it was just ok-- definitely not the worst but also not the best. Staff at the resto and the deli were also missing the Filipino hospitality we're known for. My family...and I left the place, super underwhelmed

name: Balay Dako
title: Nice meal and views
content:
We came down to Tagaytay just to have lunch here. We didn't book and were able to get a table without too long of a wait. The carpark is fairly big and is just off the highway, keep an eye out for the signs. We...perused the deli while waiting for a table and they had quite an interesting range of items. On the way to the table we went past the ice cream display as well as the grill where they were making piaya. 
The dining room was quite large and the window outside looks out to the water and the Taal volcano. We grabbed a few items to share. Most of the items were quite tasty. I quite like the lechon kawali with the tender meat and crispy skin. The sisig was also nice as was the squid rings. The kansi with the banana flower was interesting but not to my liking. For dessert, we did try the taho ice cream which was very interesting. It was almost like taho but creamy. The halo halo was nice but the palitaw was quite bland.
It was a nice place for tasty Filipino food and the views were quite good.

name: Balay Dako
title: My last visit
content:
Just had lunch there, my 2nd visit, and I have to say will be my last. Since nothing changed from our last visit.

The place is overpriced for the quality of the food & overall taste. We could've eaten in other places at a fraction...of the price we paid and still got a better food quality.

1. Eventhough it is the summer and the temp reaches to about 34 degrees, I still expect the Bulalo to be served steaming hot. Ours was warm to almost room temp.

2. Server took the time to refill the water on our table. It's not even lunch service where everything is chaotic.

3. Parking attendants let cars in when there are no parking spaces, hence, those that need to leave, can't because the cars are blocking the way.

4. Although they have a ramp going into the dining area, I still consider the place not wheelchair friendly as the dining tables are placed close to each other making it difficult to manuever the wheelchair. You may need to ask other guest to stand up or make room for you.

The good side, though:

1. The food was served maybe 10 or 15 mins after we placed our order.

2. The server was more attentive after I complained.

Of all the restaurants by Antonio's group of restaurants, this is my least favorite.

Guests are more likely to pay for the name rather than the food quality.

name: Balay Dako
title: Terrible cashier at deli, rude service and cashier
content:
Terrible cashier at deli 3pm rude and uninviting to customers, security guard was helpful though.

Although there were a lot of piaya 3pm they told us that there was a 30 min waiting time which was ok. But not worth waiting since there were absolutely...no customers when we went in

name: Balay Dako
title: Good food
content: Staff are well trained and veri accommodating to meet your requirements. You have to arrive super early on weekends due to long que

name: Balay Dako
title: Excellent
content: Excellent Experience.My husband and I went for dinner  and we really enjoyed the atmosphere. The food was fresh and delicious and the staff are so friendly also.

name: Balay Dako
title: Highly recommended!
content: The ambience is a top notch to start! But the best of it all the food was amazing.. and server ARCHIE! .. hes an asset. His smize and best recommendations was great and even with wines!

name: Balay Dako
title: Great Food and Iove how thoughtful the server was
content: My husband and I together with our friend decided to grab a dinner. We were surprised how the food was served so fast, we had kare kare, crispy pata, squid, some dessert and rice. Our server Mr. Julius went above and beyond when he offered...as soup because our order were more of fried/dry. I loved the thoughtfulness right there, kudos as well for being funny. We had a great night. It‚Äôs actually decent for $100 meal than what I usually get from NY Filipino Restaurant. Again Thank you Mr. Julius!

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: Healthy and Hearty Breakfast
content: Very nice and healthy breakfast. I love the danggit and fried rice. They also serve hot chocolate. The Daing na bangus is also great.

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: Pretty flowers, a bit boring for kid like me
content:
Review by Leo 7 years old
Nice flowers and food like the pasta and sauce. Also the location was good. Night snack was good with the cake.but a little to expensive.also can be very boring for kids like me.And flies.but still was very good!üòåü¶üüê∏

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: Outstanding experience
content:
If serenity and connecting with nature is what you are looking for then this place is it. The staff welcomed us with a delicious dalandan fruit juice.  We stayed overnight at the Lavender cottage with the family of 8.  This cottage can accommodate 13 comfortably....The rooms are spectacular and everything is clean and well maintained. Really nice to just chat and catch up with the family in the spacious living room with the birds chirping in the background.
We spent the morning walking around the place. A must if you stay here.  The gardens are well manicured.  
The courtesy and hospitality of the staff is second to none.  They greet you and are very welcoming.  Special shout out to Jiowell(?) for taking time to tell us more about the owner and the uniqueness of the place.
Food is abundant and all were tasty.  You will get full.  Guaranteed!  The staff offered us tarragon with berry tea.  Never had this before.  The aroma is sweet and smooth to sip.  I had seconds!
They gave us a 'secret' gift upon check out.  Very nice touch.
Overall, a fantastic stay.  I wish we stayed at least 2 nights.  Will we go back here again?  You betcha.

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: The Worst Buffet in Town
content:
Tagaytay has hundreds of places to eat but this has to be one of the worst. Ate with my family for Sunday lunch. Was expecting some kind of oasis full of plants flowers and trees. Was expecting good food but what we got was the...worst lunch buffet we have ever tried. The buffet had two types of spaghetti and chicken breast. Thats it. The waiters make sure to serve you the food on your table rather than you get it at the buffet table in an attempt to cut back on the portions. We were a table of 5 but they only put down two small plates of chicken breasts for our lunch. They say its eat all you can but they are definitely trying to regulate how much you eat. 

We wanted to order from the menu because we didnt like the buffet offering but the waiters said that we had to eat the buffet. 

Dont waste your time on this place. I think the public knows this is a place to avoid because there were very few people dining there. I guess we were the only out of town suckers that day. Dont be a sucker. Learn from our experience and treat your family somewhere else.

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: Could have been much better
content: Place was nice especially at night when the colored lights are on. It is just extremely warm to a point it was no longer comfortable. The experience would have been great if there was airconditioning. The service could still improve, we asked for ice many...times, some arrived. Some did not. And the food is much to be desired. They need to improve on this badly. After tasting the breakfast, we opted not to eat lunch there anymore and preferred to enjoy food outside even if we had to pay again for it

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: Need quality control and some refreshing
content:
While still one of the better eating and resting places, Sonya's garden need quality control and some refreshing: The music is too loud. It is not a karaoke bar. Piped in music should be discreet.  The vegetable are limp, no longer fresh. The bread tastes...like it was baked early in the morning and heated only in the oven. The chairs are no longer rustic but need cleaning and repainting.  The wait staff are dressed in different shades of fade white. Their shoes comes in different colors are their face shields are worn as headshields.  The floors have bits if candy wrapper and small trash.  

The table linens are still crisp, servings generous and wait staff are courteous. The price is reasonable but I wish it was a bit more like Antonio's.

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: First lunch outside with family in time of pandemic
content: Since we miss Tagaytay so much. My family decided  to try Sonya‚Äôs garden in Alfonso Cavite. We checked their menu and found out that it‚Äôs a bit pricey for Eat all u can breakfast 733 pesos. Included in the menu is Chixen and pork adobo,...daing na bangus, egg omelette with mushroom, coffee, hot cocoa, fresh dalandan juice and their special Salad. The only thing we enjoy is the salad. One thing we noticed is that they have excellent service given by the staff which we are happy. They really care for the customers request. Place is nice and quiet. Cozy and you will enjoy touring the garden.

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: Breathtaking place
content: Our overnight stay is one of the highlights of our vacation. Excellent food especially the salad with Sonya‚Äôs secret dressing, amazing staff and our room is so beautiful and cozy. You also have to try the massage but make sure that you book before you...come to get a slot. We‚Äôll definitely stay there again when we go for our holiday in Manila.

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: It was extremely pretty!
content:
5 star for the Garden
2 Star for the lack of restaurant. 

Maybe I just had a different expectation.  I planned to go there do some photography with our daughter in her dress and then have lunch in the middle of the garden and then...have a coffee in a little cottage. I do hope they'll do this kind of thing. I know everyone is focused on instagram worthy places but I might be one of those who prefer good food, good place and good coffee.

But the place was wonderful.

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: The Art of Doing Nothing
content: My best friends and I had a weekend escape at the Sonya's Secret Garden. We usually go here to eat their healthy lunch buffet. It was our first to stay and it was a very pleasant experience. The accommodation includes the buffet for  lunch or...dinner and breakfast! The food was very sumptuous. We loved the chocolate cake and the turon. They have the "Art of Doing Nothing" activities for the guests such as garden trip, floral arrangement classess, yoga etc.

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: Breakfast at the garden
content: The ambiance of the secret garden is just perfect after a long drive from manila. Just relaxed while having breakfast at the garden

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: Unique meal
content:
Must try even once in your tagaytay trip. This is a unique place , a big garden where you can stay overnight, have spa and have a salad meal. 
They offer buffet salad course at P685 per pax ( salad, pasta, salmon , bread ,...tea, juice  ) and ala carte meals  or group meals . 

Parking is ample.

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: Going for Lunch
content: Though we were not able to have our lunch in this place because they are fully booked, we still enjoyed our visit in the pretty gardens. Place is clean and relaxing. Perfect for weddings and private events.  We hope we can go back to Cavite...and visit this place again.

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: Everything was perfect!
content: Beautiful surroundings, delicious food, and great service for a fair price. We will return as often as we can.

name: Sonya's Secret Garden
title: Lunch at Sonya‚Äôs
content:
This place is soooooo relaxing. I can still remember the calming scent on the place‚Äô entrance...scent of lavander... Plants and flowers all over makes the it more restful.

The pasta, salad and dessert buffet is a must try. 
You can eat much without getting bloated..hehe.....(or its just what i felt by that time). 
I love the mint leaves over my choco cake for dessert.

I‚Äôd tried their massage service a few years ago; and its more than OK.
Relaxing and Revitalizing. Love the aroma. ü•∞

I love everything about this place.
Maybe, on our next visit we‚Äôll book for bed and breakfast. üòâ 

Best time to visit: November, December or January I think; the weather‚Äôs not to hot and a lesser chance to rain.

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: Awesome breakfast experience!
content:
Had a good time at this place.
-  The place looks very nice and has a relaxing vibe.
- Food is good.  Price is a bit on the high side, but so is the quality.  Plating was excellent. Longganisa was good.  Sunny side up eggs...we're cooked just the way I like it. 
-  Service provided by Andrew was excellent.  He was very friendly and enthusiastically answered our questions.  You can tell that he loves his job.  He also offered to replace our coffee when my wife mentioned that it was already cold when our food arrived.  (coffee was served hot early, but was already cold when our food arrived)

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: Hidden Destination Gem in Tagaytay
content: Really yummy Indian Food! Big servings!  Waiter Christian superb service!  Ambiance very homey and nice and clean! Definitely worth trying!

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: Lunch out in a beautiful garden resto
content: Good place. Not crowded. Food is excellent and staff is very accomodating! Celebrated my daughter‚Äôs birthday here. It was a quiet and happy lunch :)

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: Hidden Gem in Alfonso, Cavite
content:
This place offers one of the best customer service we have ever experienced. Andrew, our server, was very kind and he even took care of our furbaby! He really knows how to take care of the customers - humans or even dogs! 

Food is amazing...and the ambience of this place is perfect for those who wants to have a nice, peaceful meal. 

This place might be a little far from the usual hang out spots in Tagaytay, but we definitely would recommend it. Also, if you‚Äôre looking for a place where you can work remotely this place is great too as they offer free WiFi.

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: Pet friendly, good food
content:
The food is delicious. Nice ambiance.
The place is pet friendly and not discriminating towards big dogs which i appreciate.Andrew our server is very friendly and accommodating  he even asked if my dog needed water and gave him free bread too! 
Highly recommended

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: Lequestria Review Mother's Day
content: Great food, nice ambience, peeps are very friendly. I would recommend the Biryani and Croissants. Good for gatherings and business meetings.

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: New Gem in Alfonso
content: New gem in Alfonso. We ordered laksa and biryani and both were yummy. I also got their coffee caramel cake and it was heavenly. Will go back to try their other dishes‚Ä¶.

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: Great food, service and ambience!
content:
Our second time eating here since it opened, their menu has improved and they added a variety of dishes. Still, the service, food and ambience didn't disappoint us. We love their pastries especially the donut looking eclair one in the photo. We also enjoyed their...fresh salad and the grilled meats were cooked to perfection! My fave was the beef kebab.
Thank you to our server Andrew who made our experience even more memorable.

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: Taste of the worlds
content:
We went this place because my wife wanted to try when she saw it in instagram. We got there around 7pm, ordered then got served quite quickly. The staff were very nice and accomodating. The place and ambiance is so nice to chill.

Food wise,...the menu is still limited but has variety offers from different cuisines such as french, indian, american as the ones i can recall. We ordered ravioli, pizza margerita and the meat platter with biryani rice and was delicious. It's pricier than average prices in Tagaytay scenery given the serving volume. We also tried the cupcakes and was not the best there is.

I'd definitely recommend the place!

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: Awesome food and ambiance
content: My family had lunch here in lequistria. We had Mediterranean meat grill and pizza and it was so tasty, I never tasted like this before, it was superb. Surely we will come back again in this restaurant.

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: Instagramable but pricey
content:
The place was very nice, definitely instagramable...people are friendly and location is easy to find. 
Food was limited and very expensive and serving is very small...imagine bbg liempo cost 650 pesos (2 small PC., a small bowl of rice and small bowl of laing)... Mixed...sea food cost the same containing 2 shrims, 3pcs squid rings, a 2 inch tuna, cooked in gata with banana blossom.
Hope they can have better food selection and more affordablw

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: Best pet friendly resto cafe
content: Had been going to this cafe for sometime already. The place is very nice, clean, and beautiful. The staff are wonderful too. The food is awesome too! Very delicious. The best part is, they are truly pet friendly resto. Any size and breed is welcome....The staff even remembers my dog's name!! üòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅ Their croissant is the best I had ever tasted.

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: nice resto
content:
love it here
will definitely come back 
rib eye steak a bit pricey but so good
i like tye vibe of the resto

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: Lequestria first timers
content:
The staff are accommodating. The food is great and the ambiance is great too. 

It is also pet friendly which is a big plus for us dog owners.

name: Lequestria Cafe and Restaurant
title: l‚Äôequestria is the best!
content:
great food & amazing staff. the ambience is also nice. 

bonus points for being pet friendly, too! 2nd time here & will definitely return ^^

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: Antonio's Bfast Experience..
content:
Come early if you want to get seated immediately.
Plan your orders before arriving so you can give them to the staff after getting seated. Serving may take a while if the place is already full.
The basket of bread was good, but a little...expensive (350) because it was just maybe 2 pandesal, 2 loaves of bread, some stick bread, and some jam&butter.
If you order sausages with your pancakes, make sure to check if it's cooked well once your it's served because ours was not. 
If the weather's not that cold or too hot, don't agree to get seated on their garden area. There's lots of mosquitos too in the garden. Their garden area could be improved to get your money's worth because you're paying for meals that are extra pricey (e.g. extra sunny side up is more than 100 if I recall it right.
When you order coffee, make sure to inform the server you want it served hot, not luke warm. My capuccino was just warm, almost same with the weather that day. Again, maybe because the serving takes a while that's why food arrives not too hot/warm.
My kid didn't like the breaded chicken that we ordered with his waffle. But he really liked the pandesal (if it was a pandesal) in the basket of bread.

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: Good but overhyped
content: Spruced up, looks good, lots of people, nice vibe. Service starts good then declines, had to do follow-ups for the dessert and the bill. Huge plates, heavy utensils, food's average. They lost their view of the lake but is surrounded by trees so not so...bad.

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: Long wait for soso food
content: Went to magnolia branch. Wow at 10:00 we were 6th on the list. Had to kill time at the mall first. Why the hype ? The place was small for its name and media hype status. We were called in after 1 hour. It was...a fervent wish thats why i cant whine about the choice. I had the adobo. Soso. Pancake house is better. My brother had the freah corned beef which was ok. Another had tapa. Just so. Another had the beef ribs which was humingous but i did not try it. Over all i would have gone  somewhere else for brunch. The crew however were very attentive to the titas of manila crowd. The bread and piaya were very good though. The food for its price: soososo

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: Waiting Game for Good Food
content: It is not my first time in this popular all day breakfast place. Still the homey ambiance. Extensive Menu . Breakfast place that serves lunch and early dinner. But it is a waiting game , for your turn to be seated and provided a table....This takes 30 minutes to one hour . Then once seated , takes at least 30-40 minutes to get your order. However, errors ( even when double checked) happen. Such as missed orders. Anyway it was not bad returning back to this place. From beef steak, pizzas , Spanish sardines and corned beef hash. Even ice cream.

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: Great Family Outing
content: Great service and outstanding food!!! We had a large (15) family gathering on a Saturday morning.  Fully expecting wait 60 minutes or more‚Ä¶less than 30 minutes they opened the patio to accommodate our family!! 15 separate orders all taken without a mistake and served to...perfection!! Our 3 waiters were on top of everything‚Ä¶.and the food was amazing!! We topped that off with a breathtaking view of Lake Kaal and the Kall volcano from our table. A simpleton perfect morning!!

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: Tagaytay Breakfast with Family
content: Good food.. good service.. the ambience of the restaurant was also good. Just come early 'cause we're on que for 35 mins. But worth the wait anyway.üòä

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: Highly recommended for a casual meal
content: We went during the week for an early dinner, when we arrived the restaurant was pretty much empty and when we left it was a bit busier. The ambiance and view is nice, there are better views in Tagaytay no doubt, but this restaurant has...its charm. The menu is a bit of everything, breakfast items, salads, pasta, pizza, sandwiches, steaks, Filipino dishes etc. The service team was outstanding, some of the best service we experienced in the Philippines, truly genuine Filipino hospitality, and service as well as food was very quick. We ordered a couple of dishes to share and all were great, I finally found a good croque monsieur in the Philippines. The prices are very reasonable considering food quality, ambiance and service levels, so we will definitely be back.

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: Not recommended
content: We came on a weekday around 330pm‚Ä¶the place was not so busy. We had to scan a QR code that would lead you to a registration form which I filled up but looking back, I shouldn‚Äôt have given so much info because of data privacy....Anyway, we were disappointed with the view because it was covered by plants which could have been trimmed to lessen the obstruction. Again, we had to scan a QR code just to access the menu which is actually inconvenient for those without internet access (good thing i have unli)‚Ä¶we were informed that the food will be served in 20 mins but it came much earlier (they get 1 pt for this)‚Ä¶pasta was so-so, clams were not fresh, tasted eewwww‚Ä¶the pizza was 2/10, the sauce was like the sauce of a popular fast food spaghetti, the crust was made of cheap flour or probably what you can buy from the grocery, ready-made dough (get what I mean?)‚Ä¶we asked for Iced water and it came when we were about to finish our meal..hayyy‚Ä¶the cookies and cream milkshake was not too sweet (another point for them)‚Ä¶i agree with the others, the quality and serving quantity should be equated with the price‚Ä¶all in all‚Ä¶we wouldnt go back here‚Ä¶there are better restos around.

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: good quality food with a commanding view
content: The staff are very efficient and competent. The food is excellent. The view outside is splendid. The place is very popular with the rich folks. Allowing dogs into a restaurant is a big negative.

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: Great food and ambiance (good service)
content: Delicious food (both Western and Filipino) and a beautiful view overlooking the Taal volcano in the distance. Service was a bit slow, but not a big deal since the views were so beautiful.

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: Not so good anymore!
content: A bit frustrated on the quality of foods! It was really good before but from our visit, we did not have good experience. The waffle was cooked too much and even we requested it to be replaced. Hope they can improve the foods, considering the...place is a bit pricey!

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: Delivers on Expectations.
content: This place has had a great reputation for good food and service. Went with family there and they did not fail expectations.

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: Food was good but could be better
content: My Reuben wasn't prepared with Rye bread. My chips lost their crispiness before I could even finish my sandwich. Though the beef was very tender, my husband would have wanted leaner corned beef, less fat to clog his arteries. We did enjoy the atmosphere, attentive...service and general cleanliness. The food was good but could be better.

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: Great food plus nice ambiance
content: We decided to have a road trip last weekend and headed to Breakfast at Antonio‚Äôs. Had a sumptuous breakfast making us really full. Good thing that we arrived at the restaurant early so we don‚Äôt need to wait that long. Recommended!

name: Breakfast at Antonio's
title: Nice for family gathering
content: You have to come early as this place is always fully packed especially on weekends. The early you order, the early you get your food. Price is reasonable, a bit on the high side.

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: GREAT
content: The meals they served was great, It was the perfect venue for a quiet reservation. The staff are so friendly and accommodating‚ò∫‚ò∫‚ò∫

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: What a gem of a find!
content: Tucked on side street somewhere in Tagaytay we just happened to find this gem of a restaurant! Beautiful ambiance, excellent service and The food is world class!  Grilled Fish, Lamb, Pasta and the selection of wine. A must to visit if you happen to come...to the area!  We will definitely come back and bring friends next time!

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: Creepy place at night
content:
We tried this place as it was highly recommended by my sister as she went to visit this place only a few weeks before we actually tried it. We visited this place for dinner and apparently, it was kinda rainy and cold so this gave...us all a chill while walking down the steep aisle going to the restaurant. The place was a bit dark surrounded by small lights here and there and it was surrounded by lush greeneries and other vegetation. We were escorted to our table and room looks like a very old house that has been slightly refurbished to maintain its old look. But personally didnt like the feel as it was kinda creepy that night.

As for the food, it was a set meal intended to be consumed whether you dont feel like eating an appetizer or a dessert for that matter. I ordered the big fat slab of grilled pork chop which was too much for me to finish. The taste was fairly delicious but the serving was indeed generous.

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: Thursday family lunch
content: Very pleasant old farmhouse on the side of a steep hill. Lovely surroundings and open sided restaurant seating area.  Good Mediterranean style menu.  Excellent lamb chops, kebabs ok but lacked deep flavour.  Desserts were awesome. We will certainly be back

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: Just ok!
content: Place is not much good for elders or senior people, since the walkway is a bit inclined and slippery. Foods are good but not exceptional. A bit pricey!

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: Good mediterranean food in Tagaytay City
content: Last time my wife and I dined at Marcia Adams was before we were all  hit by the pandemic. So appropriately, we had to try dining there with health restrictions easing up a bit. It‚Äôs as if the pandemic never came, the staff were still...very courteous and accommodating, food preparation was fast, the food was excellent, and the prices remained reasonable. The place was also spotless and the ambience unparalleled. I‚Äôd recommend the place for family and friends getting together who want good food and great ambiance.

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: Best Greek Restaurant in Tagaytay
content: You need reservation as restaurant is always full. It specializes in special occasion like wedding. It is located along nasugbu road after taal vista. Its motif is European garden type and specialzes in Greek food. The food selection has main dish with appetizer and dessert...package. If you need more expensive type of appetozer or dieesert, you just pay more. Although a bit pricey, the food and service plus ambiance is worth it.

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: A Great Find
content:
What a great find. I've been looking for something other than Antonio's in Tagaytay for a while and this is it.

The setting is absolutely delightful and the staff are very attentive and helpful.

The food is nicely presented and very tasty. It's not an...extensive menu but it's adequate. The same can be said for the winelist.

Just be careful if you're taking some elderly friends or relatives with you as the slope going down to the restaurant is very steep!

Will definitely be coming back here soon.

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: Good food, Good View
content: Had our lunch there last Sunday. The food they served was good, a bit different from the other Mediterranean I had tried. The table they reserved for us was private and was very near mini garden (good while waiting for the meal). Service was good,...all of them followed the min health protocol and was attentive

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: Go for Ambience & View but no for Food
content: This is a quaint/lovely setting with nice views from the right table (hint!). So, if you know how to book your table then the ambience is taken care of - at least during daytime when we went. I wouldn't go there at night. The food...is at best middling (that's generous) and it is whatever you want to call it but not Italian. We were a party of 6 and ordered a variety of mains and  almost all the appetizers and deserts (don't even go there). Exercise caution with the wine list or - much better - bring your own if they allow corkage. The prices are such that we left disappointed by the food quality but we didn't feel we were taken advantage of by price/value proposition of food. Bottom line: if the food quality were to match the atmosphere this could be a nice all-around experience but, as is, it isn't for me.

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: Magical night at Marcia Adams - A Tuscan Italian restaurant in Tagaytay
content:
We arrived here on a Tuesday night for dinner without any reservation and it just opened around 5pm. We walked inside and kept taking some pictures, then we ask for some seats to eat dinner. This place is instagrammable - because every room or corner...you go to tells a different story of the moments I experienced here. No kidding! The food is very good here and was kind of surprised of the Tuscan pork chop I got with my meal. The food is very good with the lettuce chips served with tzatziki yogurt dip, then I had mango kiwi pavlova. Then we shared a guyabano fizz - yummy in my tummy!
I liked the trinkets and the ambiance is magical. It was on a blue sunset in Tagaytay. Everything created a magical night and enjoyed every moment of it. Staff were excellent and the waitress took some pictures for us. Food was very good! Ambiance is what it speaks here and it created a magical night. I suggest you go here on the evening, and you will be amazed!

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: Delighted
content: We arrived in the early evening of 2nd January without a reservation. We sat at a large table and were welcomed. The atmosphere was relaxed and the pace slow but measured. I immediately recognised the appreciation of beauty everywhere. Quilted chair seats, hand made napkins,...flower arrangements. The menu involves selecting three courses for the price of the main meal. What a brilliant idea to encourage us to eat properly! The dishes were a feast for the eyes as well as the palate. Yes, a minimum price approx ¬£11 for a three course meal - that is very reasonable - and it is quality rather than quantity. An option at this price: tzatsiki with lettuce crisps, chicken kebabs, pannacotta. Lots of options on the menu that I would try in the future when I return (in daylight). There are several dining areas and some delightful niches with tables in the gardens.

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: Good access from twin lakes
content:
We were looking for the restaurant near Twin Lakes. The restaurant is good to access from twin lakes without traffic jam..And their atmosphere and food is great! We enjoyed our time here :)  The place has a garden and photogenic!  
„ÉÑ„Ç§„É≥„É¨„Ç§„ÇØ„Çπ„ÅÆËøë„Åè„Å´ÊªûÂú®„Åó„ÅüÁÇ∫„ÄÅÁæéÂë≥„Åó„ÅÑÊñôÁêÜ„ÅåÈ£ü„Åπ„Çå„Çã„ÅäÂ∫ó„ÇíÊé¢„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åü„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„ÅÆ„ÄÅ‰∫∫Ê∞ó„ÅÆ„ÅäÂ∫ó„ÅØÈÅì„ÅåÊ∑∑„Çì„Åß„ÅÑ„Å¶„Ç¢„ÇØ„Çª„Çπ„Åó„Å•„Çâ„Åã„Å£„Åü‰∏≠„ÄÅ„Åì„ÅÆ„ÅäÂ∫ó„ÇíË¶ã„Å§„Åë„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÈßêËªäÂ†¥„Åã„Çâ‰∏≠„Å´ÂÖ•„Çã„Å®„Åù„Åì„Å´„ÅØÁ¥†Êïµ„Å™Á©∫Èñì„ÅåÂæÖ„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„ÅüÔºÅÂÜÖË£Ö„ÇÑ„Ç¨„Éº„Éá„É≥„Åå„Å®„Å¶„ÇÇ„Åã„Çè„ÅÑ„Åè„ÄÅÈ£ü‰∫ã„ÇÇ„Å®„Å¶„ÇÇ„Åä„ÅÑ„Åó„Åã„Å£„Åü„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„ÅÇ„Åæ„ÇäÁõÆÁ´ã„Åü„Å™„ÅÑ„Å®„Åì„Çç„Å´„ÅÇ„Çã„Åã„Çâ„Åã„ÄÅÂ∫óÂÜÖ„ÇÇÊÖå„Åü„Å†„Åó„Åè„Å™„Åè„ÄÅÈùô„Åã„Å´„ÇÜ„Å£„Åè„Çä„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åó„Åü:)

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: A great evening
content:
The food was just great. I haven't eaten yet something amazing like this in the Philippines. See you soon again
Thank you

name: Marcia Adams Restaurant
title: Nice place - food not so much
content:
We visit the restaurants for lunch
We were the only couple in the restaurants
Vary good and professional service
But you need to order minimum 3 course per a person
The food was average at best
Cost for 2 around 2500 peso
At that price...Will not return

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: Experience at Cirila's
content: I'm disappointed with this place. Rating was 5 star but it is not. Place is fine. Staff is not well groomed and not trained yet. It took 50 minutes to serve our order. Food was nothing to rave about.

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: A Great Breakfast Experience
content:
Food and service are very good! Met the owner, Ate Medi, and she was a gracious host.
Restaurant highly recommended. BMW bikes on display for bike aficionados, while for painting enthusiasts, Ate Medi's works are displayed in the dining area for your enjoyment. (Paintings not...for sale, though.)

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: The food and services at Nanay Cirilas Restaurant were super delightful!
content:
I finally visited Nanay Cirilas' KAPENG BARAKO, a Filipino restaurant! 

I arrived with my sister and niece during lunch time. We decided to look around outside the restaurant and WOW! I loved the motorcycle display, and the garden was beautiful. It felt so tropical. When...I walked inside the restaurant, I felt homey right away. The place was so clean, and the table arrangement and the decorations were breathtaking. 

We were greeted with a friendly welcome, and the host led us to our table. When the food was served, we all wanted to chow down right away because the food looked  vibrant and cooked to perfection! I had to take pictures! The waiter was always there to make sure we had everything we needed. The food was delicious, and desserts were irresistible.

This was overall the best food and desserts experienced I had. The atmosphere of the restaurant was clean, cozy, and comforting. 

A million thanks to the attentive head chef Medi and staff for their utmost service. I will highly recommend Nanay Cirilas restaurant to all my family and friends. I will definitely be coming back here soon!

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: Very cozy ambiance and very good dishes!
content:
This place is a house converted into a restaurant. It is run by the daughter-in-law of Nanay Cirila (after whom the place is named), who used to own just a simple caf√©. She is also the head cook of the place.

This restaurant is very...cozy and it serves very good, home-style dishes. No walk-in diners are allowed for now. Thus, reservation is required, as well as pre-ordering of food and drinks. To reach the place (which is not along the Tagaytay-Nadugbu main road), it is best to use Waze or Google map.

We tried some of its recommended dishes (such as bulalo, kalderetang baka, kare-kare, sinaing na bangus, fried tawilis, grilled prawns with salted eggs and baked tomatoes, pancit, and desserts) and everything was great! Service was also very friendly. Thumbs up!

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: Great Place, Excellent Food
content:
We were searching for places to celebrate my mom's 60th birthday and this popped up. The place is very intimate and homey. Chef Medi was very easy to talk to. We gave minimal instructions on the chalkboard and cake and it turned out absolutely lovely!...Our surprise was a success because of the the staff's cooperation as well. (Thank you kuya!) I was a bit nervous if my mom's surprise guests will be satisfied with the food and ofcourse like the reviews, it did not disappoint! 

We ordered 6 different ulams, everything was delicioso! We asked if we could add additional bulalo for the other side of the table, I thought it would not be allowed but thankfully it arrived after 5 minutes. 

The sinaing na bangus was dissected by the seniors and said they wanted to try cooking it Chef Medi's way because it was delectable.

Their signature dish Nanay Cirila's Bulalo was refreshingly healthy, my mom said "tinanggal yung sebo, ganun dapat pagluto." 

Thank you Chef Medi and the ate's and kuyas, we had a wonderful time. The place is beautiful and the foods are just mouth watering. Definitely recommend this place! Just book in advance

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: Without a doubt, a 5-star rated restaurant.
content: I‚Äôm from the United States and have eaten at some of the finest restaurants around the world. Nanay‚Äôs is an exceptional fine dining restaurant in a warm contemporary setting. It‚Äôs the truly the best restaurant in Tagaytay, and probably even the Philippines. The food, the...experience exceeded our expectations. Thank you Medi and Ray. Wow !!!! A++++++ 5 star ‚≠êÔ∏è PS, this restaurant deserves a Michelin rating.

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: Filipino Foodie Heaven
content: I always look forward to eating Filipino cuisine when I go visit family in  the Philippines. Nanay Cirila's did not disappoint because everything we ordered was authentic.  I would say that it's a very personalized experience when chef/owner Medi welcomed us and checked on us...at the culmination of our dinner. Very happy we chose to dine here and would highly recommend ! 5‚≠êÔ∏è

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: Laid back and super food
content: Visited here with my family, extended fam, and some friends. Food was not your ordinary restaurant style and taste. It was very homie and flavorsome. Very neat and organize. The chef was very accommodating as well as the staff. Looking forward to be back soon.

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: Best restaurant in tagaytay
content: The must visit resto in tagaytay ‚ù§Ô∏è foods are    Delicious, the place is so beautiful and clean. The people are so welcoming and the chef is beautiful and kind.

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: Shhh...bukas na sila ng 07june2021
content: This is the one place in tagaytay i could call home. The way chef Med treats you is like yau are a long lost beloved family member. The food will make you stay and the experience would make you never want to leave. See you...soon chef. Save us a seat.

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: Homey and gracious
content: Uber hospitable.  Thanks again to our chef, Medi and her staff.We had a quiet and hearty anniversary lunch and they knew just when to let us be, and when to intervene for service.  So much more on the menu to try and possibly share with...more of the family.  Thanks too for the thoughtful note greeting us on our 36th year.  Tawilis and barako, raindrop cake...atbp.Hits the spot.

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: Home in every bite
content:
One of the best dinners we have ever had!

Now there's another place we can call home in Tagaytay! From the amazing hospitality and culinary passions of Tita Medy, the Chef / Owner, and her Staff -- to the delicious food, Nanay Cirila's Kapeng Barako...will let you feel that every dish is humbly yet passionately made from home. 

It is very special because all the dishes are unique yet the deliciousness are all heartwarming ly familiar. 

We ordered the following:

Appetizer: Butter Shrimps
=Nicely done üëå Shrimps are indeed buttery soft, garlicky but subtle. Ain instant favorite. A must-try!

Beef: Bulalo
=One of the best I've tasted! Not a single bit of that oily or ma-sebo soup. They patiently remove the oily stuff so all you get is the tenderest beef and most flavorful broth. With fresh veggies too! Yum! Theirs is the only Bulalo we will eat from now on.

Pork: Grilled Liempo
=Another hit!  Soft and just the right balance of flavors/seasoning. And the "ihaw" taste is right. You know they grilled it using good firewood, (not with kerosene or plastic!). 

Fish: Crispy Daing na Bangus
=Fresh, well seasoned, crispy and no "gilik" taste. Just the way you want your bangus to be. 

Veggies: Fresh Lumpia Gulay
=Joy!!! Just JOY! The generous vegetables inside this Lumpia with it's peanuty sauce will make you smile! One order is not enough!

Dessert: Halo-Halo
=There's a special twist that i would like to share but you better discover this by yourself. The Ube Ice Cream is good, but the "twist" elevates it to an "Aha! That works fabulously!" experience.

Beverages: Hot Tarragon Herb Tea & Brewed Iced Tea with Calamansi
=Nothing artificial here. They are all natural, all fresh.

Truly a gem in Tagaytay! 

Do contact them and discover the flavors for yourselves! And a wonderful chat with Tita Medy makes everything heartwarming. I'm so happy to have met her and now call her a friend.

Special Info:
*Pre-booking and pre-ordering is required. Check their website for all your needed details (Menu, Address, etc.) Check also Google Maps and/or Waze for driving instructions.
And you're in for an amazing treat: a display of Harleys! Bring your cameras!

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: The best place to eat in tagaytay!
content:
we went to visit this fine establishment last sunday and we were blown away by the food. 

We ordered the Bulalo Lunch Set and it was more than enough for my family.

The bulalo meat was so tender and soft that the knife just went...through it like butter, very delicious.

The vegetable springrolls was so crisp and fresh, that the flavours just burst through with each bite.

Chef medi was so friendly and inviting that she rounded out the experience to perfect.

If your looking for a good place to eat and relax, look no further than Nanay Cirilas!

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: Traditional Comfort Food with a Twist
content: Very intimate and private. Good place to take visitors üòä the seafood platter is very yummy and fresh üëå

name: Nanay Cirilas Kapeng Barako
title: Our daughter's 1st Birthday
content:
We celebrated our daughter's 1st birthday at Nanay Cirilas last November 17, 2018 and it was an amazing experience with our family and friends. The place is so homey, the food is great , the staffs are very accomodating. Special thanks to Chef Medi for...all the preparation (from the decoration,charkart and the food). Thank you for allowing us to use your guest room for our babies.
Best to dine here with family and friends. I highly recommend this place. Looking forward to dine again.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Not available
content:
Want a Japanese beer? Not available. Want a sake? Not available. Want a milk tea? Not available. Want air conditioning? Not available. Want an avocado, mango or watermelon smoothie? Not available. 

Was honestly shocked they bothered opening today.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Nice place
content:
Not really impressed with the food.  
If you order the katsu curry mild they sweeten it way too much so it's not made fresh, just a spicy version they sweeten.  First time it came out the curry was cold, so they are just heating it...up and not even good at that.  Very Pricy too!   There are better places to eat at Twin Lakes.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Lunch
content: We enjoyed all the dishes.  The rainbow Maki was awesome as was the  salad, tempura, and ebi sushi. No disappointments at all which is always a bonus. Will be  returning  soon.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: WORST RESTAURANT EVER, DO NOT GO
content:
Waited for freaking 1 hour and 30 mins just to receive my chicken curry thats not even freaking hot or warm 
Doesnt even taste like good curry 
7% service charge for the worst service and said that they had "traffic sa kitchen" - you have...a lot of tables to offer and you cant serve them all? Wow lol 
Had a big freaking menu of what coffee they serve and they didnt even have coffee lol

Went there thinking itd be good because of their Trip Advisor reward in 2020 LOL SO QUESTIONABLE

-1000 /10 WILL NOT RECOMMEND
DO NOT GO EVER

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Nice Japanese Resto in Tagaytay
content:
Food was good. Pricewise and taste is excellent. Auzora Salad was a good  twist on your regular crabstick salad.
Chicken teriyaki was very tasty, shrimp tempura was good..only downside was the mix sashimi. It didn't taste well, the salmon i think was a different cut...of the fish as it was chewy. But the variety is ok..
Nice japanese restaurant when your in Tagaytay that's not overcrowded.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Good food but a bit pricey
content: They offer great food, although a little pricey. Courteous staff and good ambiance. Great location too.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Sad experience
content: Soggy and sad and made our family supper stressful. That‚Äôs how I will describe my experience in Aozora. I guess my expectations were set high since I‚Äôve been reading about the good reviews. The Aozora ramen is bulalo with noodles, nothing to be crazy about.Fod...is average. The wagyu steak is pricey but the way it‚Äôs cooked was mediocre- a waste of ingredients.

name: Aozora Japanese Restaurant
title: Dog food presentation; Flavor is not Japanese
content:
Aozora SVD Road WAS very good until recently.   Today was my third time.   Two months ago I already noticed the food quality and service was different.   I gave it another chance, and today was the third time.   The food was lousy, presentation was like dog...food, the staff were not attentive, the portion size was smaller, and it is not Japanese at all.
