title: Review for TSOKOLATERIA
content: Their outside dining has a very nature feel to it plus it has a beautiful view of the Taal Lake. I like how you can order from both the menus of Tsokolateria and Hawaiian BBQ. We had a Sunday breakfast and we enjoyed the food...selection of Tsokolateria. I particularly liked the Cebu style crispy bacon with black rice. The banana waffle churos can actually be a full meal in itself unless you intend to share it as a dessert somehow between maybe four people. Service was pretty adequate and their staff was attentive. Price point is okay too. Would come back when I'm in town again.

name: The Original Hawaiian Bar-B-Que
title: NEVER disappointing
content:
I've eaten here twice, great ambiance, fast service, not that pricey (most items are good for 2), got to try both menus:

1. Hawaiian menu (4 stars)
-you gotta order their hawaiian iced tea!
-ribs are super tender; just a bit too sweet for my...taste
-their baked potato is heaven
-noticed that their menu items are rich and indulgent so order something acidic to balance things out

2. Tsokolateria menu (5 stars)
-savory items infused w/ chocolate
-ingredients are simple but well thought out
-pictures show pinoy caprese, creamy kesong puti soup, lechon kawali w/ organic rice
-food looks rich but its actually light
-can't wait to eat here again!

name: The Original Hawaiian Bar-B-Que
title: I love Ribs!
content: I ordered food good for 2 as i am with my husband (ribs and onion rings). Food was very well presented. The taste of ribs- smokey and sweet (but not too sweet). Onions ring- heavy battered, fail,fail, fail. Nothing much different with the food in...Manila, but with a view and good ambiance.

name: The Original Hawaiian Bar-B-Que
title: Romantic date place to dine
content:
We asked if the food are good for sharing, they mentioned they are good for 2. But when the orders arrived, they are actually good for 3! We ordered tacos, baked potatoes, and baby back ribs. We loved all of it!

The venue is housed...by The Boutique Bed and Breakfast. On the ground floor is one restaurant venue that is actually of two different restaurants/menu: Hawaiian and Tsokolateria. We tried their native hot chocolate and it didn't disappoint our expectations. :)

name: The Original Hawaiian Bar-B-Que
title: Barbeque Heaven!
content: Hawaiian Barbeque has been a favorite of our kids...whenever we visited Tagaytay this is a must visit for lunch!  They love the tranqulity of the ambiance...clean tables, chairs and table-set up.  Food is always delectable.  Your meal will never go wrong with Hawaiian Barbecue.  Pineapple...fried rice, spam and fries, they're chicken with mango salsa, and the most delish of all the original Barbeque ribs! with a fresh buko juice you'll never go wrong!

name: The Original Hawaiian Bar-B-Que
title: Sulit to the max
content: Nice view, good atmosphere and most of all delicious food and courteous staff (Hi Jean and Abet!). Loved it . will come back pa more.

name: The Original Hawaiian Bar-B-Que
title: BBQ lovers heaven
content: The pork ribs are to die for but everything was just fantastic great friendl service and good prices good enough for the well off traveller and the budget traveller just so nice

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: Nothing beats eating bulalo in Mahogany Market
content: We are at the source  of bulalo meat! It cant get fresher than this. Plus, we can brag we were adventurous and ate at a public market. Bulalo and Tawilis are a must. If you want additional dishes, try the crispy shrimps and crispy mushroom....Ubos!! :)

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: DON'T EAT AT LEN'S KITCHEN -NOT WORTH IT!!!
content: Me and my husband had a worst dining experience in here, particularly in üÖªüÖ¥üÖΩ'üÜÇ üÖ∫üÖ∏üÜÉüÖ≤üÖ∑üÖ¥üÖΩ. With a butterfly tongue and good sales talk we're encouraged to sit and try their Kare-Kare and Crablets!  One of the lady crew's kept on saying "malaman po" & "masarap"....Upon checking the menu,  Kare-Kare worths ‚Ç±250 and same with crablets‚Ç±250. Orders were served but we're suprised!! Their kare-kare serves in a very small bowl, with little amount of vegetables and small cuts of "tiwalya" and "skins" (it's a tiny small cuts-as in manipis at walang buong laman, 4-5 cuts na parang tira-tira!!) Taste wise? Lasang luma at walang lasa!!. If I would describe it, I'd rather buy in our local Carenderia that worths ‚Ç±60 with a huge meat. I called  the crew and asked her "Is this really ‚Ç±250?" and at the back of my mind ito na yun?? We feel like we were scammed , promise! Crablets tasted old too. Guys don't be a victim of this bogus eatery at mahogani market. Magsisisi kayo..

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: Its worth going
content: We went here for dinner and we enjoyed a well prepared and served meal for our group of 10. Our whole group walked away full and contented with our choices. Of course Bulalo was part of the package we chose. The whole set-up is good...considering where it is. Me being a foreigner, stood out among the crowd. And if you are a foreigner and you go here, just be warned that a abattoir/slaughterhouse is beside the eatery.

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: Quality food,affordable price
content: Good service, good food. We ordered bulalo, half orders of tawilis and crablets ( we were only 2). We came 9 a.m. to avoid the crowds.

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: When in Tagaytay... Len's Kitchen!
content:
I have been to Tagaytay a lot of times, dined at different restaurants, and ordered bulalo every single time. For the past 5 years, and to this date, we still go back to Len's Kitchen at the Mahogany Market Eateries. There are other eateries lined...next to one another but we recommend Len's Kitchen. Not only do you get a full-service experience, but the staff is more than friendly. They are like family members inviting you to eat in their homes. After so many years, we finally met the owner today and she is a lovely and wonderful person, too.

To be honest, you would want to appreciate that the way they serve their bulalo meat. They are in bite sizes, easy to serve among your friends and family, and easy to consume. I also found out that they also take their customers' feedbacks seriously when they started serving the bone marrow (taba) separately so others who are on the "health-conscious" side, and you can simply ask one of the staff for the bone marrow which they will serve separately. 

Budget-wise, definitely affordable. To be honest, generally speaking, when talking about the cost to dine, it will actually depend on what you order. We have paid around P700 for 4 people, and sometimes for two (depends on how hungry we all are.. haha). But again, in general, the place is budget-friendly. Free refill of soup and veggies, free coffee after meals, seasonal fruits (when available).

I was told that they also serve breakfast. :)

So when you are in Tagaytay, this is a must-visit!

TOP TIP: I was told they are open 24hours. :) Bulalo-fix whenever you want!

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: price reflects the quality
content: Since I went on a bulalo food trip, Mahogany Market then must be part of the must go to.  To get to the eateries, it is through a steep step of stairs to the 2nd floor, above the butcher/meat section.  From there, is a whole...line of eateries, food court style.  I could see bulalo precooked on display, which is a concern for freshness.  I eventually settled down to one of the eatery and ordered their bulalo.  It was served in like 5 minutes, even though they said they have a new batch.  The meat wasn't that tender, and the soup was plain clear soup with petchay. The bone marrow was breaking apart, which is another sign that is not fresh, and overcooked meat. Cheap price compared to the rows of restaurants along the Tagaytay ridge offering Bulalo, but the flavors were not outstanding, for me.

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: Great place to try out Tagaytay's most famous delicacy, Bulalo
content:
Tagaytay's most famous food item is bulalo, a soup based dish cooked with bone marrow and vegetables. The busy eateries on the top level of the Mahogany market is a great place to have this. You not only get an authentic taste of this local...delicacy, you also get to really experience local life. 
This is a must-do if you are visiting Tagaytay for the first time.

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: bulalo king!!! great service delicious spread
content: the place is open air and well smells of fresh meat. when you go upstairs though where the eateries are, go striahgt to the centre.. where you will find bulalo king. foos was great. bulalo of course fantastic. waiters were helpful and courteous. free coffee...barako at the end of your meal. will definitely eat here again.

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: Great food & great price!
content: The place isn't classy, it's a bit crowded because it's in the market but they serve the best beef shanks which they call bulalo. I also love the crispy mushrooms and tawilis! Even ordered mushrooms to go!lol

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: Not PWD friendly
content: Was not able to have our lunch because this is not a  PWD friendly place. Besides, the smell of market stinks.

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: Family Bonding
content:
we have chosen Moi and Lyleth Eatery as when u arrive there will be a lot to choose from, while walking what made me chose them if the food was just cooked and they have amazing smiling staff

Food - 5/5 as they were able...to maintain the taste of the traditional Filipino food,  not that good in presentation yet the taste was amazing

Venue - 3/5 it is literally carinderia style however cleanliness was fine not dirty. Not so amazing ambiance. 

Pricing - 5/5   just average yet cheaper than restaurants

Staff - 5/5 accomodating and friendly

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: Delicious ‚ÄúBulalo‚Äù Beef soup
content: We enjoyed the food so much aside from enjoying the ambiance of the place and the coldness if the  weather in Tagaytay. You also get to eat free mini bananas called ‚Äúseniorita‚Äù. All the stress in work was gone after eating the specialty called ‚ÄúBulalo‚Äù...or Beef Soup that was freshly bought from the market just below the Restaurants. Will surely recommend this place which is 24hours open.

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: Market, dining and fresh fruits
content: This is one place where you can eat, buy fresh fruits, dried fish all in a day.  When you eat at the restaurants you can eat as much bananas as you can for free.  It comes with the food.  The place is famous for a...soupy dish called "bulalo" with lots of veggies and tiny fish called "tawilis".  Try it when you are in the area...

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: just beef shank, meat is diced boiled in very salty water with pechay only
content:
Just beef shank, meat is diced boiled in very salty water with pechay only.
Waitresses are on the edge of being rude, prices are not clear.
utensils and plates can be cleaner.
free banana is just senorita, and free coffee is too sweet.
they crowded...the tables too much.

name: Mahogany Market Eateries
title: A must try place for food junkies!
content: I was a bit hesitant in eating at this place because I thought that the place is dirty and always filled with people in and around metro tagaytay. But when I started to climb the stairs going up the eateries, I smelled heaven and boom......all my hesitations melted and replaced by anticipation of trying out their gastronomic food choices. We had of course, their famous bulalo, I must say, it was perfect! (we came there on a rainy sunday afternoon so it was a compliment). The meat was so tender and the soup was just the right amount of salt and spice. Then we had crispy tawilis. Gosh! The best crispy tawilis I had! We also had crispy lechon kawili which didn't disappoint me. For only Php800, we had a sumptuous lunch for two and a few chunks of lechon for take out and the bone for our dog.

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: Hidden find
content: Out of the way experience. Very classy but casual. Starters are very good. Servings are large. Hard to find but worth it.

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: Real proper Italian food expertly prepared and delicious... Very large servings, you will not be disappointed.
content:
The title says it all about the food, it really is excellent.
The ambiance is equally inviting and you really could be in a Napa Valley homestead covered garden resto.
Service was excellent, waitress on hand to help with and serve our requests, it was...very quiet when we dined for lunch and that just added to make it a more private feel setting.
I wanted to try their Napa Valley wines but had a drive back to Antipolo after lunch.

We have dined at Antonio's a few times in the past, but we will for sure return here again on our next Tagaytay visit or pass through to/from Nasugbu. This is our new fav place to eat.

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: In love with this place
content: Don Limone Napa Grill, thank you for making our celebration extra special, such delicious & appetising food, warm and welcoming service and a very stunning place altogether made the best and highly satisfying experience for us. we can't wait to visit you again along with...more of our friends and family!

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: Mother‚Äôs Day 2021
content: Whenever i crave for good food I go to Don Limone Napa Grill. The food, the service and most of all the ambiance is just perfect for my taste. I love being at Napa Grill. My go to place whenever we want to celebrate a...special event. Betty is so accommodating and the staff too! More power to you! Ilove your place and will always be my favorite place in Tagaytay

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: Friday Lunch
content: Arrived at 1pm for lunch to a brown out, but no problem, the staff and host all took it in their stride and created a veritable smorgasbord of Persian/Mediterranean delights!

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: Not really a place I‚Äôll recommend.
content: Not really a place I‚Äôll recommend. Food is okay-not bad but not great either. Priced expensive. Portions wouldve been okay but service is also not great. Servers don‚Äôt listen to requests. We had a full plate we asked for take out but they threw it...away. As compensation they gave burnt trimmings of whatever their kitchen had left over to spare - nothing like what we paid for. Worst communication I‚Äôve seen in a decent looking restaurant. Worst recovery service. No one even apologized to us even out of courtesy.  You can try this place for yourself, ambiance is nice. But unfortunate for us we had a bad experience. Good luck!

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: Good food, best limoncello
content: Their main course came with great appetizers of salad, 2 kinds of bread and 3 kinds of dip.  Both the lamb and the beef tenderloin we ordered came with rice and were very tender and tasty.  Their Limoncello is a must order before the meal,...as an aperatif or after the meal, as a digetif.

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: Good but steeply priced
content:
We came here on a double date. We had 2 orders of the lamb shank, grilled tenderloin, and I had the chicken pasta. The shank was too sweet, tenderloin was not juicy (overcooked), but my pasta was soooo good! We all loved our appetizers as...well. Their cheesecakes were similar to New York's Junior's - bit on the heavy side. Their coffee was watered down.

On the upside, the place is really nice. Love the ambiance and its rustic feel. I think we can come back for a date. Quite pricey thiugh -  we paid 5000 for 4pax - with no drinks/wine.

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: Too expensive
content: Php400+ for a slice of cheesecake and coffee is ridiculous. We walked away. Had I known they were only offering a set menu, I wouldn't have gone in the first place.

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: Amazing hidden gem
content:
Tucked away in a kind of neighborhood this place was a brilliant surprise once you got past the very plain looking exterior.  Once inside the grounds I realized this was the nicest most well done Mediterranean style looking restaurant I had been.  Even better than...one I had been to in Crete thst was considered iconic.

This place had good service from a very friendly staff.  It was literally walls of wines to include a kind of cellar chock full of wine.  The place had rooms tucked everywhere for private venues and occasions.

I had the lamb piccata, the wife chicken and the kids a kind of pasta with meatballs.   It was presented very tastefully and it tasted just as awesome.  Hints of lemon was in just about everything.

This is not a cheap place.  Plan to spend 1000p a head.  The service,  ambience and quality of food is worth it.

This is not a casual place like McDonalds or pizza hut.

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: Beautiful Place and Good Food to match!
content: This is not a big place but it is so beautiful!  It would be great for dates. üòä But for us, it was a family dinner that was very much enjoyed!  Very good Mediterranean food.

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: Why is you should go
content:
Most restaurants in Tagaytay serves Filipino food, which is not really a splurge if you are a local. We opt for an adventure instead and chose Don Limone.

We ordered 3 main dishes as we have kids with us. The lamb piccata, beef tenderloin, tia...maria (chicken gorgonzola pasta) was served with appetisers: hummus, pimento and cheese spread, meatballs, moutabal and some bread. The food generally taste good. But if I had one complaint about it, it would be that it was slightly too sweet for me. Ordered the Bailey‚Äôs and chocolate cheesecake. Both were outstanding.

Service is nice and warm. Wine selection is not bad. Will definitely return.

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: Lovely lovely
content:
I love this restaurant!  The chef somehow put a wonderful twist in each dish we ordered, such that I had never tasted them quite that way before.  Somehow, the flavours seem more concentrated - they just burst in your mouth.  We had an assortment appetisers...in generous portions, then our main course, then their famous cheesecake for dessert.  Fresh teas.  Highly highly satisfying.

The only downside is that they only accept cash payments (who carries a lot a cash anymore these days?).  And also, there is no wheelchair access.

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: Delicious Mediterranean and Middle Eastern Food
content:
This tucked-away restaurant just off the main road and right across the police station is a gem when it comes to their very tasty Mediterranean and Middle Eastern Fare. Owned by a Filipino and American couple who lived in the Middle East for many years,...you can taste the authenticity in their dishes through their complex use of herbs and spices. I had the Lamb Shank and relished that it was garnished with lots of fresh tarragon, this herb goes so well with Roasted Lamb. 

The place is open but certain parts are being renovated to give way to a wine cellar. 

A plus for us was that it was dog friendly.

We will be back!

name: Don Limone Napa Grill
title: Don Limone, Not a Lemon but...
content:
Don Limone is tucked in off the busy Tagaytay-Nasugbu Highway. It's inside the Benitez Compound. It could be in your friendly neighborhood.

The food is chiefly Mediterranean cuisine. And it's good.

The garden makes you feel so relaxed; it  makes the restaurant an excellent place...for bonding, family quality time. The murals especially the "Angels" and "Creation " are admirable works.

But, alas, the restaurant seems not much patronized probably because its offerings are a bit pricey. And we went there at a time when the people there were busy preparing for its transfer to Metro Manila.
